articles.title: Transition to 1Core Webinar (July 9, 2020)
Changing account details
articles.description:
Update your account details like name, email address, phone number or address, anytime by following these steps:

  1. Select account details from the menu bar.
  2. Click edit icon on the field you'd like to change.
  3. After you’ve added the updated details, click save changes.
  4. Click done after completing all the updates.
  5. You will receive an email from us to verify the changes.

In case you have forgotten your password, click on the forgot password button and follow the instructions there.

Note: Once you verify the updated email details, you can resume your activities on your account.

You will receive an email from us to verify the changes.    In case you have forgotten your password, click on the forgot password button and follow the instructions there.    Note: Once you verify the updated email details, you can resume your activities on your account.

articles.title: Adding a payment method
articles.description:
To set up payment channels on your account,

  1. Select payment options from the menu bar.
  2. Click the add payment method option.
  3. Pick the options from the checklist and fill in the required details.
  4. After you’ve added the details, click save.
  5. Click done once you’ve finished.

Tip: You can always come back and add or delete more options, by following the same steps.

The different payment channels supported at Saul’s are -
  • Google Pay
  • PayPal
  • WePay

Note: We also offer cash on delivery.

articles.title: Alerts on the Program Enrollment Dashboard
articles.description:
Program Enrollment Dashboard has the following three alerts on the page. 


1. Enrolled Children with no program assigned

2. Enrolled Children with only completed program 

3. Enrolled Children with multiple programs assigned





Center With Online ESign Enrollment:



Centers with online enrollment with eSignature will have five alerts. The additional alerts are, 


1. Enrollment pending Director's Signature

2. Enrollment pending Parent's Signature

articles.title: Offering Enrollment to the parent(s)
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. Offering Enrollment to the parent(s)
    • 1.1. New Family Enrollment
    • 1.2. Existing Family Enrollment Offer




1. Offering Enrollment to the parent(s)


You can send program enrollment offers to parents using the 'Sent Enrollment Offer' option on the Program Enrollment page.



1.1. New Family Enrollment


Upon selecting the 'Send Enrollment Offer' button, you will be taken to the 'Send Enrollment Offer' page. You can enroll new families into the center's program using the 'New Family' option on this page.



After selecting the family type, you will be taken to the Parent and Children Info sections of the Family Info page. 



On the program section, fill out the program details (Enrollment Start Date, Child Age Group, Program to Offer, Program Schedule and Assign Classroom). 



Note: On the 'Program' section, you can select the enrollment start date. However, once you have sent the enrollment offer, you cannot edit the enrollment start date using the Children page (only for the first enrollment). You can edit the enrollment start date for subsequent program enrollments.



On the Fees Info, you can configure all the fees for a child (Tuition, Discount, Subsidy billing, etc.,)



You can add a tuition discount using the fixed rate and percentage of the existing tuition amount.



After optimizing the tuition and other fees for the program, you can view the confirmation page before sending the enrollment. 




1.2. Existing Family Enrollment Offer


You can also send enrollment offers to existing families using the 'Existing Family' option on the Send Enrollment Offer. 




The Parent and Child Info will be auto-populated in the respective places. You can also edit the info at this point.



You can configure the Fees, Discount, and Agency on this Fees Page. You can also provide discounts on the Agency Fee using the 'Add Discount' button. 


Using the Fees page, you can also configure the Subsidy status of the family and select the agency details, agency fees, and discount on the agency fees.

 





For Multiple Ledger Family :


Earlier, we discussed the 'Send Enrollment Offer' process for single ledger families (new and existing). Now, let's review the 'Send Enrollment Offer' process for multiple ledger families. 

On the Family Info page, you can select the family type.



For a New Family, you need to enter the parent(s) and child details. You can also configure a family as a split family using the 'Split Family' option.


For an Existing Family, you need to select a family from the 'Select Family' drop down and choose the parent to invite to enroll.



Select the Enrollment Start Date, Child Age Group, Program to Offer, Program Schedule, and Classroom details. 

On the Fees page, you can configure the Fee details of the program.


For the Single Family Payment: The billing and payment will be the sole responsibility of Parent #1.




When Parent Split Payment, they can do that in two ways.

1. Each Parent Makes Full Payment in Alternate Period

2. Parents Split Payment in Each Period



When Parent Splits the payment, you can configure the percentage split of the payment for each parent.




Note : If the center is not enabled with eSignature, then you will be taken to confirm & send page after the Fees page.


If the center is mapped with multiple eSign documents, you will be taken to the Select Enrollment Agreement page after the Fees page.

articles.title: Online Enrollment Flow
articles.description:
1. Online Enrollment Flow Setup


Online Enrollment Flow Setup is an important process of adding additional values such as defining the registration mode, fees & discount details, configuring landing page messages, and registration URL to a childcare program.  


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Online Enrollment Flow 




2. Online Enrollment


On the Online Enrollment tab, you define the enrollment flow of your center, preference recording the Parent Hand Book, configuring existing family change requests, and setting the confirmation email distributions. 


Enrollment Offer (center Initiated): After the parent requested the program, the center processes the request and decides the appropriate action.



Direct Enrollment (Parent Initiated ): Parents will enroll themselves using the URL provided to them directly. 





If your center is configured with a Parent Hand Book using Online Forms Module, then the uploaded Parent Hand Book will be auto-populated when you select the 'Yes' radio button for the 'Allow Parents to Download and Review' option. If not, you need to upload 'Parent Hand Book' using the 'Add ' button


The parent handbook will be displayed on the online enrollment flow based on the enrollment start and end dates.  




2.1. Enrollment Fees

The main aim of the 'Enrollment Fees' tab in the Online Enrollment Flow Setup is to help you create various fees for the program (Registration Fees, Prepay, Security Deposit, and Other Fees) while preparing the enrollment offer. 


Once the parent accepted the enrollment, the fees created here will be moved to the child billing.



Note : Earlier Other Fees didn't have separate billing cycle, it was combined with the regular billing cycle. Now 1Core has configured the Other Fees with separate billing cycle option.



2.2. Discount

1Core has introduced new Discount options which allow you to provide different kinds of discounts to the parents on your programs. 


If the center has any preset discounts in the billing set up those will be auto-populated here. You can use those discounts or you can add new discounts using the 'Add Discounts' option.




2.3. Messages


The Messages tab contains the text editor options of several user messages ( Welcome Message, Program Overview text, Online Application Header text, Acknowledgement text ).


Welcome Message will be displayed on the home page of the landing page from which the parents accept the program enrollment. 



2.4. Enrollment URL


The Enrollment URL tab contains the URL for the online application of the center's program. Parents can use this URL to enroll in a program in the center.

articles.title: Optimizing FTE Value
articles.description:
you can optimize the FTE Value as per your center's policy and the FTE Value criteria can also be optimized for per day valuation. By default, the maximum FTE Value per day is 0.20


For example, if your center policy on FTE value is 0.10 per day and 0.50 per week, then you can optimize that while creating a new program type using the Add Program Type Setup page.  The set FTE value will be auto-populated on the Add New Program page.  


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Types

articles.title: Program Enrollment Dashboard
articles.description:
Program Enrollment Dashboard

The Program Enrollment Dashboard in 1Core is a place where you can view complete enrollment details for your center. The main purpose of this page is to provide a comprehensive understanding of your childcare center's enrollment, including change requests, incoming, enrolled, waitlisted, withdrawn, and declined child records, along with their counts. 

 

Access Path : Center Dashboard > Program Enrollment


Note: Alerts are dynamic and will only be displayed if a child record meets the conditions of the alert. If no child records meet the conditions, the alert section will not be shown at the top.


Center With Alerts : 

 


Notes :  1.The total count in the Enrolled tab is equal to the total active children count in the children module. 
              2. The total count in the Incoming tab is equal to the total incoming children count in the  children module
              3. The total count in the Withdrawn tab is equal to the total inactive children count in the children module.

You can only delete the child record present under the 'Decline' tab.

articles.title: Registration Flow for New / Existing Parent After Receiving Enrollment Offer
articles.description:
Process for Existing Parent who has Parent portal Account and received an invitation to enroll their child for a new Program:

  • Review Program Info
  • Review Parent info and add any additional details if required.
  • Review Child info and add any additional details if required.
  • Review all the Info entered once again.
  • Create a TAP Account and make any registration fee applicable.
  • Sign the digital document
  • Once after when they complete all these above steps, for an existing parent who already have a parent account, the system will prompt them to login to their account.


Images as follows:

 

 

 

 

 

         

 

 

 

 

Process for New enrollment Registration / Existing parent who does not have a parent portal account after when they receive Enrollment offer invitation:

  • Review Program Info
  • Add all the required info for Parent.
  • Add all the required info for child.
  • Review all the Info entered once again.
  • Create a TAP Account and make any registration fee applicable.
  • Sign the digital document
  • After signing the document, the system will definitely prompt them to create a Password for Family Portal Account.

 

Images as follows:

 

 

 

 

 

 

After when they create a parent account by setting up a password, the system will prompt them to login.

articles.title: Batch Program Update
articles.description:
This function allows the user to update a Program for all the child with in one specific Age Group / Classroom.


Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Functions--->Batch Program Update



The User can update the program as follows:

* Provide a Start Date for the New program

* Provide an End date for the Current Program

* Select the Age Group that needs to be updated and Classroom they would like to assign the children.



                Select the Program you want to transition the children / Choose the Billing cycle


             Select the Children you want to assign to the program



Note: The Director have to verify the amount for Multi-Ledger type families and make changes if required.

            

            Review and Confirm




     Once after the Update, the New Program details will be available under the Child " Program & Billing Page "

articles.title: Revise Child Fee
articles.description: 1Core offer its users to revise child fee for all existing child record anytime after revising the program fee
articles.description_text: 1Core offer its users to revise child fee for all existing child record anytime after revising the program fee

articles.title: Update Revise fee for Already Existing Child Records
articles.description:
Once when the program fee is revised, the system will automatically identify the existing child record, that still have the old fee and will prompt the user to update the revised fee.


If the User wish to update the fee right away, they have to click on " Yes I want to update the revised fee to the enrolled child now" and follow the steps, so that all the existing child will get updated with the new fee.




* Select the Child applicable for the revised fee.

* Review the information and confirm.


* The Revised billing can be viewed under Child's Program & billing page.

articles.title: How to Add a New Program Type
articles.description:
You can add a new program type using the 'Program Type' option under the 'Program Enrollment' section. Click the 'Add New Program Type' button to add program category, name, timings of the program, and FTE value to a new program.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Program Types



Clicking the 'Add New Program Type' button will take you to the 'Add Program Type Setup' page. 



Program Type Category:


Program Type Category defines the Program's functioning schedule. 


1. Custom Program: In a custom program, you must enter the FTE value. FTE stands for Full-Time Equivalent value. This defines the total hours/days of the functioning of a program. 


2. Regular Program: In a regular program, you must enter the start time and end time of the program and the FTE value.


3. Drop-In Program: In the drop-in program, you need not define the start and end time and FTE value of the program. Because parents are going to be charged based on how many hours their children spend in the childcare center. 


Note: Full-Time Equivalent value is usally 0.20/day. So totally 1.00 for 5 days a week. And you can optimize the FTE value as per your company policy.



Click the 'Save' button to add the new program type.

articles.title: How to Add a Program Policy or Tuition Policy
articles.description:
You can add policies for a program by using the 'Policies' option under the 'Program enrollment' section.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Policies



The policies and acknowledgment text entered here will be shown to the parents at the time of online registration to the program. 


You can view the preview of the entered content by clicking the 'Preview' button. 



Click the 'Save' button to save the program policy/tuition policy.

articles.title: Program Enrollment
articles.description:
1Core allows the childcare centers to create their own Programs via the 'Program Enrollment' option. Program enrollment allows users to manage their program schedules, billings, offers, and discounts. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment


To create a successful and effective program for your center, follow the 'Program Enrollment' creation order as mentioned below,


1. Program Types

2. Policies

3. Program and Fees

4. Other Fees and Discounts

5. Family Portal



Related Articles:

articles.title: How to Add a New Program
articles.description:
1Core allows you to create new programs for the parents. You can create parent centric and market-centric programs using the 'Program and Fees' section of the setup tab.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Program and Fees > Add New Program


Clicking the 'Program and Fees' option will take you to the 'Program Setup' page. Click the 'Add New Program' button to create a new program. 



Clicking the 'Add New Program' button will take you to the 'Add New Program' page.

  

'Add New Program' page has four sections, 


 1. Program Settings 

 2. Program Timings

 3. Current Program Fees

 4. Program Info
articles.description_text: 1Core allows you to create new programs for the parents. You can create parent centric and market-centric programs using the 'Program and Fees' section of the setup tab. Click the 'Add New Program' button to create a new program.           Clicking the 'Add New Program' button will take you to the 'Add New Program' page.      'Add New Program' page has four sections,       1. Program Settings    2. Program Timings   3. Current Program Fees   4. Program Info

articles.title: Add New Program : Program Settings
articles.description:
Program settings in the first section on the 'Add New Program' page. You can use this section to configure the age group, program type, program schedule, and details regarding the enrollments.


 

Fixed Days Schedule:  This option allows you to create a program for specific days of the week.



Flexible Days Schedule: This option allows you to create a program without mentioning the specific day but by a number of days a week condition.



Accept Enrollmentrs now? 


If you press 'Yes', then the program will be available to parents to enroll. 

If you press 'Not Now', then both parents and director cannot enroll the child in the program.


Display this Program to Parent


If you press 'Yes', the program will be displayed to the parents and parents can enroll in this program.

If you press 'Not Now', the program will not be displayed to the parents and only the director can enroll the child in the program.

Flexible Days Schedule: This option allows you to create a program without mentioning the specific day but by a number of days a week condition. articles.title: Add New Program : Program Timings
articles.description:
Program Timings is the sesection of the 'Add New Program' page. You can use this section to configure Program timings.


Who sets the program time? 


Fixed Time by Center: This option allows center directors to fix the timing of the program.


Select Time: 


1. Same Time for All the Days: Choosing this option will make the timing of the program the same for all days in the week. You can select the start and end timings of the program. By default, two-time slots are available for you to select. But you can enter timings in a single slot or you can enter timings in both slots.


2. Different Time for the Days: Choosing this option will make the timing of the program different for different days. By default, two-time slots are available for you to select. But you can enter timings in a single slot or you can enter timings in both slots. 



Parent Should Select Time: This option allows the parents to choose the timings of the program.


Time is Not Required: This option will allow you to create a custom drop-in program without a definite in and out time schedule.
articles.description_text: Program Timings is the sesection of the 'Add New Program' page. You can use this section to configure Program timings.     Who sets the program time?      Fixed Time by Center: This option allows center directors to fix the timing of the program.       Select Time:      1. Same Time for All the Days: Choosing this option will make the timing of the program the same for all days in the week. You can select the start and end timings of the program. By default, two-time slots are available for you to select. But you can enter timings in a single slot or you can enter timings in both slots.     2. But you can enter timings in a single slot or you can enter timings in both slots.         Parent Should Select Time: This option allows the parents to choose the timings of the program.       Time is Not Required: This option will allow you to create a custom drop-in program without a definite in and out time schedule.

articles.title: Add New Program : Current Program Fees
articles.description:
Current Program Fees is the third section of the 'Add New Program' page. You can use this section to configure the effective dates and billing.



Should Parents Prepay for the program? 

If you press 'Yes', then the prepay configure boxes will appear. You need to enter the prepay condition for the program. 


Enabling the prepay condition will make the parents pay a prepay amount at the time of registration.


If you press 'No', then the program won't need any prepay from the parents.

You need to enter the prepay condition for the program.      Enabling the prepay condition will make the parents pay a prepay amount at the time of registration.     If you press 'No', then the program won't need any prepay from the parents.

articles.title: Add New Program : Program Info
articles.description:
You can add a description to your program in the program info section of the 'Add New Program' page.


On the 'Add New Program' page, you can enter the maximum slots allotted for the program that you are creating. 


You can define the program description in the program description text editor.
articles.description_text: You can add a description to your program in the program info section of the 'Add New Program' page.     On the 'Add New Program' page, you can enter the maximum slots allotted for the program that you are creating.      You can define the program description in the program description text editor.

articles.title: Program and Fees
articles.description:
You can create your own programs with customized billing. To create a new program select the ' Program and Fees' option under the Program Enrollment.



Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Program and Fees
articles.description_text: You can create your own programs with customized billing. To create a new program select the ' Program and Fees' option under the Program Enrollment.        Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Program and Fees

articles.title: Other Fees and Discounts Setup
articles.description:
You can add the Registration fee, Security Deposit, and Other Fees to a program using the 'Other Fees and Discounts' page. 


On the 'Other Fees and Discount Setup', you can also collect and store the funding account details of the parents. 



You can add the 'Registration Fee' to the program by selecting the 'Yes' option from the 'Do you collect Registration Fee' radio button.

If you select the 'Yes', the Billing Description and Registration Fee boxes will appear. 

 


You can also add a security deposit to your program by selecting the 'Yes' from the Security Deposit radio button.


You can define your security deposit amount by two options. Either you can define the security deposit amount by the percent of tuition fee or you can enter a fixed amount.



 


Fees other than the tuition, registration fee, and security deposit are termed as 'Other Fees' and you can add these fees by using the 'Other Fees'button from the 'Other Fees and Discounts setup' page.

If you select the 'Yes', the Billing Description and Registration Fee boxes will appear.           You can also add a security deposit to your program by selecting the 'Yes' from the Security Deposit radio button.     You can define your security deposit amount by two options. Either you can define the security deposit amount by the percent of tuition fee or you can enter a fixed amount.              Fees other than the tuition, registration fee, and security deposit are termed as 'Other Fees' and you can add these fees by using the 'Other Fees'button from the 'Other Fees and Discounts setup' page.

articles.title: 1Core QR Code (Touchless) Sign in/Sign out User Guide
articles.description:
Introduction:

 

1Core introduces a touchless (QR Code based) sign in/out solution option so the parents can use their 1Core Family app to sign in and out at the center without touching any public surfaces. 

  QR Code (Short for Quick Response Code) is a two-dimensional barcode that is readable built-in scanner in all modern smartphones. 

To use the touchless (QR Code) sign in/out in 1Core, you must do the following:

Provider must download the 1Core Attend app

  • 1Core Attend in the Apple app store
  • 1Core Attend app in Google Play


Note: 1Core Attend app is for the center to serve as a sign-in/out kiosk. It is NOT meant for parents or staff to download.   

line

Invite the parents to download the 

  • 1Core Family in the Apple app store
  • 1Core Family app in Google Play


Important Note: If your center has not invited the parents to register for a Family Portal account before, you must send out the Family Portal invitation by email so the parents can  register for a 1Core Family Portal account first. Once the parents have registered, they can use the same login credentials (user email + password) to login to the 1 Core Family App.  

To invite the parents to register:  Communication--->Send Family Portal Invitation Email


                                     



1Core Attend App as Sign In/Out Kiosk:

With the QR Code option enabled, when you login to the 1Core Attend App, you will see the QR Code for your center.  There are 2 options:

                  QR Code Only                                                 QR Code and ID Code                                                                                                                                                                  

             



You can refresh the code manually anytime by selecting Refresh QR Code.


                                                

                   
 

 

QR Code Backend Setup and Printing:

Once the QR Code feature is enabled for your center, the Director will be able to access the setup and printing option: 

Access Path: Center Dashboard --->Functions--->Time and Tracking--->QR Code for Attendance

Beside using the QR Code on the 1Core Attend app, you also have the option to print the QR Code for your center and place it at a place (e.g. door or clipboard) where the parents can scan using their 1Core Family App.

 

Select this to print QR Code for your center:


               

Note: If you choose to use the Print option, please note by default the QR Code is set to regenerate DAILY.  If you don’t plan to print a new QR code for your center daily, you should change the QR code generation frequency to weekly and monthly. Otherwise your printed QR Code will be INVALID the next day as a new QR code is generated automatically by the system.

 

To change the QR Code generation frequency, select the QR Code Setup button on upper right corner:



Sign In/Out by Parents using the 1Core Family app:

Parent select this QR Code Scan icon to activate the built-in QR Code scanner and get ready to scan the QR Code.

When the parent’s login to the 1Core Family App, they will see the QR Code Scan icon on the upper right corner.


Parents will aim the QR Code scanner at the Center QR Code on the 1Core Attend app or on the printed QR Code.


                  

 

 

The parent repeats the same process when it is time to sign out.

The parent has to click "Done" to exit the screen.

The parent will see the name of their child and can sign in their child by selecting the Sign in button.

articles.title: QR Code Generation Frequency Setup
articles.description:
QR Code: Generation Frequency Setup

Using this option, the Director can set up the Generation Frequency of QR Code for their center either Daily/ Monthly/Weekly/No Automatic Refresh.

 

Access Path : Center Dashboard > Functions > Time and Tracking > QR Code for Attendance



 


1. Modify - QR Code Frequency


You can set the QR Code refresh frequency on daily/weekly/monthly/no automatic refresh. 


No Automatic Refresh- Enables you to use the same QR Code daily without any change until a manual refresh. 


Weekly Refresh 


To set the QR Code refresh frequency weekly, select the 'Weekly' radio button on the 'Automatic QR Code Refresh Frequency' option. 



Note : You can add multiple CCs for the email reminder alert.


Monthly Refresh 


To set the QR Code refresh frequency 'Monthly', select the "Monthly'  radio button on the 'Automatic QR Code Refresh Frequency' option. 



Note: The widow for prior email remainder is 1 to 5 days, before the QR Code change occurance for both Weekly/Monthly frequency change. 


2. Print - Next Reference QR Code 


To print the future (next ) QR Code, select the 'Next Refreshed QR Code'  tab on the QR Code Attendance page. It'll help you take a printout of the next QR Code beforehand and change the manually pasted QR codes on the campus smoothly on the refresh due date.

articles.title: 1Core Attend - Timeclock Role & User Creation
articles.description:
1Core Attend Time Clock Role creation for Center:

The Owner or the Company Admin can create the Time clock Role as mentioned below.

Access Path: Company Dashboard-->Role Management--->Add New Role.

  • Create Timeclock Role.
  • Choose the Location as Single.
  • Once after creating the role, click Edit under Permission
  • Enable only the Time & Attendance tracking function and Save
  • Once enabled, the page will reload and the edit link will appear on the right, click on the Edit icon and enable the required functions
  • Enable the required reports under Center Reports tab.
  • Enable the required functions under Center Function tab

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Time clock Username Creation:

The Time clock user can be created as mentioned below.

Access Path: Company DashboardàUsersàAdd New User

  • Create a Username, by completing all the required field.
  • Under Role, select Timeclock.
  • Under Location Assignment for Single Center, select the available location.
  • Once after when the User is created, the Owner or Company Admin can change the password anytime by editing the respective username.


 

 

For Multiple Center Location:

             Select the respective location under Location Assignment

          The Owner or Company Admin can create a timeclock user for every single location

articles.title: 1Core Class App - Classroom Username Creation
articles.description:
To access each classroom in the 1Core Class App, you can create a special shared classroom login credential for each classroom.

To create the 1Core Class App classroom login credential, please follow the steps below:

Access Path: Company Dashboard--->Users-->Add New User

  • Complete all the required fields to create a user.
  • Under Role, select Classroom.
  • Assign a specific classroom for that username login and save.
  • This shared classroom login credential can be given to all the staff within each classroom.


Note:The Location Director or Company Admin or the Super User can create as many numbers of classroom users based on the total number of available classrooms (Ex: If they have 4 Classrooms (Infant/Toddler/Preschool/Pre-K) they can create a user for every single classroom)

articles.title: Daily Health Screening - 1Core Class App
articles.description:
Daily Health Screening – Setup:

1Core has now introduced a new feature “Daily Health Screening” with 1Core Class App.

The Health Screening feature for the Company will be enabled in the back end by 1Core Customer Support Users.

Once after when it is enabled, the Company Super User or the Company Admin will have the ability to do the rest of the setup as mentioned below. 

Access Path: Company Dashboard--->Setup--->Attendance--->Daily Health Screening Setup


  

  • Click Yes to enable Daily Health Screening Application

 

  • The system will display the Primary & Secondary Questions.
  •  To enable to the setup for Multi Centers, click on Select Center to enable Health Screen at the bottom.
  •  Select the Centers applicable and Save.

           

Once after when it is enabled for the centers, it can be configured under the Center Level Setup.

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Setup--->Daily Health Screening Setup.


 

 

Follow the Access path and click Save to enable this question setup for the specific center.

         


Update the Questions as needed:



Health Screening – 1Core Class:

 

Please make sure to update the 1Core Class app to view the Health Screening Function.

  • Click Health Screening to record the Questionnaire for children


          

 

  • Display the Active Children who has a schedule on the selected Date.
  • The Small Icon on the left of the Circle around the child name indicates that the child has completed the health Screening questions.

             

  

  • When a staff select Yes to the Primary and Secondary Questions, the system will not allow them to Sign in that respective Child.

                               

           

  • When a Staff selects No to the Primary and Secondary Questions then the system will display the Sign in Screen for the child

 

 

                       

  • The Blue ring indicates the child is successfully signed in completing the health questions.

                     

 

To view the completed Health Screening for a child:

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Children--->Click on the Health Screen Icon on the right side of the child’s name.

 

       

  • The Icon displayed under Time-In and Time-Out indicates through which interface the child was signed in and signed out

 

Health Screening Reports:

 

The Center can generate the following reports regarding Daily Heath Screen.

  • Daily Health Screening Sheet
  • Daily Health Screening Log

 

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Reports--->Daily Health Screening 


 


 

Daily Health Screening Sheet:


This report is used to enter the answers for the health screening questions to the children manually.

  • Using this sheet, the staff will be manually able to enter the answers for a child.

 

Daily Health Screening Log:

Can be used to generate the Health Screening log for any selected Time Period.

  • Child who completed the Screening will only be displayed in this report.
  • The Date / Time and the name of the User who answered the questions will be displayed in this report.

articles.title: 1Core Family App Quick Guide
articles.description:
Family App Setup:

After parents register for their family account, they can download the 1Core Family app in their phone from App store (or) Play store and login with their Family account User email and password.


  • When they login for the first time, the system will prompt them to setup either a 6-digit Quick Login Code, Use their Device Native Security (Passcode, Touch ID/Face ID) or continue with their username and password. Parents can choose either setting, which can be used for quick access to the app for future login purposes. 






  • This 6 Digit Login Code is setup by the parent for easy access with their family app and has no relation with the Authorized Id Code they use for Sign in and Sign out purpose.
  • Once after the initial setup, they will be able to see the QR Scanner on the right corner of their Homepage, which can be used to scan at the center for sign in and sign out purpose.

  

Family App Purpose:

Parents can do the below mentioned functions from their app.

  • Sign in and Sign out their child using the QR Scanner.
  • Setup payment account /make payments / schedule recurring payment / make one-time payment / Add multiple accounts.
  • View / Edit their contact information
  • View / Edit their child info (Child Questions / Health info / Contact Info / Restricted Person info etc.)
  • View Pictures and videos posted by their child’s classroom Teacher.
  • View their child’s daily activity postings (Food / Homework / Diaper) added by the Classroom Teacher.
  • Download Account / Tax Statement and email the same if required.
  • Change their Password / 6 Digit Quick Login Code.
  • Instant messaging with Classroom teacher at anytime.

articles.title: Health Screening Enhancements - 1Core Web
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1.Ability to Add / Edit the Health Screening Questions
  • 1.1.Ability to Add / Edit answers for the health screening Questions


1.Ability to Add / Edit the Health Screening Questions


1Core has provided the ability for Center Director to Add / Edit the health screening questions with the web Interface

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Setup--->Attendance--->Daily Health Screening Setup

               *Click Add Question to add new Health Screening Questions

               * Enter the Question, Select category and Save.

             

   

       


       Click on the Edit Icon to edit already existing questions.

       Make the Changes and Save.

     

 

1.1.Ability to Add / Edit answers for the health screening Questions


1Core has provided a new option where Director can add the answers for health screening questions with the Web interface.

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Children--->Child Record--->Health Screening 

*Click on the Health Screening Icon to view the record for the child

*Click Update Health Screening to record the answers for health screening questions with 1Core Web

 

 

 

*By default, system display the Current Date. Director can select a past Date if required.

*Select Yes/No and click Save to record the answers for a child.

 

     

 

1.1.1Edit the Recorded Answers

1Core has provided a new option to edit the already recorded answers for the health screening questions under the child page.

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Children--->Child Record--->Health Screening 

*Click Update Health Screening to edit the recorded answers for the child

*The Director can edit the already recorded answers for the child and make changes if required and click Save

articles.title: Health Screening Available in 1Core Family App
articles.description:
1Core has now provided an option for the parents, where they can perform the Daily Heath Screen for their child before Signing them to the Center.

This Setup can be enabled in the 1Core Web Interface as follows.

Access Path: Center DashboardàSetupàDaily Heath Screening Setup.



  • Classroom staff will be able to do the Health Screening through 1Core Class App, if the “Daily Health Screening at Sign by” is enabled for Staff.
  • Parents will be able to do the Health Screening through their Family app if the “Daily Health Screening at Sign by” is enabled for Family.
  • Both Staff and Parents will be able to do the Health Screening through 1Core Class and Family app, when the “Daily Health Screening at Sign by” is enabled for Both.

 

Daily Health Screening through 1Core Family App can be completed as follows.

Once when the setup is enabled, the parent login to the 1Core Family app.

  • Click on the QR Code Sign in located on the top right of the Home Screen.
  • Scan the QR Code available in the Center’s Tablet or from the printed version
  • Click “Sign in “
  • The Health Screen questions will pop up for the parents.
  • Based on the response provided, their child will either get Signed in or will be restricted from Signing in at the Center.

 

Note: Families with Multiple Child will have to complete the Health Question for each and every child separately one after the other.

 

Once after when the parent completes the Health Screening and Sign in their child, the Classroom staff will be able to see the update in the 1Core Class App and the admin user will be able to view the answers recorded by the parents in the Web Interface.










The Admin User will be able to view the Health Screen answers recorded by the parent in the 1Core Web interface as follows.

Access Path: Center DashboardàChildrenàHealth Screen Icon



The Admin User will be able to view through which interface the Child got Signed to the Center by going under their Time Card details.

Access Path: Center DashboardàChildrenàTimecard Icon

articles.title: Product Update in 1Core Family and 1Core Attend - 09 Nov 2020
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS


1. 1Core Family - Enhancement in Collage


2. 1Core Attend and 1Core Family - Displaying “Primary Classroom” on signed-in page


1. 1Core Family - Enhancement in Collage

Now, the parents can “View”, “Share” and “Download” each photo in the Collage.


“Share” and “Download” options are available only for Photos not for Videos.


You can move from one photo to another with a simple swipe.





2. 1Core Attend and 1Core Family - Displaying “Primary Classroom” on signed-in page

 

Earlier, we were displaying the classroom in 1Core Attend and 1Core Family when the child was signed in through the classroom movement only. 


Now, we are displaying the "Primary Classroom" in 1Core Attend and 1Core Family even though when the child does not sign in through Classroom Movement. 


If the child is signed in through 1Core Web/1Core Attend/1Core Family/Health Screening, the “Primary Classroom” will be displayed in 1Core Attend and 1Core Family.


If the child does not have a Primary Classroom, “Not Assigned” will be displayed.

If the child does not have a Primary Classroom, “Not Assigned” will be displayed.

articles.title: Chat Feature on 1Core Class and Family Mobile Apps
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

1. Chat Feature


2. Enabling the Chat Feature at Company Level


3. 1Core Class - Location Director Role


4. 1Core Class - Classroom User


5. 1Core Family



1. Chat Feature


1Core has come up with a new chat feature for childcare center Location Directors, Classroom Users, and Parents. 1Core has linked 1Core Class and 1Core Family app for the chat services. So the childcare staff and parents can engage in active dialogue with each other regarding the children's welfare and progress.


2. Enabling the Chat Feature at Company Level


Chat feature can be enabled or disabled for the Center Directors using the company level 'User Management' option.




3. 1Core Class - Location Director Role


1Core Class is the mobile app for childcare staff and Location Directors. Using this app, classroom users and location directors of a childcare center can interact with the parents.



.


The childcare center director can directly message the parents of enrolled children using the 'My Messages' section. 



The Childcare center director will have the access to the classroom messages. The classroom messages section will have the conversation that happened between the parents and classroom users of different classrooms.


But the Childcare center director will not be able to participate in the conversation in the classroom messages section, he can only view the conversations taken place between parents and classroom users.





The center director can also send messages to the parents by accessing the child's profile from the classroom list. 


When you are working on any other screen than the Messages screen, you will receive a push notification for any new incoming messages. 




While you are on the 'Messages' screen, any new incoming message will be alerted along with the alert tone set in the mobile. No push notification will be displayed in this scenario. 


4. 1Core Class - Classroom User


Chat feature for the 1Core Class - classroom user is similar to the Location Director. But the classroom users can only engage in conversation with the parents of the children, who are all enrolled under the classroom user's assigned classrooms.



After selecting the profile, you will be taken to the message editor page from where you can send texts to the selected parents. 


When you are working on any other screen than the Messages screen, you will receive a push notification for any new incoming messages. 


While you are on the 'Messages' screen, any new incoming message will be alerted along with the alert tone set in the mobile. No push notification will be displayed in this scenario

 

5. 1Core Family


It is very vital that parents and childcare centers communicate with each other on various levels to ensure the child's safety and progress. 


Parents can send messages to the classroom users and childcare center directors directly by using their 1Core Family app.


Selecting the 'Messages' option will take you to the chat conversation page. 




On the contacts page, you can view the Location Director (s) profile, details of the classroom user(s).


Selecting a profile from the contacts section will take you to the message editor page, from where you can send a message to the selected person.


When you are working on any other screen than the Messages screen, you will receive a push notification for any new incoming messages. 





While you are on the 'Messages' screen, any new incoming message will be alerted along with the alert tone set in the mobile. No push notification will be displayed in this scenario.

articles.title: 1Core Class and Family Mobile Apps Update - 24 Feb 2021
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

1. 1Core Class App


1.1. Introduction of message feature module for Company Super User and Company Admin


1.2. Ability to send message broadcast to the parents


1.3. Ability to access the messages page from any screen of the app and view the unread messages notification on the message badge.


2. 1Core Family


2.1. Ability to access the messages page from any screen of the app and view the unread messages notification on the message badge.

1. 1Core Class App

1.1. Introduction of Message feature module for Company Super User and Company Admin


Earlier the messaging feature module was introduced only to the Location Directors and Classroom users in the 1Core Class app. Now, it has been introduced for Company Super Users and Company Admin roles. 


1.2. Ability to send message broadcast to the parents

For effective parent communication, 1Core has come up with a new message broadcast option. The Broadcast Messages option is used to send a particular message to more than one parent or in some cases, to all of your contacts. 


All credential holders of the 1Core Class app (Company Super User/Company Admin/Location Director/Classroom) can send broadcast messages to parents. 


Selecting the Contact icon will take you to the 'Send Messages to Parents' page. 



1.3. Ability to access the messages page from any screen of the app and view the unread messages notification on the message badge.


Now you can access the message's screen from any screen of the 1Core Class app by selecting the message badge from the header view. 


If you have any unread messages, they will be indicated along with the count of the unread message on the message badge.



2. 1Core Family


2.1. Ability to access the messages page from any screen of the app and view the unread messages notification on the message badge.


Now you can access the message's screen from any screen of the 1Core Family app by selecting the message badge from the header view. 


If you have any unread messages in your chat, they will be indicated along with the count of the unread message on the message badge.

articles.title: Product Update 1Core Class and 1Core Family Apps 16- April - 2021
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. 1Core Class App
    • 1.1.  Ability to Create an Activity using 1Core Class App
    • 1.2. Ability to Send Activity Notification to Parent using 1Core Class App
    • 1.3. Enhancement in the Child Profile Section
  • 2. 1Core Family App
    • 2.1. Activity Notification for a parent on 1Core Family App
    • 2.2. Enhancements in the Child Profile section of 1Core Family App


1. 1Core Class App


1.1.  Ability to Create an Activity using 1Core Class App


Activities are day-to-day preplanned classroom businesses. 1Core has come up with the Activity functions for both 1Core Web and Mobile Apps. 


You can create an activity for a classroom using the 1Core Class App. Select a classroom from the 1Core Class App home screen.  


1.2. Ability to Send Activity Notification to Parent using 1Core Class App


You can send Activity notifications of the signed in children of a classroom to their parents using the 1Core Class App.

 


By default, the activities created on the 1Core web will be displayed on the Select Activity screen.


You need to add at least a single activity/note or a combination of both in order to send the notification for parents, the system will provide you an error message otherwise. 


Submitting an activity notification with a note alone: 





1.3. Enhancement in the Child Profile Section


1Core has enhanced the child profile section of the 1Core Class App, any activity notified for the children will be added to the Timeline tab on the child profile section, and the media that shared with the activity notification will be shown in the gallery tab. 




2. 1Core Family App


2.1. Activity Notification for a parent on 1Core Family App


When an activity notification for a child sent from the 1Core Class App, it will be notified to the parent on the 1Core Family App. 

They will receive a push notification and the Activity notification along with shared media and notes will be shown on the home screen of the 1Core Family App.


2.2. Enhancements in the Child Profile section of 1Core Family App


Now, the child profile section will show the gallery, activity, and timeline sections. Selecting these three sections will take to their respective screens.

articles.title: 1Core Staff App Guide
articles.description:
1Core Staff App


1Core Staff App is a unique mobile app for childcare center staff. Like our 1Core Class and Family apps, this 1Core Staff app will also be a multi-purpose mobile application that contains a bundle of features for the staff to function smoothly. 


1. Logging In to the 1Core Staff App

To Login  :


1. Open the App on your mobile (IOS/Android) 

2. Enter the login credentials

3. Click the 'Login' button


Note : New Registrations for the 1Core Staff App can be only done through Registration URL. But if you are a registered user of 1Core Staff Portal then you can use your Staff Portal Credentials to login the 1Core Staff App.



2. Viewing the Staff Profile on the 1Core Staff App


You can view the Staff profile details on the 1Core Staff App by selecting the profile picture or name of the staff on the home page. 



Note: You can only view the details of staff that has been entered through 1Core Web and 1Core Staff portal. 



3. Sign In / Out of the Staff portal using the 1Core Staff App

You can sign in / out of your staff portal using the QR Scan feature of the 1Core Staff App. You can also view the timecards of your sign in and outs.  


 Earlier we had a health screening questionnaire only for the children, now you can do the same screening for the staff using the 1Core Staff App.  


To Sign In : 

Note : To access the QR Code scanning feature on the 1Core Staff app, you need to enable the  QR Scan feature on the 1Core web.


Time Card after signed in:


After you have signed in, the 'Scan and Sign In' button will get changed to ' Scan and Sign Out' and a time card entry will be visible on the home page.  

Changing the classroom while signing out :


Select the 'Change Classroom' button while you try to sign out to change the present signed in classroom to another.




To Sign Out : 


To sign out completely, select the 'Sign Out' button on the change classroom screen.




Note : The 'Change Classroom' option will be visible only if the 'Track Staff Movement' option is enabled in the company module configuration.



Timecard entry after changing the classroom



Note : You can only view the PTO Balance Summary that has been entered through the 1Core web.


4. Changing the login password on the 1Core Staff App

You can change your login password using the settings option on the 1Core Staff App menu. 




5.  Logging Out of 1Core Staff App

To Logout : 

 

1. Select the  'Menu' icon from the home page of the app.

2. Select the 'Logout' option.

articles.title: Two Way Messaging Between 1Core Class and Staff App
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS


1. Chat Feature Between 1Core Class and Staff App


2. Enabling Messaging Feature at Company Level


3.  Messaging From 1Core Class to 1Core Staff App


4. Messaging From 1Core Staff to 1Core Class App



1. Chat Feature Between 1Core Class and Staff App


1Core has now introduced the Two Way Messaging feature between 1Core Class and Staff App. The company super users and location directors can send messages to staff (except for the classroom role). 



2. Enabling Messaging Feature at Company Level


You can enable or disable the 'Two Way Messaging between 1Core Class and Staff app'  feature using the 'Is Staff Chat Applicable' option at the Company Level. 


Access Path : Company Dashboard > Users > Admin / Staff Search



3.  Messaging From 1Core Class to 1Core Staff App


As a Company Super User / Company Admin / Location Director, You can message the staff using the messages icon present on the home screen. 


Note : The messages option is available both in the collapsible profile section and home screen header.



Clicking the 'Messages' option will take you to the 'Messages' screen.



Clicking the 'Staff Messages' option will open the 'Individual Message' screen and it will have the list of staff present in that center. You need to select staff from the list to start the chat. 



4. Messaging From 1Core Staff to 1Core Class App


As a Staff App user, you can message the Location Directors/Company Super Users/Admin Users using the Staff App. 


Note : The messages option is available both in the collapsible profile section and home screen header.


Select the 'Messages' option to open the 'Messages screen. 



On the messages screen, select the 'Compose' icon to open your contact list where you can see all the super users, company admins, location directors, and fellow staff. 


Note: By default, you can only perform Staff App to Class App messaging. If you want to perform Staff App to Staff App messaging (Staff to Staff Message), you need to contact the 1CoreSolution Customer Support to enable the feature. 



After selecting the contact, you can type and send the messages to them.

 


Note: You will receive message notifications in the Staff app like the Class app.

articles.title: Parents - Self Sign Up using Family App
articles.description:
Parent can sign up (create Family portal Account) directly through the “1Core Family App” instead of getting an Invitation from the School Director. 



The process for Self-Sign Up is as follows:

seo_data.meta_title: Parents - Self Sign Up using Family App

articles.title: Inviting Authorized Person for QR Code Sign in/out
articles.description:
With 1Core Family app, Parents will be able to add a new Authorized Person for their child at anytime when required.


Adding New Authorized Person

Login to the family app

Select the Menu button on the top left corner

Select the Family drop down and go to Authorized person tab

Select the "+" icon to add authorized person.


Once when you add all the authorized person, you will be able to invite them for family app account.

Authorized person who are already added in the family previously will be listed under this tab, parents does not need to have them added again.




Authorized Person– Invite/Edit /Revoke options


1Core allows the following options for fucntions which parents can use for their Authorized Persons.

Invite -->Parents can invite the Authorized Person to register for the family app to pick up their child.

Edit -->To edit the existing Authorized Person details

Revoke-->To revoke the Authorized Person permission







Note: Authorized Person can also complete the registration by using the “Sign Up Now” option.

articles.title: Picture Collage in 1Core Family
articles.description:
Parents can “View”, “Share” and “Download” each photo in the Collage.


“Share” and “Download” options are available only for Photos not for Videos.


You can move from one photo to another with a simple swipe.

To enable this option : 


Access Path : Company Dashboard > Locations > Select Center > Edit

articles.title: Gallery - 1Core Family App
articles.description:
1Core Families App has a Gallery feature where the parents can view all the photos and videos received from the staff. 




You can filter the Gallery page results using the filter options present at the bottom of the page.
articles.description_text: 1Core Families App has a Gallery feature where the parents can view all the photos and videos received from the staff.              You can filter the Gallery page results using the filter options present at the bottom of the page.

articles.title: Parent has the ability to toggle between centers
articles.description:
Now,  parents with the same email address have the ability to select Centers and switch from one center to another center whenever required.





Parents can scan the QR code on the center selection page itself. This will help the parent easily sign in/out of the child without entering the respective centers.




Click "Done" once you sign in/out the children from the school. It redirects to the same center selection page.


Parents can go to the home page of the respective center by clicking the Center name. In the side menu, you can see the arrow icon to change it to another center.

articles.title: Logging in to the 1Core Class App
articles.description:
Select the 1Core Class App icon from your mobile/tab device to open the app. 



After you logged in, the app will check your device's time zone information. If there is any mismatch between your center's set time zone and your device's time zone, you will get this warning message. 





You can ignore the Time Zone mismatch by selecting the 'That's fine! Let me Proceed!' option or you can select the 'Show me how to fix it!' option to learn how to correct the time zone mismatch.


Selecting the 'That's fine! Let me Proceed!' option will take you to the dashboard of the 1Core Class App.

articles.title: 1Core Class Dashboard
articles.description:
1Core Class App dashboard provides series of important information about the center and the associated classrooms.


1Core Class App Dashboard
articles.description_text: 1Core Class App dashboard provides series of important information about the center and the associated classrooms.     1Core Class App Dashboard

articles.title: How to Sign In/Out a Staff using the 1Core Class App
articles.description:
A Staff can sign in and out to the 1Core solution in various modes, they can sign in/out using the 1Core Web portal, 1Core Attend App, and 1Core Class App. 


The Company Super Users, Directors, and Admins can directly sign in/out a staff using the 1Core Class App. 


To Sign In a Staff to a Classroom:


To sign in a staff, select their associated classroom from the app dashboard. 



After the staff selection, you are required to furnish the selected staff's ID Code to complete the action. 



After the successful sign-in, you can see the signed-in time of the staff below their profile picture on the classroom screen.



To Sign Out a Staff from a Classroom:


Select the Staff who you want to sign out from a classroom and enter the staff's ID code to authenticate the sign out. 


After authenticating the sign out, select the sign-out time and select the 'Ok' to sign out the staff. 

 


Note: Staff Sign In/Out is completely synchronized in all platforms, whether a staff is Signed-in/out through 1Core Attend or 1Core Web, the time cards for their Sign in/out will be the same.

articles.title: How to Sign In/Out a Child using 1Core Class App
articles.description:
With our 1Core Class App, you can sign in/out the children to their classrooms. To sign in/out a child,  you need to open their associated classroom or any classroom. 


If the child is enrolled in a classroom, you can access the child under the scheduled section of the classroom. 

(or) 


If you want to sign in a child to a classroom in which he/she was not enrolled originally, you can do that by selecting the child's name from the 'Other Children' section of the selected classroom.



Other Children: The children who are all enrolled to the center but not to the selected classroom will be categorized as Other Children. You can sign in these Other Children to any classroom. The signed-in classroom will be displayed  in the Classroom Movement of the child rather than their assigned primary classroom in the schedule.



The classroom sign-in made from the 1Core Class is synchronized with the 1Core Web's time card entry the sign-in/out of a child and the classroom movement will be updated automatically in the child's time card entry in the 1Core web.



After a successful sign-in, the child who got signed in will be moved to the Signed In tab from the Scheduled Tab.




To Sign Out a Child from the classroom:


Select the Sign Out button present below the child's profile to sign out them.




For a Batch Sign In:


You can also sign in/out children in batches also. To do a batch sign in/out, select the Sign In button present in the footer of the screen. 



You can select both the scheduled children and other children to batch sign in into a classroom.


For a Batch Sign Out:


You can do batch sign-out for a classroom. Select the Sign Out button from the footer of the screen.




Color code for Children Sign-In:


1Core has given three color codes to indicate the children sign in to the center.  Using these color codes, you can recognize the children's status of sign in to the center easily at a glance



Special Notification: 


Special notifications like birthday and allergy details will be indicated via special badges on the child's profile. 


Allergy Notification Badge:


Birthday Notification  Badge and Count Down:

articles.title: Managing a Classroom From the 1Core Class App
articles.description:
With 1Core Class App, you can manage entire classroom operations including the children, staff sign-in/out, classroom movement, and updating the classroom activities. 


Viewing a Classroom Details


Select a classroom from the 1Core Class App dashboard.


Using the Classroom screen, you can view the scheduled children and signed-in children and staff(s) details.


By default, the children section of the classroom screen will show you the scheduled children list for the selected classroom. You can select the 'Signed In' tab to view the signed in children list. 



The 'Other Children' section will have the children list who are all registered in the center but not enrolled in the selected classroom. 



You can switch from one classroom to another using the 'Switch Classroom' icon present in the header.
articles.description_text: With 1Core Class App, you can manage entire classroom operations including the children, staff sign-in/out, classroom movement, and updating the classroom activities.      Viewing a Classroom Details     Select a classroom from the 1Core Class App dashboard.       Using the Classroom screen, you can view the scheduled children and signed-in children and staff(s) details.     By default, the children section of the classroom screen will show you the scheduled children list for the selected classroom. You can select the 'Signed In' tab to view the signed in children list.           The 'Other Children' section will have the children list who are all registered in the center but not enrolled in the selected classroom.           You can switch from one classroom to another using the 'Switch Classroom' icon present in the header.

articles.title: Moving Children from One Classroom to Another
articles.description:
You can move a signed-in child(ren) from one classroom to another by simply selecting the 'Move' button present in the footer of the 1Core Class App screen.




Note : While moving a child from one classroom to another, the sign in time to the destination classroom will become the sign out time for the present or current classroom.
articles.description_text: You can move a signed-in child(ren) from one classroom to another by simply selecting the 'Move' button present in the footer of the 1Core Class App screen.             Note : While moving a child from one classroom to another, the sign in time to the destination classroom will become the sign out time for the present or current classroom.

articles.title: Child Profile in 1Core Class App
articles.description:
Using the 1Core Class app, you can view all the necessary information about the child using the child profile screen.


To view the child profile screen, select a child profile from the classroom screen.



You can view the parents' details, authorized pickup, and restricted person details, special diet, allergies, and medical details in the child profile screen.


You can also access the child's picture gallery, notes, incident, and Timeline using the child's profile screen.


Select the 'More' option to access the Incidents and Notes options.

You can view the parents' details, authorized pickup, and restricted person details, special diet, allergies, and medical details in the child profile screen.     You can also access the child's picture gallery, notes, incident, and Timeline using the child's profile screen.     Select the 'More' option to access the Incidents and Notes options.

articles.title: Two way messaging option for Classroom Staff and Parents
articles.description:
1. 1Core Class - Two way messaging option


1Core Class offers an instant messaging option for the admin users as well as for the classroom staff. Using this messaging service, Admin users, classroom users and location directors of a childcare center can interact with the parents.



.


The childcare center director can directly respond to the messages of the parents using the 'My Messages' section. To send a new message to a parent, select the compose message icon at the lower right corner of the 'Messages' screen, from where you can select a parent from the overall list of the enrolled parents.



The Childcare center director will have the access to the classroom messages. The classroom messages section will have the conversation that happened between the parents and classroom staff of different classrooms.


The Location director will not be able to participate in the conversation in the classroom messages section, while they will have the ability to view the conversations taken place between parents and classroom staff.





The Location Director can also send messages to the parents by accessing the child's profile from the classroom list. 


When you are working on any other screen than the individual conversation screen, you will receive a push notification for any new incoming messages. 




While you are on the 'Conversation' screen, any new incoming message will be alerted along with the alert tone set in the mobile. No push notification will be displayed in this scenario. 


2. 1Core Class - Classroom User

Two way messaging feature for the Classroom user is similar to the Location Director. But the classroom users can only engage in conversation with the parents of the children, who are all enrolled under the classroom user's assigned classrooms.



After selecting the profile, you will be taken to the message editor page from where you can respond to the messages of the parents. To send a new message to a parent, select the compose message icon at the lower right corner of the 'Messages' screen, from where you can select a parent from the overall list of the enrolled parents.


When you are working on any other screen than the messages screen, you will receive a push notification for any new incoming messages. 


While you are on the "Messages" screen, any new incoming message will be alerted along with the alert tone set in the mobile. No push notification will be displayed in this scenario

articles.title: How to Create a Broadcast Message
articles.description:
For effective parent communication, 1Core has come up with a new message broadcast option. The Broadcast Messages option is used to send a particular message to more than one parent or in some cases, to all of your contacts. 


All credential holders of the 1Core Class app (Company Super User/Company Admin/Location Director/Classroom) can send broadcast messages to parents. 


Selecting the Contact icon will take you to the 'Send Messages to Parents' page. 



Classroom Filter: 


The 'Classroom Filter' option in the 'Send Messages to Parents' screen will display the parents based on the classroom.

The Broadcast Messages option is used to send a particular message to more than one parent or in some cases, to all of your contacts.      All credential holders of the 1Core Class app (Company Super User/Company Admin/Location Director/Classroom) can send broadcast messages to parents.      Selecting the Contact icon will take you to the 'Send Messages to Parents' page.         Classroom Filter:      The 'Classroom Filter' option in the 'Send Messages to Parents' screen will display the parents based on the classroom.

articles.title: How to Create a Food Plan and update a Food Activity in the 1Core Class App
articles.description:
You can create your own food plan for your center. Select the 'Food Plan' option under the  'Classroom Activities' option.


You have to create a food plan on daily basis. so choose a date and select the 'Add' button to add the food plan for the day. 



To update a Food Activity to the parents


After every meal and snack, you can update those to the parents using the Activities Launcher present in the footer of every classroom screen.

You have to create a food plan on daily basis. so choose a date and select the 'Add' button to add the food plan for the day.           To update a Food Activity to the parents     After every meal and snack, you can update those to the parents using the Activities Launcher present in the footer of every classroom screen.

articles.title: Daily Health Screening Questionnaire for 1Core Class App
articles.description:
1Core has now introduced the 'Daily Health Screening Questionnaire' for 1Core Class App via the 1Core Web mode.

  • Company Level Setup
  • Center Level Setup
  • 1Core Class App - Daily Health Screening


Company Level Setup


To enable the 'Daily Health Screening Questionnaire' for your company level, contact 1Core solution's Customer service executive.


After getting 1Core Class enabled for your company, you can select 1Core Class App applicability for the center level using the 'Daily Health Screen Setup' options present in the 'Setup'.



Selecting the 'Select Centers to Enable  Daily Health Screening' button will take you to the center selection page. 



Center Level Setup

After enabling it for centers, now you can configure the center level setting at the center level dashboard.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Attendence > Daily Health Screening Setup






Selecting the 'Add Question' button will open the 'Add Health Screen Question' dialogue box. In the 'Add Health Screening Quesiton' dialogue box, you can select the answer type between Yes/No or Text answer. 



1Core Class App - Daily Health Screening

Select the 'Health Screening' option from the 1Core Class App dashboard.




After submitting your response, the Child Sign In dialogue box screen will appear. You can use the QR code on the screen or the Sign In by staff option to sign in a child to the center.

 

After the successful signed-in of a child, the child's profile will have the Health Screen badge on it. 



To view the successful health screening in the 1Core Web, go to the children profile page in the center dashboard. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Children > Select a Child > Health Screen icon

articles.title: How to Enable 1Core Class, Family, Attend and Daily Health Screening for a center
articles.description:
1Core Solution has a wide array of mobile apps and innovative feature support for various functions of childcare management duties. Some of them are 1Core Class, 1Core Family, 1Core Attend, and Daily Health screening options.


To enable the mobile apps support for your company, contact our customer services executives.


To enable the mobile apps support to the center level, go to your company dashboard and select the 'Locations' module from the left side panel. 


Selecting the 'Locations' module will open the 'Center Management' page. Select the 'Mobile Apps Configuration' option icon adjacent to the center that you want to enable. 



On the 'Mobile Apps Configuration' page, you can enable the 1Core Class, 1Core Family, 1Core Attend, and Daily Health Screening option to the selected center.
articles.description_text: 1Core Solution has a wide array of mobile apps and innovative feature support for various functions of childcare management duties. Some of them are 1Core Class, 1Core Family, 1Core Attend, and Daily Health screening options.     To enable the mobile apps support for your company, contact our customer services executives.     To enable the mobile apps support to the center level, go to your company dashboard and select the 'Locations' module from the left side panel.      Selecting the 'Locations' module will open the 'Center Management' page. Select the 'Mobile Apps Configuration' option icon adjacent to the center that you want to enable.           On the 'Mobile Apps Configuration' page, you can enable the 1Core Class, 1Core Family, 1Core Attend, and Daily Health Screening option to the selected center.

articles.title: 1CORE CLASS APP CLASSROOM SCREEN
articles.description:
1.1. Scheduled


In the Scheduled tab, you can able to view the children who are all scheduled for the classroom on a particular date and time. 



1.2. Checked  In/Out


Checked In/Out tab contains the details of children who are all checked in / out by the classroom/admin users. 


Earlier this tab was called 'Sign In/Out' tab. 




1.3. Addition -  Absence Tab


In the new 'Absence' tab, you'll be able to view the list of children who are all absent for that day. The absence that was marked on the child time card page using the 'Record Absence' option is reflected here.



If a child was marked absent but checked in to the center today, you can mark their presence by clicking the 'Check In' button on the child profile. 


1.4. Show Children in the Other Classroom


Earlier, on the Classroom screen, you were able to see unscheduled children under a label named 'Other Children' without their assigned classroom details. Now, 1Core has provided classroom details for the 'Other Children' section and changed the section name to 'Show children in Other Classrooms'. 


By default, the 'Show Children in Other Classrooms' will be in collapsed mode. You need to click the 'Show Children in Other Classrooms' button to view the list of children in other classrooms.

articles.title: Show All Messages - 1Core Class App
articles.description:
1Core Class App classroom users will be able to view the 'Show all messages' option on their 'Messages' screen. This will help them to filter the message conversations on their 'Messages' screen.


By default, this toggle will be switched off for the users. 


1. When the toggle is switched off, you will only be able to see the chats of parents whose children are currently in your classroom.

2. When the toggle is switched on, you will be able to see all your chat history with all the parents (parents of current children in your classroom as well as the children who all took part in your classroom in the past).
articles.description_text: 1Core Class App classroom users will be able to view the 'Show all messages' option on their 'Messages' screen. This will help them to filter the message conversations on their 'Messages' screen.     By default, this toggle will be switched off for the users.      1. When the toggle is switched off, you will only be able to see the chats of parents whose children are currently in your classroom.  2. When the toggle is switched on, you will be able to see all your chat history with all the parents (parents of current children in your classroom as well as the children who all took part in your classroom in the past).

articles.title: Bring In , Medicine and Bottle
articles.description:
1CoreSolution has introduced three new activities on its web and mobile apps: Bring In, Bottles, and Medicine. These features have been added to the app to provide more comfort to children in care and their parents.

Bring In - Children in care often require essential items from home, such as pacifiers, nibs, sunscreen, and diapers. The 'Bring In' activity feature in the 1Core Class App enables centers to remind parents to bring in these items.


Bring In Notification to the parent via the 1Core Families app


Medicine - This feature helps parents ensure that their children receive their medications on time and enables them to know who administered the medication to their children.



You can also view the history of the medication given at the center, contact info, diet requirement, and allergies of the selected child.




Medicine Notification to the parent via the 1Core Families app

Bottles - This feature gives parents peace of mind by letting them know that their child has received milk, formula, or a mixture at the right time.

On the 'Bottles' page, you get to choose the type of feed (formula/breast milk/mixture) and the amount of the milk, who gave the milk, and the time. 

You can also view the history of the bottle feed, contact info, diet requirement, and allergies of the selected child.


Bottles Notification to the parent via the 1Core Families app

articles.title: Enabling the Staff to Staff messaging in the System Admin
articles.description:
By default, users can only perform 1Core Staff App-to-Class app messaging and vice versa. But there is a provision to perform Staff to Staff messaging (Staff App to Staff App) available at the System Admin level. 


Once the client requested this feature, Support can enable this feature using the system admin. 


Access Path : System Admin Home > Company/Location Setup > Edit Company Info > OApp > 1Core Staff

articles.title: Age Group Setup - Center Level
articles.description:
To add/edit an age group at the center level, you need to go to the 'Setup' module of the 1Core center dashboard. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Age Group





Add - Age Group :


To add a new age group to your center, select the 'Add Age Group' button located at the top right corner of the page. Upon clicking the button, a pop-up will appear where you can enter the setup details for the new age group.



Capacity :


When creating an age group, you have the option to specify the capacity for that particular group. This capacity count is used by 1Core to calculate the center's enrolled count and the number of available seats for this age group.



State Licensing Ratio and Center Ratio: 


You have the option to specify both the state licensing ratio for the particular age group and the corresponding center ratio for your facility.


Nap Ratio : 


If the staff scheduling module is enabled for your center, the "Nap Ratio Applicable" option will be automatically enabled by default. If you wish to turn it off, you will need to disable the staff scheduling module. To do so, please contact 1Core support for assistance
