Now you can view the batch payments in the last 24 hours.         Access Path : Center Dashboard > Online Tuition Payments > Process TAP Payment based  on Ledger Balance
     Selecting the 'Process TAP Payment based on Ledger Balance' option will take you to the 'Process New TAP Payment' page.           On the TAP Transaction Details page, the ACH and Card payments will be shown in different rows.             2.2. Improved Security Measures to Curb the Double / Duplicate Payments.     1Core has added new measures in the TAP Payment option to curb out the incidents of double/duplicate payments.      There are three main reasons for the duplicate / double payments issue.    Copy-Pasting the session link  Refreshing while submitting the payment  Disabled the Right Click on the Process TAP Payment Based on Ledger page  Restricting the action of opening the same session link on various browsers simultaneously.      Note: These curbing measures also enabled for the ' Process TAP Payment for Family' page.     From now onwards, a payment session will get start when you enter into the 'Process TAP Payment Based on Ledger' page.           Copy-Pasting the session link     You cannot open the same session link in another window on your browser by copy-pasting the link. If you try to open the session link in another window, you will get an error message.              Refreshing while submitting the payment     Earlier, if you click the refresh button while submitting the payments there was a chance of double payment.     To curb out this, 1Core has come up with an improved measure, if you click the refresh button while the payment submission is underway, then the payment initiated will become void and no payment will be processed for that submission and you will be asked to go to the main page via an error pop up message.           In addition to the above measure on the user level, from now onwards, you have to close an ongoing payment session before you toggle to other modules. If not, you will be asked to close the current session when you enter again to the 'Process TAP Payment based on Ledger Balance'.      In the multicenter situation, you cannot abandon a payment session in one center and switch to another and process the batch payment, you will get an error message stating to close the abandoned session first in the other center.           2.3. Enhancements in the 'Process TAP Payment for Family' option.      Now you can view the payment in progress details on the 'Process TAP Payment for Family' page.   You can also view the last 10 transactions made for this family using the 'View the status of last 10 payments' option.          2.4. Enhancements in the 'Review Status of Submitted TAP batches' option.     A new filter option has been added to the 'Review Status of Submitted TAP batches' option and now you can also view the batch transaction summary for a particular batch transaction on the 'View Submitted TAP payment' page.        Access Path : Center Dashboard > Online Tuition Payment > Review Status of Submitted TAP Batches                2.5. Enhancement in the Issue Credit payment for Unitify payments.      Unitify processes the card payments after 24 hours of the payment submission. So earlier, payments were failed often for the Unitify card payments.   From now onwards, 1Core will keep the status of the Unitify payment pending for the 24 hours after the payment submission and will change the status 'Success' once after the confirmation from the Unitify side.      Access Path : Center Dashboard > Online Tuition Payment > Refund/Issue Credit > Review Issue Credit Status       This pending payment status can be seen on the 'Issue Credit (Card)' page.     Access Path : Center Dashboard > Online Tuition Payment > Refund / Issue Credit > Issue Credit (Card)          2.6. Ability to view the Issue Credit history on the Families page.     Earlier, you cannot view the refund history on the Online Payment History page. Now you can view the Refund Transaction history on the Online Payment History page of the families module.         Access Path : Center Dashboard > Families > Select a family > View Payment History                3. Reports      3.1. Ability to sort the Rollcall sheet based on Alphabetical order of Classroom and sort the Rollcall Report based on the children Date Of Birth.     1Core has now given options to sort the Rollcall sheet based on the Alphabetical order of the Classroom and the Rollcall Report based on the Children's Date of Birth.         Access Path : Center Dashboard > Reports > Attendance > Rollcall Sheet
          4. Family Portal   4.1. Ability to view the TAP card payment pending in the Family Portal.     Now you can view the TAP card payment processed by the center in the Family portal.           4.2. New Caution message for the families who try to proceed with the same amount of payment submission through the same payment account twice with in the last 24 hours     In order to eradicate the Double / Duplicate payment, 1Core  has introduced a new caution message in the Family Portal. Now, families who try to proceed with the same amount of payment submission through the same payment account twice within the last 24 hours will get a caution message before their payment submission.              Note : When you select 'Yes' on this caution message, the resultant payment will not be termed as Duplicate payment.

articles.title: 1CORE PRODUCT UPDATES 15-FEB 2021
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. Families
    • 1.1. Introduction of Alphabetical Quick Lookup for the Families List page
    • 1.2. Ability to access all the enrolled Children's Time Card, Program & Billing, Health Screening, and Learn@Home present in a Family on the Families Profile page.
  • 2. Children
    • 2.1. Introduction of Alphabetical Quick Lookup for the Children page
  • 3. Ledger
    • 3.1. Introduction of Alphabetical Quick Lookup for the Ledger page
  • 4. Staff
    • 4.1. Introduction of Alphabetical Quick Lookup for the Staff page
  • 5. Program Enrollment
    • 5.1. Ability to visit the Enrolled Children profile pages from the Enrolled and Incoming tab
    • 5.2. Ability to edit the info on the Enrollment Offered tab and resend the offer
    • 5.3. Ability to alter the FTE Value criteria as per your center's policy
    • 5.4. Ability to make a program fee's ledger void
  • 6. Setup
    • 6.1. Ability to include Tuition charges into the Tax Statement Billing Configuration
    • 6.2. Ability to include the incoming families and children in the Program-Based Recurring Billing
  • 7. Functions
    • 7.1. Ability to view the primary classroom name on the Time Clock page
  • 8. Online Forms
    • 8.1. Enhancements on the Add New Form page
  • 9. Company Dashboard
    • 9.1. Ability to search Staff details on the Users  Management page and the ability to conduct a parent profile search based on the Role
  • 10. Center Dashboard 
    • 10.1. Repositioning of Classroom Attendance Summary and Child Attendance tab


1. Families

1.1. Introduction of Alphabetical Quick Lookup for the Families List page


To ease the search experience on the Families profile page, 1Core has now added an alphabetical quick lookup option.


Access Path:  Center Dashboard > Families



1.2. Ability to access all the enrolled Children's Time Card, Program & Billing, Health Screening, and Learn@Home present in a Family on the Families Profile page.


To improve the user experience,1Core has now added Children Time Card, Program & Billing, and Learn@Home module icon to the Families Profile page and also on the quick launcher setup. 


You can now access all the children enrolled under a family and their Program & Billing, Time Card, Health Screening, and Learn@Home profile from the Family Profile page using the smart launch icon.



1.3. Ability to download the Authorized Person list


You can now download the Authorized Person list of a child from the Child's Profile page and you can download that list in two formats pdf and csv.



Selecting the 'Authorized Person' icon will take you to the Child's Authorized Person page. From there, you can download all active and inactive Authorized Persons associated with the child. 



2. Children

2.1. Introduction of Alphabetical Quick Lookup for the Children page


You can now access the children's profile easily by using the new alphabetical quick lookup option added to the Children page. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Children



3. Ledger

3.1. Introduction of Alphabetical Quick Lookup for the Ledger page


1Core has now added the Alphabetical Quick Lookup option on the Ledger page for a seamless user experience.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Ledger


4. Staff

4.1. Introduction of Alphabetical Quick Lookup for the Staff page


To ease the profile search experience on the Staff page, 1Core has now added the Alphabetical Quick Lookup option.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Staff



5. Program Enrollment

5.1. Ability to visit the Enrolled Children profile pages from the Enrolled and Incoming tab

You can now directly visit the enrolled children profile page from the Program Enrollment Management page by selecting the children's name under the Enrolled tab.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Program Enrollment


5.2. Ability to edit the info on the Enrollment Offered tab and resend the offer


Now, you can edit the parent, child, and program information on the offered enrollments and resent the offer to the parent.



You can edit the Parent Info, Child Info, and Offered Program information on the 'View Offered Program' page.


5.3. Ability to alter the FTE Value criteria as per your center's policy

Now, you can optimize the FTE Value as per your center's policy and the FTE Value criteria can also be optimized for per day valuation. By default, the maximum FTE Value per day is 0.20


For example, if your center policy on FTE value is 0.10 per day and 0.50 per week, then you can optimize that while creating a new program type using the Add Program Type Setup page.  The set FTE value will be auto-populated on the Add New Program page.  


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Types



5.4. Ability to make a program fee's ledger void

You can now allow the program and billing ledger to get void (By default, the 'Allow Ledger Void' will be set as 'YES'). You can only do that to the existing program fee setup. Select the Edit icon on the Current Program Fees section on the Program Fee setup. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Program and Fees





Earlier, when you edit the Program Name on the Program Setup page, you have to edit the program name and the name on the Program Fee descriptions separately. 

Now, if you edit a Program Name, the associated Program Fee descriptions will also get changed automatically. And it will be reflected in the child profile pages who are all enrolled in that particular program.



6. Setup

6.1. Ability to include Tuition charges into the Tax Statement Billing Configuration


Now, you can include tuition charges into the Tax Statement Billing report, a new column labeled Tuition Charges has been included on the Tax Statement Billing Configuration page.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Tax Statement Billing Item Configuration



6.2. Ability to include the incoming families and children in the Program-Based Recurring Billing

Earlier, you could only include active families and children in the Automatic Recurring Billing. Now you can include incoming families and children also in the Automatic Recurring Billing.


If an incoming child is enrolled in a program that has a program based recurring billing and the child is going to enroll his/her program in the current billing cycle, then they will be added to the current program based recurring billing cycle. 


To enable the Recurring Billing for Incoming Families and Children at the Company Level,


Access Path : Company Dashboard > Setup > Billing Configuration - Company Level



After configuring the Recurring Billing for Incoming Families and Children option at the company level, you can now configure this option on the center level by using the 'Automatic Recurring Billing Rule' option. 


You can optimize this recurring billing for incoming families and children option for both new program based billings and already existing program based billing rules. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Billing > Automatic Recurring Billing Rule





7. Functions

7.1. Ability to view the primary classroom name on the Time Clock page


You can now view the child's primary classroom name on the time clock page. The Primary Classroom name will be displayed at both Sign In/Out page.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Functions > Launch Time Clock




8. Online Forms

8.1. Enhancements on the Add New Form page


Earlier, you cannot select particular classrooms on the Add New Form page at the center level. Now, you can select a particular class(s) on the Add New Form page.



Once the parent uploaded their form, you can view that by using the 'View Parent Uploaded Forms' option.

9. Company Dashboard

9.1. Ability to search Staff details on the Users  Management page and the ability to conduct a parent profile search based on the Role


Now, 1Core has added a separate Staff Profile search tab on the Users Management page. From this search, you can find a particular staff record and edit the details. 


Access Path : Company Dashboard > Users




10. Center Dashboard 

10.1. Repositioning of Classroom Attendance Summary and Child Attendance tab


Earlier, the Classroom Attendance Summary tab and Child Attendance were positioned on the lower right side at the bottom of the Center Dashboard page. 


Now, they have been moved to the upper right corner of the Center Dashboard page.

articles.title: 1CORE PRODUCT UPDATE 28 - DEC - 2020
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. Families
    • 1.1. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Families Page
    • 1.2. Ability to view the Sponsor/Co-Sponsor contact details
    • 1.3. Ability to delete the Co-Sponsor on the Family Profile page
    • 1.4. Ability to send an email directly to the parents on the Families page
    • 1.5. Ability to edit the Authorized Person Name on the Authorized Person Page
  • 2.Children
    • 2.1. Ability to sort the children list by their DOB
    • 2.2. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Children Page
    • 2.3. Ability to view the deleted program billing in the View History
  • 3. Staff
    • 3.1. Ability to Sort the Staff Records list by Staff's First and Last Name 
    • 3.2. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Staff Page
    • 3.3. Enhancements in the Batch Staff PTO Updates
  • 4. Program Enrollment
    • 4.1. Enhancements on the Program Setup page
    • 4.2. Ability to collect/edit 'Registration Fee' at the Program level
    • 4.3. Ability to collect 'Funding Account' at Program Enrollment level 
    • 4.4. Ability to add 'Other Fees' at Payment, Fees and Discount Setup
    • 4.5. Changes in the Enrollment Offer flow
    • 4.6. Changes in the Program Enrollment Dashboard
  • 5. Online Tuition Payment
    • 5.1. Ability to collect the Billing Address on the Card Swipe Payment page
  • 6. Reports 
    • 6.1. Mailing Address Label (Avery 5160) - Ability to create a label for Parent #2
    • 6.2. Children Checked In Without Health Screening
  • 7. Company Dashboard 
    • 7.1. Ability to carry out Parent Account Search with the help of Parent's Cell/Home/Work Phone numbers

1. Families

1.1. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Families Page


To ease your search experience on the Families record list, 1Core has now come with a new search text retain option and an option to toggle between the results.



Access Path: Center Dashboard > Families



Now, two similar results for your search keyword Kevin have been shown to you and you want to find out which Kevin is your intended Kevin from the search. 


You can find that by using two methods,

  • Using Family Status Filter
  • Toggling between Family Profile pages.

Using Family Status Filter :

After getting your results, use the Family Status drop down to filter the search results according to your needs to single out the intended result.



Toggling Between Family Profile Pages:


Select any one of the results and use the Back and Next toggle arrows present on the upper right corner of the family profile page to toggle between the results to find out the intended search result.




 1.2. Ability to view the Sponsor/Co-Sponsor contact details


 You can now view the sponsor/co-sponsor's contact details with Mobile, Home, and Work numbers (15 digits) by selecting the contact icon left to the Parent(s) name on the Families page.



Access Path: Center Dashboard > Families 



1.3. Ability to delete the Co-Sponsor on the Family Profile page


Now you can delete the Co-Sponsor on the Family Profile page. You cannot delete the Co-Sponsor record under certain conditions,

  • You cannot delete a Co-Sponsor if they registered from the Family Portal.
  • You cannot delete a Co-Sponsor if they got a TAP/TPD funding account registered on them.
  • You cannot delete a Co-Sponsor if they got billing and ledger for a child.


1.4. Ability to send an email directly to the parents on the Families page


You can now send emails to parents on the Family profile page. Select the mail icon right to the parents name and a bubble text will open with the parent's mail address. You can send the mail by selecting the email address on the bubble text. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Families > Edit Family > Mail Icon


1.5. Ability to edit the Authorized Person Name on the Authorized Person Page


Earlier there was no option to change the Authorized Person's Name on the Authorized Person page. 


Now, You can edit the Authorised Person Name in different ways. You can edit the Authorized Person Name on the Authorized Person page or If the Authorized person is a registered parent then you can directly edit the parent Name on the Family Profile page. 


The changes made on one page will reflect back to the other.


2.Children


2.1. Ability to sort the children list by their DOB


1Core introduced a sorting icon to the right of the 'DATE OF BIRTH' column in the Children List. You can now sort the enrolled children by their Date of Birth.  


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Children > Children List View


2.2. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Children Page


To ease your search experience on the Children record list, 1Core has now come with a new search text retain option and an option to toggle between the results.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Children





Earlier in the More Filters option, only the 'Active' option was enabled. But now to give 

a comprehensive search experience and results, 'All' options will be selected by default.



2.3. Ability to view the deleted program billing in the View History


Earlier there was no provision to view the 'Deleted' Program Billings and Attendance Billings through the View History option.

Now you can view the 'Deleted' Program and Attendance Billings through the View History option.

You can even view the details of who modified the billing record and when it got modified. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Children > Child Profile > Program and Billing 




3. Staff

3.1. Ability to Sort the Staff Records list by Staff's First and Last Name 


Earlier First and Last Names of the Staffs were kept as a combined entity in a single column in the Staff Records list. 

Now, 1Core has split the First and Last Names into separate columns adjacent to each other and a sorting option is introduced in the First and Last Names to sort the record by their name. 

By default, the list will be sorted by the Last Name of the Staffs. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Staff



 3.2. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Staff Page


To ease your search experience on the Staff record list, 1Core has now come with a new search text retain option and an option to toggle between the results.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Staff




3.3. Enhancements in the Batch Staff PTO Updates


1Core comes with new enhancements in the Batch PTO Updates option. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Functions > Staff > Batch Staff  PTO Updates




4. Program Enrollment

4.1. Enhancements on the Program Setup page

1Core made important user interface enhancements on the Program Setup page. Now, you can view the Currently enrolled children list, count, and FTE value by selecting the Currently Enrolled icon on the program list.



Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Programs and Fees > Program Setup



Selecting the 'Currently Enrolled' option will take you to the detailed program details list which contains the children's names, age groups, classrooms, FTE values, and Program dates.





4.2. Ability to collect/edit 'Registration Fee' at the Program level


Earlier, if you configure 'Registration Fee' in the Program Enrollment then all programs in the enrollment will have the set Registration Fee.


Now, 1Core allows you to configure the 'Registration Fee' at the program level. You can enable/disable the Registration Fee for every program. 


If you want to set the Registration Fee for the program, select the 'Yes' in the 'Do You Want to Collect a Different Registration Fee for this Program?' option. 


If you don't want to collect the Registration Fee for the particular program, select the 'Yes' radio button and change the amount entered in the 'Center Registration Fee' to Zero. 


If you select 'No' for the 'Do You Want to Collect a Different Registration Fee for this Program?' option then the program will be configured with the regular 'Registration Fee'.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Program and Fees


You can change the Registration Fee and other Fee details even after you saved the program. Go to the Program Setup page of a program and edit the set Registration and Other Fees details.


4.3. Ability to collect 'Funding Account' at Program Enrollment level 


Now you can collect the Funding Account at the Center level on the Payment, Fees and Discount Setup page. You have been provided with an option to enable/disable the funding account collection and store before sending the invite to the parents.


Using the 'Do you want to collect and store the Funding Account' option, you can enable an option to collect the funding account details from the parents and store them for future use. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Payment, Fees and Discount Setup


4.4. Ability to add 'Other Fees' at Payment, Fees and Discount Setup

Now you can configure new fees other than Registration Fee, Security Deposit and Tuition. The Fee other than the Registration, Security Deposit, and Tuition is labeled 'Other Fees'. 


You can add multiple different fees with Recurring and One Time billing cycle to the program using the 'Add Other Fees' button from the 'Payment, Fees and Discount Setup' page.


The entered 'Other Fees' will be collected from the parents during the Funding Account Creation.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Payment, Fees and Discount Setup




Note: If the Other Fee is set as Recurring, it will be created as Recurring billing on the Child page and processed with the same billing cycle set for the program.
If the Other Fee is set as One Time, it will be processed only once at the time of funding account creation.


4.5. Changes in the Enrollment Offer flow


1Core made some important changes in the 'Invite a Parent to Enroll' option.


List of enhancements:


  • Ability to offer a program with ZERO tuition fee
  • Ability to enable/disable the funding account collection and store on the 'Invite a Parent to Enroll' page
  • Ability to choose Subsidized status of a family on the 'Invite a Parent to Enroll' page
  • Ability to enable/disable the Added Other Fees on the 'Invite a Parent to Enroll' page
  • Ability to customize the Monthly tuition, Security Deposit, and Registration Fee at the child level



Now you can edit the Billing cycle and Fees on the Invite a Parent to Enroll page. 


If you want to charge a family with a 'Zero Tuition fee', change the Monthly Tuition amount to Zero. So the parent won't be charged with any tuition charge for this program.


4.6. Changes in the Program Enrollment Dashboard


Placement of the Delete option icon present in the New Applications list, Waitlist list, Enrollment Offered, Enrolled, Incoming, and Declined under the Program Enrollment Management page are now repositioned. 


Now You can delete an enrollment record by selecting the particular enrollment record.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Program Enrollment


Screenshot of old Program Enrollment Management page.


Screenshot of New Program Enrollment Management Page




5. Online Tuition Payment


5.1. Ability to collect the Billing Address on the Card Swipe Payment page

Many Payment Providers have mandated the requirement of billing address for a successful transaction in the card payment billing and it is also very crucial for the refund of failed card bill payment.


Keeping these in mind, 1Core has now added a new option to collect the Billing Address on the Card Swipe Payment page. You can collect the Billing Address of Parent 1/ Parent 2.

If you want to collect the Billing Address to something other than Parent 1/ Parent 2's address, you can do that by selecting the 'Other Address' option and the entered 'Other Address' can be used for future billings


Access Path: Center Dashboard >Online Tuition Payment > Card Swipe Payment > Process Card Swipe Payment



6. Reports 

6.1. Mailing Address Label (Avery 5160) - Ability to create a label for Parent #2


You can now create a label for Parent #2. Earlier, you can only create a label for Parent #1. Now you can choose between Parent #1 and Parent #2 for label creation.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Family and Child > Mailing Address Label (Avery 5160)



6.2. Children Checked In Without Health Screening


1Core introduces a new report to check the children who are all checked in without Health Screening. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Daily Health Screening > Children Checked In Without Health Screening

 


7. Company Dashboard 


7.1. Ability to carry out Parent Account Search with the help of Parent's Cell/Home/Work Phone numbers

Earlier, there was no option to find a parent account using their Cell/Home/Work phone numbers on the User Management page. 

Now, 1Core has come with a new option to carry out Parent Account Search with the help of parent's Cell/Home/Work phone number on the User Management Page under Company Dashboard.


For this search, you can use full/part of their phone number to generate a result.


Access Path : Company Dashboard > Users > Parent Account Search
articles.description_text:
TABLE OF CONTENTS   1. Families  1.1. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Families Page  1.2. Ability to view the Sponsor/Co-Sponsor contact details  1.3. Ability to delete the Co-Sponsor on the Family Profile page  1.4. Ability to send an email directly to the parents on the Families page  1.5. Ability to edit the Authorized Person Name on the Authorized Person Page    2.Children  2.1. Ability to sort the children list by their DOB  2.2. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Children Page  2.3. Ability to view the deleted program billing in the View History    3. Staff  3.1. Ability to Sort the Staff Records list by Staff's First and Last Name   3.2. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Staff Page  3.3. Enhancements in the Batch Staff PTO Updates    4. Program Enrollment  4.1. Enhancements on the Program Setup page  4.2. Ability to collect/edit 'Registration Fee' at the Program level  4.3. Ability to collect 'Funding Account' at Program Enrollment level   4.4. Ability to add 'Other Fees' at Payment, Fees and Discount Setup  4.5. Changes in the Enrollment Offer flow  4.6. Changes in the Program Enrollment Dashboard    5. Online Tuition Payment  5.1. Ability to collect the Billing Address on the Card Swipe Payment page    6. Reports   6.1. Mailing Address Label (Avery 5160) - Ability to create a label for Parent #2  6.2. Children Checked In Without Health Screening    7. Company Dashboard   7.1. Ability to carry out Parent Account Search with the help of Parent's Cell/Home/Work Phone numbers     1. Families  1.1. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Families Page     To ease your search experience on the Families record list, 1Core has now come with a new search text retain option and an option to toggle between the results.        Access Path: Center Dashboard > Families
        Now, two similar results for your search keyword Kevin have been shown to you and you want to find out which Kevin is your intended Kevin from the search.      You can find that by using two methods,   Using Family Status Filter  Toggling between Family Profile pages.      Using Family Status Filter :  After getting your results, use the Family Status drop down to filter the search results according to your needs to single out the intended result.          Toggling Between Family Profile Pages:      Select any one of the results and use the Back and Next toggle arrows present on the upper right corner of the family profile page to toggle between the results to find out the intended search result.          1.2. Ability to view the Sponsor/Co-Sponsor contact details      You can now view the sponsor/co-sponsor's contact details with Mobile, Home, and Work numbers (15 digits) by selecting the contact icon left to the Parent(s) name on the Families page.        Access Path: Center Dashboard > Families           1.3. Ability to delete the Co-Sponsor on the Family Profile page     Now you can delete the Co-Sponsor on the Family Profile page. You cannot delete the Co-Sponsor record under certain conditions,   You cannot delete a Co-Sponsor if they registered from the Family Portal.  You cannot delete a Co-Sponsor if they got a TAP/TPD funding account registered on them.  You cannot delete a Co-Sponsor if they got billing and ledger for a child.      1.4. Ability to send an email directly to the parents on the Families page     You can now send emails to parents on the Family profile page. Select the mail icon right to the parents name and a bubble text will open with the parent's mail address. You can send the mail by selecting the email address on the bubble text.      Access Path: Center Dashboard > Families > Edit Family > Mail Icon       1.5. Ability to edit the Authorized Person Name on the Authorized Person Page     Earlier there was no option to change the Authorized Person's Name on the Authorized Person page.      Now, You can edit the Authorised Person Name in different ways. You can edit the Authorized Person Name on the Authorized Person page or If the Authorized person is a registered parent then you can directly edit the parent Name on the Family Profile page.      The changes made on one page will reflect back to the other.     2.Children     2.1. Ability to sort the children list by their DOB     1Core introduced a sorting icon to the right of the 'DATE OF BIRTH' column in the Children List. You can now sort the enrolled children by their Date of Birth.       Access Path: Center Dashboard > Children > Children List View       2.2. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Children Page     To ease your search experience on the Children record list, 1Core has now come with a new search text retain option and an option to toggle between the results.     Access Path: Center Dashboard > Children                  Earlier in the More Filters option, only the 'Active' option was enabled. But now to give   a comprehensive search experience and results, 'All' options will be selected by default.          2.3. Ability to view the deleted program billing in the View History     Earlier there was no provision to view the 'Deleted' Program Billings and Attendance Billings through the View History option.  Now you can view the 'Deleted' Program and Attendance Billings through the View History option.  You can even view the details of who modified the billing record and when it got modified.      Access Path: Center Dashboard > Children > Child Profile > Program and Billing            3. Staff  3.1. Ability to Sort the Staff Records list by Staff's First and Last Name      Earlier First and Last Names of the Staffs were kept as a combined entity in a single column in the Staff Records list.   Now, 1Core has split the First and Last Names into separate columns adjacent to each other and a sorting option is introduced in the First and Last Names to sort the record by their name.   By default, the list will be sorted by the Last Name of the Staffs.      Access Path: Center Dashboard > Staff           3.2. Ability to retain the search text and the ability to toggle between results on the Staff Page     To ease your search experience on the Staff record list, 1Core has now come with a new search text retain option and an option to toggle between the results.     Access Path: Center Dashboard > Staff               3.3. Enhancements in the Batch Staff PTO Updates     1Core comes with new enhancements in the Batch PTO Updates option.      Access Path : Center Dashboard > Functions > Staff > Batch Staff  PTO Updates                4. Program Enrollment  4.1. Enhancements on the Program Setup page  1Core made important user interface enhancements on the Program Setup page. Now, you can view the Currently enrolled children list, count, and FTE value by selecting the Currently Enrolled icon on the program list.        Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Programs and Fees > Program Setup        Selecting the 'Currently Enrolled' option will take you to the detailed program details list which contains the children's names, age groups, classrooms, FTE values, and Program dates.                4.2. Ability to collect/edit 'Registration Fee' at the Program level     Earlier, if you configure 'Registration Fee' in the Program Enrollment then all programs in the enrollment will have the set Registration Fee.     Now, 1Core allows you to configure the 'Registration Fee' at the program level. You can enable/disable the Registration Fee for every program.      If you want to set the Registration Fee for the program, select the 'Yes' in the 'Do You Want to Collect a Different Registration Fee for this Program?' option.      If you don't want to collect the Registration Fee for the particular program, select the 'Yes' radio button and change the amount entered in the 'Center Registration Fee' to Zero.      If you select 'No' for the 'Do You Want to Collect a Different Registration Fee for this Program?' option then the program will be configured with the regular 'Registration Fee'.     Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Program and Fees       You can change the Registration Fee and other Fee details even after you saved the program. Go to the Program Setup page of a program and edit the set Registration and Other Fees details.       4.3. Ability to collect 'Funding Account' at Program Enrollment level      Now you can collect the Funding Account at the Center level on the Payment, Fees and Discount Setup page. You have been provided with an option to enable/disable the funding account collection and store before sending the invite to the parents.     Using the 'Do you want to collect and store the Funding Account' option, you can enable an option to collect the funding account details from the parents and store them for future use.      Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Payment, Fees and Discount Setup       4.4. Ability to add 'Other Fees' at Payment, Fees and Discount Setup  Now you can configure new fees other than Registration Fee, Security Deposit and Tuition. The Fee other than the Registration, Security Deposit, and Tuition is labeled 'Other Fees'.      You can add multiple different fees with Recurring and One Time billing cycle to the program using the 'Add Other Fees' button from the 'Payment, Fees and Discount Setup' page.     The entered 'Other Fees' will be collected from the parents during the Funding Account Creation.     Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup > Program Enrollment > Payment, Fees and Discount Setup             Note: If the Other Fee is set as Recurring, it will be created as Recurring billing on the Child page and processed with the same billing cycle set for the program.
If the Other Fee is set as One Time, it will be processed only once at the time of funding account creation.     4.5. Changes in the Enrollment Offer flow      1Core made some important changes in the 'Invite a Parent to Enroll' option.       List of enhancements:      Ability to offer a program with ZERO tuition fee   Ability to enable/disable the funding account collection and store on the 'Invite a Parent to Enroll' page  Ability to choose Subsidized status of a family on the 'Invite a Parent to Enroll' page  Ability to enable/disable the Added Other Fees on the 'Invite a Parent to Enroll' page  Ability to customize the Monthly tuition, Security Deposit, and Registration Fee at the child level          Now you can edit the Billing cycle and Fees on the Invite a Parent to Enroll page.      If you want to charge a family with a 'Zero Tuition fee', change the Monthly Tuition amount to Zero. So the parent won't be charged with any tuition charge for this program.       4.6. Changes in the Program Enrollment Dashboard     Placement of the Delete option icon present in the New Applications list, Waitlist list, Enrollment Offered, Enrolled, Incoming, and Declined under the Program Enrollment Management page are now repositioned.      Now You can delete an enrollment record by selecting the particular enrollment record.     Access Path: Center Dashboard > Program Enrollment     Screenshot of old Program Enrollment Management page.     Screenshot of New Program Enrollment Management Page         5. Online Tuition Payment     5.1. Ability to collect the Billing Address on the Card Swipe Payment page  Many Payment Providers have mandated the requirement of billing address for a successful transaction in the card payment billing and it is also very crucial for the refund of failed card bill payment.     Keeping these in mind, 1Core has now added a new option to collect the Billing Address on the Card Swipe Payment page. You can collect the Billing Address of Parent 1/ Parent 2.  If you want to collect the Billing Address to something other than Parent 1/ Parent 2's address, you can do that by selecting the 'Other Address' option and the entered 'Other Address' can be used for future billings      Access Path: Center Dashboard >Online Tuition Payment > Card Swipe Payment > Process Card Swipe Payment          6. Reports   6.1. Mailing Address Label (Avery 5160) - Ability to create a label for Parent #2     You can now create a label for Parent #2. Earlier, you can only create a label for Parent #1. Now you can choose between Parent #1 and Parent #2 for label creation.     Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Family and Child > Mailing Address Label (Avery 5160)          6.2. Children Checked In Without Health Screening     1Core introduces a new report to check the children who are all checked in without Health Screening.      Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Daily Health Screening > Children Checked In Without Health Screening        7. Company Dashboard      7.1. Ability to carry out Parent Account Search with the help of Parent's Cell/Home/Work Phone numbers  Earlier, there was no option to find a parent account using their Cell/Home/Work phone numbers on the User Management page.   Now, 1Core has come with a new option to carry out Parent Account Search with the help of parent's Cell/Home/Work phone number on the User Management Page under Company Dashboard.     For this search, you can use full/part of their phone number to generate a result.      Access Path : Company Dashboard > Users > Parent Account Search

articles.title: 1CORE PRODUCT UPDATES - OCT 22 2020
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS


1. Family Profile – Ability to Copy contact info from Parent #1

2. Family Profile – Ability to send an Online Tuition Payment Invitation 

3. Children – Provision to view the Classroom in the Children List

4. Program Enrollment - Ability to resend the Enrollment Offer email

5. Program Enrollment – Edit Effective End Date and Revise Fee for a Program

6. Rollcall Sheet Report - Filters and Additions

7. Center Attendance Summary Report – Provision to include/exclude the Classroom Summary

8. Birthday Report – Sort the report based on the Month 

9. eMessage - Filter to select Classroom and Date 

10.Staff Payroll Hours Setup

  • 10.1 Payroll Hours Attendance – Round Off
  • 10.2 Calculate OT Hours

1. Family Profile – Ability to Copy contact info from Parent #1


1Core comes with a new option labeled ‘Copy Contact Info from Parent#1’ on the Add New Family page. You can click this to copy and paste the contact information from Parent#1 to Parent#2. 


This will reduce your efforts to enter the Parent#2 contact information. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Families > Add Family > Parent #2

 



2. Family Profile – Ability to send an Online Tuition Payment Invitation 


Now, you can send an “Online Tuition Payment Invitation” to a parent when you add/edit a family.

 

 Access Path: Center Dashboard > Families > Add/Edit Family


The invitation will be sent to the parent in the following cases,


New Family:


While adding a new family, a pop-up invite will be displayed at the end, after you have clicked on the save button.


Existing Family:


  • Single Ledger - This Popup invite will get displayed until one of the parents is registered in Online Tuition Payment.
  • Multiple Ledger - This Popup invite will get displayed until both the parents are registered in Online Tuition Payment.


If you select the option “Do not remind me about this family again”, then the pop-up will not be displayed again for that family.



3. Children – Provision to view the Classroom in the Children List

 

A new column “Classroom” has been added to the Children List.

The classroom column will have the classroom details of the enrolled children along with their family.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Children > Children List View



4. Program Enrollment - Ability to resend the Enrollment Offer email


You can now resend the Enrollment Offer email to the parent.


If the parents missed the earlier emails or the earlier emails have not resulted in a successful conversion, then you can resend the email by using this option.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Program Enrollment > Enrollment Offered





5. Program Enrollment – Edit Effective End Date and Revise Fee for a Program


With a new feature introduced in 1Core, you can  “Revise Fee” for each program. Now, editing programs are split into two setups.

  • Program Settings – You can view the program settings like Program Name, Scheduled days, FTE value, etc.
  • Program Fee – You can edit the effective date, add program fee for monthly/weekly, and revise the fee for a program.


Access Path: Center Dashboard  > Setup  > Program Enrollment  > Program & Fees >  Program Fee






  • Earlier,'Revise Program Fees' on the 'Functions' page were processed in batch-wise. Now, clicking the 'Revise Fee' button from the Program Fees' page will allow you to revise the fee for a particular program while setting the effective start date.






  • You can click the 'Confirm' button to save the revised fee for the program.
  • Upon confirmation, you can also revise the fee for the children who are associated with the same program.


6. Rollcall Sheet Report - Filters and Additions


On the Rollcall Sheet, you are provided with two new options as follows:

  • Select Month - Monthly / Weekly period selection
  • Print Schedule - Include / Exclude the schedule on the report

Also, the total number of children by the classroom is displayed at the bottom of the Rollcall sheet. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Attendance >  Rollcall Sheet




7. Center Attendance Summary Report – Provision to include/exclude the Classroom Summary


You can use the new filter labeled “Print Classroom Summary“ to include/exclude the classroom summary.


Access Path: Center Dashboard >  Reports > Time Tracking Attendance > Center Attendance Summary






8. Birthday Report – Sort the report based on the Month 


From now onward, in the Birthday Report, children will be sorted based on their Date of Birth. Earlier children were arranged by their first names.

Sort order is given as below, 

  • Classroom
  • Month 
  • Date
  • Year 
  • Child Name


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Family & Child > Birthday Report


9. eMessage - Filter to select Classroom and Date 


You are now provided with new filter to select a classroom while sending the eMessage.

Also, you can select the Effective Start Date and End Date for the eMessage to be displayed for the parent.


Access Path: Center Dashboard >  Functions > Time & Tracking >  eMessage Families > Add New Message







10.Staff Payroll Hours Setup


1Core has grouped the following configurations under the “Staff Payroll Hours Setup” page.

  • Round up the Payroll Hours from the Attendance (new)
  • Calculate OT Hours (new)
  • Lock the Staff time card
  • Allow director to edit time card
  • Time Sheet Pay Period


Access path: Company Dashboard > Setup >  Staff > Staff Payroll Hours Setup



10.1 Payroll Hours Attendance – Round Off


You are introduced with the following new Round Off features for the Payroll Hours:

  • Actual Hours – Displays the actual staff Sign In and Out hours
  • 5 Mins Round-Up – Calculates 5 Mins “Round Off” for the Sign In and Out hours

Example: Staff Signed In at 7.53 am and Signed Out at 3.22 pm

Signed In will be rounded up to 7.55 am

Signed Out will be rounded down to 3.20 pm

  • 10 Mins Round-Up – Calculates 10 Mins “Round Off” for the Sign In and Out hours. 

Example: Staff Signed In at 7.53 am and Signed Out at 3.27 pm

Signed In will be rounded down to 7.50 am

Signed Out will be rounded up to 3.30 pm 

  • 15 Mins Round-Up – Calculates 15 Mins round-up for the Sign In and Out hours 

Example: Staff Signed In at 7.53 am and Signed Out at 3.22 pm

Signed In will be rounded up to 8 am

Signed Out will be rounded down to 3.15 pm



The Round-Up Hours will be displayed in the following reports (Actual Hours will not be displayed in the reports but can be viewed on the screen as mentioned in the screenshot)

  1. Staff Time Sheet Report (Individual, Center level and Company Level) 
  2. Staff Hours Summary Report (Center level and company level) 
  3. Staff Classroom Attendance Report 
  4. Staff Claim form report (Canada Companies) 
  5. Classroom Attendance Details report (OClass Centers) 
  6. Hourly Staff Actual vs. Budgeted Hours Report (Company level) 
  7. Staff Missing Signout Report 
  8. Gusto Payroll Report 
  9. Children and Staff time card report



10.2 Calculate OT Hours


You are provided with the following new configurations for calculating OT Hours.

1. No OT Hours - By enabling this configuration, the OT Hours will NOT be calculated for the staff time cards. In this case, you must choose an option between "Pay Standard Hours Only" and "Pay Actual Hours".

  • Pay Standard Hours only – Total scheduled hours per day as specified in the Staff Schedule section.
  • Pay Actual Hours – Total actual hours (sign in/out time) per day as captured in the Staff Time Card.


 


2. Daily Hours > 8 Hours – By enabling this configuration, the OT Hours will be calculated automatically for the time card which is greater than 8 hours in a day.



3. Weekly Hours > 40 Hours - By enabling this configuration, the OT Hours will be calculated automatically for the time card which is greater than 40 hours in a week.



By enabling any one of these two configurations Daily Hours > 8 Hours, Weekly Hours > 40 Hours, the following two options will be displayed. 

  • Automatically Apply OT Hours - The system will automatically apply OT Hours if the daily hours are greater than Standard Hours (Scheduled Hours) of the staff. If the staff does not have a schedule, then it will apply OT Hours when the daily hours gets greater than 8 Hours.



 

  • Show Me OT Hours, I will update manually – The system will not apply OT Hours automatically and you must update it manually.

articles.title: 1CORE FAMILY APP UPDATES - Family Portal Sign up through the App / Ability To Select Multiple Centers / Health Screen options for Authorized Person
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS


  • 1. Introduction
  • 2. Parents - Self Sign Up using Family App
  • 3. Ability to Associate Centers Across Companies
  • 4. Ability for Parent to add Authorized Person 
  • 5. Authorized Person– Invite/Edit /Revoke options
  • 6. Child Attendance Notification in Dashboard
  • 7. Immunization Notification to Parents



1. Introduction


1Core introduces the following additional features with the “Family App”.

  • Parents - Self Sign Up using Family App 
  • Ability to associate centers across companies (Multiple Schools)
  • Ability for Parent to add Authorized Person
  • Authorized Person - Add/Edit/Invite/Revoke 
  • Child Attendance Reminder notification in Dashboard
  • Immunization Notification for Parents


2. Parents - Self Sign Up using Family App


Parent can sign up (create Family portal Account) directly through the “1Core Family App” instead of getting an Invitation from the School Director. 

The process for Self-Sign Up is as follows:










3. Ability to Associate Centers Across Companies


Now, 1Core introduces the new feature in the Family App where parents with same email address have the ability to select Centers and switch from one to center to another center whenever required.




4. Ability for Parent to add Authorized Person 


Now, the Parent will be able to add a new Authorized Person for their child.




5. Authorized Person– Invite/Edit /Revoke options


Now, 1Core introduces the following options for Authorized Persons.

Invite    àParents can invite the Authorized Person to register for the family app to pick up their child.

Edit      àTo edit the existing Authorized Person details

RevokeàTo revoke the Authorized Person permission








Note: Authorized Person can also complete the registration by using the “Sign Up Now” option.





6. Child Attendance Notification in Dashboard

 

Now, Parent can see the Child Attendance Notification in Dashboard.

Parent can also disable the notification in the Notification Settings.




7. Immunization Notification to Parents


Now, 1Core introduces the Immunization Notification in Family App.

To enable the medical expiration for the center please email to “support@1coresolution.com”. Up on the enabling the Medication Expiration a notification will be sent to the parent. In order to receive the expiration notification, parents have to enable the same under the settings tab in the Family App.

articles.title: 1CORE PRODUCT UPDATES - AUG 31 2020
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS


  • 1 Introducing Crop option in photo upload – Child and Family Profile
  • 2 Child Record - Ability to delete the Emergency Contact/Authorized Pickup
  • 3 Child Schedule - New grid view
  • 4 Child Program & Billing - Provision to enter “Program End Date” for new programs
  • 5 Post Ledger - Posting Date and Child Name - default values
  • 6 Ability to select the number of records to view - Families, Children and Staff 
  • 7 Batch Family/Child Status Update
  • 8 Program Types Setup - Provision to collect FTE value
  • 9 Program Enrollment - Ability to send the “Enrollment Offer mail” to Parent 2
  • 10 Program Enrollment - Provision to view all the documents associated with the child 
  • 11 Staff Record - Provision to view the Username 



1 Introducing Crop option in photo upload – Child and Family Profile


Now, 1Core introduced a Crop option while uploading Child and Parent photo under child and family profile.

Access Path: Center Dashboard à Children à Select Child à Upload Image

Access Path: Center Dashboard à Families à Select Family à Upload Image



2 Child Record - Ability to delete the Emergency Contact/Authorized Pickup

 

Now, 1Core provides an option to delete the Emergency Contact/Authorized Pickup.

Access path: Center Dashboard à Children à Edit Child à Emergency Contact/Authorized Pickup



3 Child Schedule - New grid view


1Core provides the ability to display the schedule in a grid view. Schedule can be hidden or displayed by clicking the icon.

Access path: Center Dashboard à Children à Program & Billing 


4 Child Program & Billing - Provision to enter “Program End Date” for new programs

 

Now, 1Core provides the ability to enter the program end date when adding a new program in the child page 

Access path: Center Dashboard à Children à Program & Billing à New Program


5 Post Ledger - Posting Date and Child Name - default values

 

When the Director post a ledger by using “Post Ledger Item”, the current date and the child name will be displayed by default.

Access Path: Center Dashboard à Families à Select Family à Ledger à Post Ledger Item


6 Ability to select the number of records to view - Families, Children and Staff 


Now, 1Core introduces the feature to select the number of entries displayed in a Families, Children and Staff list page. The page will display 50 entries by default.

6.1.Families:


6.2.Children:


6.3.Staff:


7 Batch Family/Child Status Update


Earlier, Active status family and child can be changed to Inactive only.

Now, 1Core introduced the option to change the status from Active to COVID-19 and vice versa. 

Access path: Center Dashboard à Functions à Family & Child à Batch Family/Child Status Update



8 Program Types Setup - Provision to collect FTE value


1Core provides the ability to collect the FTE value in Program Types Setup.

While adding / updating the Program, FTE value should be pre-populated in the respective field based on the Program Type.

Allow the user to update the 'FTE' value in the Program level also.

Access path: Center Dashboard à Setup à Program Enrollment àProgram Types 


9 Program Enrollment - Ability to send the “Enrollment Offer mail” to Parent 2

 

Earlier, the Director can send the Enrollment Offer to Parent #1 only.

Now, 1Core introduced the feature to select “Parent 1” or “Parent 2” to send the Enrollment Offer invitation.

Access path: Center Dashboard à Program Enrollment à Invite a Parent to Enroll 


10 Program Enrollment - Provision to view all the documents associated with the child 

 

1Core has now introduced a new section “Other Documents” Under the enrolled child tab.

All the documents signed by the parent for the child will be displayed in the enrolled program under the section "Other Documents" even though the signed program for a child is deleted.

Access Path: Center Dashboard à Program Enrollment à Enrolled 



11 Staff Record - Provision to view the Username 

Now, the “Username” for the Staff Portal can be viewed in the staff record.

Access path: Center Dashboard à Staff à Edit Staff

articles.title: 1CORE PRODUCT UPDATE - AUG 07 2020
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS


1.Center Dashboard Changes

  • 1.1 Capacity Screenshot
  • 1.2 Enrolled Screenshot
  • 1.3 Enrolled FTE Screenshot
  • 1.4 Occupancy Screenshot 
  • 1.5 New Applications Screenshot
  • 1.6 Newly Enrolled Screenshot
  • 1.7 Incoming Screenshot
  • 1.8 To be Withdrawn Screenshot

2.Program Enrollment Dashboard – New Incoming Status (NEW)

3.Parent Can Use Same Email Address Across Companies

4.Use the same email across the portals (director, staff, family)

5.Child Profile – Changes

6.Child - Program & Billing Changes

7.Provision to View Updates Made by Parent via Family Portal

8.Displays E-Signed Document under Online Forms even after the Program is deleted under child Program Page

9.Ability to pay the Registration Fee for Canada (Bambora) – Program Enrollment

10.Visitor Health Screening – New



1.Center Dashboard Changes


Center Dashboard has been revised as follows.



Newly Enrolled     àDisplay the no of Newly Enrolled in the last 30 days


To be Enrolled       àDisplay the no of Incoming child record with in the next 30 Day period.

                                   

To be Withdrawn àDisplay the no of child record to be withdrawn with in the next 30 Day period.

                                       

1.1 Capacity Screenshot



1.2 Enrolled Screenshot


The programs with Active and Completed status are included in the Enrolled count.

The programs with Deleted status are not included in this count.


1.3 Enrolled FTE Screenshot



1.4 Occupancy Screenshot 



1.5 New Applications Screenshot


1.6 Newly Enrolled Screenshot



1.7 Incoming Screenshot



1.8 To be Withdrawn Screenshot



2.Program Enrollment Dashboard – New Incoming Status (NEW)


 1Core has introduced a new status “Incoming” under Program Enrollment Dashboard.

  • Enrolled – It will display the children whose Enrollment Start Date is within the current date and display the programs irrespective of the status. 
  • Incoming - It will display the children with future Enrollment Start Date



The column name “Enrolled Date/Desired Enrollment Start Date” is changed as “Program Start Date” in all the following places:

  • New Application Tab
  • Change Program Request Tab
  • Waitlist Tab
  • Enrollment Offer Tab
  • Declined Tab


3.Parent Can Use Same Email Address Across Companies


Now, 1Core allows the parents to use the same email address across companies (multiple Schools)

Key points regarding this implementation:

Company/Center Perspective:

  • No changes in the functionality or flow.


Manage Parent Accounts:


  • Parent email address and password is unique across the companies. When the email/password is updated in one company, parent must use the updated email and password for other company too. Email address change is applied on Family Record of both the companies.


  •   When the parent user account is made inactive in a company, it will not create any impact with the parent account in other company. The Parent will be able to login with other company.


  • Email Template for Family Portal Invitation has been modified and the image is provided below for the same

 

Parent Perspective:

  • When a parent login through the Family Portal, they will be provided with a center selection screen.

 

  • When a parent registers through Program/Camp enrollment using the 1Core link, the system automatically will redirect them to the respective center.  Here, parent will not be provided with the center selection.

 

  • When the parent changes the email address in their Family Portal, it will be updated under the family records with all the associated Companies and its Centers.


Example:

“ABC Schools” has two centers associated with it “DAV School” and “SBOA School”.

“XYZ Schools” has one center named “Manhattan”.

Multi-center selection across companies:



Family Portal Invitation:



4.Use the same email across the portals (director, staff, family)


Earlier, same email address cannot be used with multiple portals. Registration and login issues were there when they use the same email address for Parent/Staff/Director. 

Now, the same email address can be used in following portals:

  • Director Portal: https://app.1core.com 
  • Staff Portal: https://staff.1core.com 
  • Family Portal: https://family.1core.com 

Example: marybeth@1coresolution.com can be registered and used with all three portals.


5.Child Profile – Changes


The following highlighted fields are moved to the Child Information Section. Earlier this was part of Class Information section.

  • Child ID Code
  • Child Status
  • Enrollment Start Date 
  • Withdrawal Date 
  • Withdrawal Reason

Access Path: Center Dashboard à Children à Select Child



6.Child - Program & Billing Changes

 


7.Provision to View Updates Made by Parent via Family Portal


Now, 1Core provides the ability to view the updates made by a parent through Family Portal. 

This option will be displayed under Functions regardless of updates. 

Access path: Center Dashboard à Functions à Family Records à View Updates Made via Family Portal



8.Displays E-Signed Document under Online Forms even after the Program is deleted under child Program Page


Now, the E-Signed documents are displayed under the families Online Forms even though the program is deleted in the child’s program page.




9.Ability to pay the Registration Fee for Canada (Bambora) – Program Enrollment

 

Earlier, if the center has the Registration Fee for the Program Enrollment, then it is not implemented in the Enrollment Offer flow. So, the payment failed while processing the Registration Fee.

Now, the Parent can enroll the program after paying the Registration Fee successfully in the Enrollment Offer flow.



10.Visitor Health Screening – New

 

1Core introduces a new function “Visitor management”. Here, the User can add the visitor and collect the answers for health screening questions.

Based on their answers, the visitor will/will not be allowed inside the School.


Access Path: Center Dashboard à Functions à Visitor Health Screening à Visitor Health Screen

articles.title: 1CORE PRODUCT UPDATES – JULY 02 2020
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  1. Provision to select Child Lives with option with online Registration
  2. QR Code Generation Frequency Set as Weekly by Default
  3. Ability to bill Attendance-based billing for 1Core Class Attendance
  4. Health Screening Enhancements – 1Core Web 
    1. Ability to Add / Edit the Health Screening Questions
    2. Ability to Add / Edit answers for the health screening Questions
  5. Include Portal column in Staff Records

1. Provision to select "Child Lives with" option with online Registration

 

1Core now provides the ability for parents to select “Child lives with” when they register for programs after receiving the enrollment offer.

This option will be displayed under Child Info Page.

                     


 

           



2. QR Code Generation Frequency Set as Weekly by Default

 

Now, the QR Code Generation Frequency is set as Weekly by default.

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Functions--->Time & Tracking--->QR Code for Attendance--->QR Code Setup

 

  


3. Ability to bill attendance-based billing for 1Core Class Attendance

 

1Core has introduced an option to bill the attendance-based billing based on 1Core Class movement Sign in / Sign out.

Access Path: Company Dashboard--->Locations--->Edit Center--->Attendance based billing is based on Classroom Movement

When this option is enabled, Attendance-based billing will be calculated based on the 1Core Class Attendance.

By Default, it will be set as “Time Clock” only.

 

 

 

The following reports can be generated, when Attendance billing is setup as based on Classroom Movement.

  • Children Currently Checked In
  • Center Attendance Summary
  • Failure to Sign Out
  • Sign Out (Late Pick-up) Report
  • Billing by Attendance
  • Child Time Card with Absences Report
  • Children and Staff Signed in by Classroom
  • Contracted vs Actual Hours
  • Child Absence based on Child Schedule
  • Child Time Card Report by Subsidy Agencies
  • Child Time Card
  • Child Time Card with Absences


4. Health Screening Enhancements – 1Core Web 


Ability to Add / Edit the Health Screening Questions:

1Core has provided the ability for Center Director to Add / Edit the health screening questions with the web Interface

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Setup--->Attendance--->Daily Health Screening Setup

               *Click Add Question to add new Health Screening Questions

               * Enter the Question, Select category and Save.

             

   

       


       Click on the Edit Icon to edit already existing questions.

       Make the Changes and Save.

     

      

 

a. Ability to Add / Edit answers for the health screening Questions

1Core has provided a new option where Director can add the answers for health screening questions with the Web interface.

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Children--->Child Record--->Health Screening 

*Click on the Health Screening Icon to view the record for the child

*Click Update Health Screening to record the answers for health screening questions with 1Core Web

 

 

 

*By default, system display the Current Date. Director can select a past Date if required.

*Select Yes/No and click Save to record the answers for a child.

 

     

 

b. Edit the Recorded Answers

1Core has provided a new option to edit the already recorded answers for the health screening questions under the child page.

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Children--->Child Record--->Health Screening 

*Click Update Health Screening to edit the recorded answers for the child

*The Director can edit the already recorded answers for the child and make changes if required and click Save


 

 

                       


5. Include Portal column in Staff Records

 

1Core has provided a new column “Portal Access “under Staff Records Home Page.

When a Staff registered for a Staff Portal Account, the portal Access will be displayed as “YES”

When a Staff is not registered for a Staff Portal Account, the portal Access will be displayed as “NO”

Access Path: Center Dashboard-->Staff

articles.title: Batch Postings by Family / Transaction Type / Classroom
articles.description:
1Core allows the Center Directors to do Special Batch Postings to the Family Account Ledger as follows.


Access Path: Center Dashboard---> Functions---> Batch Post by Family / Transaction Type / Classroom

 

 

 

 

Batch Post by Family: This function can be used, when the same charge applies for all the families.


* Choose a Posting date.

* Select a Transaction Type and Description.

* Enter the amount and comments.

* Select the Families applicable and post.

 

 

 

  

Batch Post by Transaction: This function can be used, when different charges apply for the families.


* Choose a Posting date.

* Select a Transaction Type and Description.

* Enter the amount and comments for each family and post.

 

 

 

Batch post by Classroom: This function can be used, when same amount applies for all the child with in a classroom.

 

* Select the Family and Child Status 

* Select the Classroom for which you want to post the charges.

* Choose a Posting date.

* Select a Transaction Type and Description.

* Enter the amount and comments and post.

articles.title: Agency / 3rd Party /Subsidy Billing & Payment
articles.description:
What is The Purpose

This user guide covers the steps in 1Core in the setup, billing and payment related to subsidy agencies (in 1Core it is called 3rd Party Agency). 1Core maintains a separate Agency Ledger to track all the agency related billing and payments.

 

 

3rd Party (Subsidy) Agency Setup

If your center accept 3rd party subsidized agency payments, the first step is to setup the 3rd party agency in 1Core.

 

Center Dashboard --> Setup --> Other àAdd/Edit 3rd Party Agency


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


When a 3rd party agency record is created, the system automatically creates a ledger for the agency.

 

 



Flag a Family as Subsidized Family

In order for the subsidized function to work, the next step is to flag all subsidized families. To do that you need to go to the Family record and check "Subsidized" check box in the Family Type field within the Family Info section of the family record as shown below:

 

 

 


 Setup up Recurring Billing to 3rd Party Agency

 Once you have flagged a family as subsidized family, when you go to the Child Billing section within the child record, you are able to setup billing items for the 3rd party agency. Note: If "Subsidized" family type is not checked, the agency ledger is NOT available to be selected in the Ledger Type.

 

There are two methods to setup recurring billing for subsidized families:


Say the child tuition is $300 per month. The 3rd party agency has indicated that it will pay $216 and the parent has a $84 co-pay.

 

(a) Parent Co-Pay Net Amount Method

In this method you would setup 2 billing items in the Program and Billing section of the child record. The first billing item is to bill the 3rd party agency ledger for $216. The second billing item is to bill the Sponsor (parent) ledger for the $84 parent co-pay as show below:

 

 

 

In the parent co-pay method, the parent ledger is less cluttered and it is the more straight forward. However, the subsidized parents do not see the full tuition amount on their account statement.

 

(b) Subsidy Offset Method

 

In this method you would setup 3 billing items in the child billing section of the child record. First is to bill the 3rd party agency ledger for the total subsidy amount. Next you setup 2 billing items in the Sponsor ledger. The first sponsor billing item is the parent full tuition. Then the 2rd associated billing item is a "subsidy offset" which is equal to the subsidy amount. This net of 2nd and 3rd billing item in the Sponsor ledger is equal to what the parent owes as the parent co-pay.


 

 

In the Subsidy Offset method, the subsidized parents do see their full tuition in their account ledger and statement.

 

Note: Depending on the method you choose, you would need to setup a tuition charge billing item called "Parent Co-pay" or a credit billing item called "Subsidy Offset" under Billing Item Setup.

 

In either method, when the automatic recurring runs, the system automatically post the respective billing items to the parent and the agency ledger.

The first billing item is to bill the 3rd party agency ledger for $216. The second billing item is to bill the Sponsor (parent) ledger for the $84 parent co-pay as show below:           In the parent co-pay method, the parent ledger is less cluttered and it is the more straight forward. However, the subsidized parents do not see the full tuition amount on their account statement.     (b) Subsidy Offset Method     In this method you would setup 3 billing items in the child billing section of the child record. articles.title: Agency Payment Posting with Automatic Application
articles.description:
When you receive a payment from the Agency, you should use the following function:

 

Center Dashboard--> Functions --> Agency --> Agency Payment Posting with Automatic Application

                                                                                                       


Subsidy Agencies typically pay for multiple children with a single check or bank direct deposit. With each payment, the Agency provides a statement indicating which children and charges are being paid for. This Agency Posting function is designed to help you allocate the Agency Payment to the respective children accurately as shown below.


 

First, select the billing and posting related information related to the payment received:


 
 



 Next, enter the agency payment amount for each child as outlined in the agency statement:

 


Note: Click on the “Calculate Total” button when you are done entering the payments for all the children. Only when the calculated total equals to the check amount, the “Next” button will be enabled.

 

 

 



 

On the next screen, the system will calculate and apply the difference between the payment amount and the billed amount. The Underpayment and Overpayment will be automatically calculated and placed on the column shown below:

 

�    Underpayment

o Left as outstanding balance from Agency 

o Transfer to Sponsor’s (Parent) leger

o Write-off � Overpayment

o Left as outstanding overpayment from Agency

o True-up (automatically create a tuition charge to the agency ledger to true up the billing amount to match the agency payment amount)

 

 


Once everything looks correct, click on the “Next” button to do final review before submitting to post these transactions to the ledgers.

articles.title: 1Core Attend Kiosk eMessage Function
articles.description:
eMessage to Authorized Person(s) via 1Core Attend Kiosk 

1Core allows the Center Admin Users to send eMessages to selective group or all authorized persons via the 1Core Attend Kiosk app.


Note:  The eMessages will ONLY be shown on the 1Core Attend Kiosk, and not anywhere else.


To create the eMessage, follow the access path below:


Access Path: Center Dashboard---> Functions --->Time and Tracking -->  eMessage Families




Click on the "Add New Message" button.




Filter and select the Authorized Person that you would like send the eMessage and then click on "Continue" button.


You will be presented with a list of Authorized Persons. Select all or a subset of the authorized persons and click on "Continue" button.

Next you can specify the display duration and frequency of the eMessage to display before composing the appropriate eMessage.  



Review the eMessage before you send. Click "Confirm" button once you are ready to send.


You will send a confirmation that the eMessage will be sent to the selected authorized person(s).



HOW eMESSAGE IS DISPLAYED


When the Authorized Person enters their PIN into the 1Core Attend Kiosk.


The eMessage will be shown to them.



After viewing the eMessage, the Authorized Person can proceed to Sign in/out the child.

HOW eMESSAGE IS DISPLAYED     When the Authorized Person enters their PIN into the 1Core Attend Kiosk.       The eMessage will be shown to them.          After viewing the eMessage, the Authorized Person can proceed to Sign in/out the child.

articles.title: 1Core Email Handling/Protocol
articles.description:
Email communication is used extensively in 1Core.  There are 3 types of emails which the users can send from 1Core:

  • Instant ad-hoc emails
  • System generated emails
  • Customizable emails using templates


All emails sent from 1Core will have support@1core.com in the From field. If the recipients reply to the emails, the reply will be delivered based on the type of email as follows: 

  • support@1core.com
  • The login user/sender email
  • The center director contact email maintained in the center location record in 1Core


Attached is an Excel with more details about each type of email you can send and the send from and reply to addresses.

If the recipients reply to the emails, the reply will be delivered based on the type of email as follows:    support@1core.com  The login user/sender email  The center director contact email maintained in the center location record in 1Core      Attached is an Excel with more details about each type of email you can send and the send from and reply to addresses.

articles.title: Failed Card/ACH Notification Mail
articles.description:
The system will not send the Failed Card Transaction notification to the Director & the Parent for CARD One Time Payment.


But if it is a ACH One Time Payment, the system will send the Failed ACH Transaction notification mail to the Director & the Parent

If the failed payment is a Batch/Recurring payments with any message, then the notification mail will send to Director and Parent for both Card and ACH

articles.title: Send Family Portal Invitation Email
articles.description:
Family Portal registration invitation can be sent as follows.

 

Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Communications-->Send Family Portal Invitation Email

 

* Select existing Families

* Click Submit

* Select the families and click continue at the bottom

* To modify text (check "Show last modified message") below the description box, make any changes if required and  send.

 

Note: The email will be sent with in 30 minutes from the time you hit Send.




Note: 

* For the first time, the family will be displayed under "Invitation Not Sent" Tab.

* After when the invitation is sent the family will be displayed under "Invitation Sent But Not Yet Registered" Tab.

* Once after when the parent register for an account, the family will be displayed under "Already Registered" Tab.
articles.description_text: Family Portal registration invitation can be sent as follows.     Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Communications-->Send Family Portal Invitation Email     * Select existing Families  * Click Submit  * Select the families and click continue at the bottom  * To modify text (check "Show last modified message") below the description box, make any changes if required and  send.     Note: The email will be sent with in 30 minutes from the time you hit Send.             Note:   * For the first time, the family will be displayed under "Invitation Not Sent" Tab.  * After when the invitation is sent the family will be displayed under "Invitation Sent But Not Yet Registered" Tab.  * Once after when the parent register for an account, the family will be displayed under "Already Registered" Tab.

articles.title: Staff Portal Registration
articles.description:
1Core now allows the Classroom Staff to have their own Staff Portal Account. 


Staff Account Purpose:


With registering online for an account the staff will be able to do the following.
* View / Edit their Profile information.
* View/ Change the their Password & sign in /sign out code
* View their Time Card entries/ PTO/Absence record.
* Have the ability to email Location Director.
* Download their Absence / Timesheet / Summary Hour Reports.

* Will be able to email the 1Core Support team, using the Questions link.





The Staff Portal Registration invite can be sent as follows:


Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Communication--->Staff Portal Registrations.


*Select the Staff Record

*Click on "Email Selected Staff to Create Portal Account"

*The registration invitation will be sent only to the Staff's Primary Email Id.




* All the Staff Record will be displayed under "Invitation Not Sent" tab by default.

* Once when the invitation is sent they will get moved under "Invitation Sent But Not Yet Registered" tab.

* After when they register for their Staff Account, the record will get moved to "Already Registered" tab.


The Admin User can also find if the Staff is registered to the Staff Portal or not under Staff Record.


* If the Portal Access for a Staff says "YES", then the staff is registered for the Online Staff Account.

* If the Portal Access for a Staff says "NO", then the staff is not registered for the Online Staff Account.
