articles.title: Text Messages for Parent / Staff / Camp Parents
articles.description:
1Core allows its Center Admin Users to Send Text Messages to their Parents / Staff / Camp Parents whenever required.


Note: Text Message option can be added as an additional module for 10$ per month.


Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Communication--->Text Message to parents / Text Message to Staff / Text Message To Camp Parents


Text Message To Parents:


* Enter the Text Message.

* Select the Families.

* Confirm and Send.



Text Message to Staff:


* Enter the Text Message.

* Select the Staff.

* Confirm and Send.




Text Message to Camp Families:


* Select the Camp/Event Type

* Select the Session

* Enter the Text Message 

* Select the Families / Confirm and Send.




The Text Messages sent from the center can be viewed under Text Message History.

articles.title: TAP Functions for Director to Manage the Parents TAP Accounts
articles.description:
There are a number of TAP functions designed for the Director to manage the parents TAP accounts.

 


Clicking on the Total Active Payors Enrolled in TAP link will give you a list of the TAP families.  


Under the Action column, the Director has the following functions:

  • To dis-enroll a family from TAP 
  • Help replace the parent funding account
  • Help edit the parent credit card information (e.g. card expiration date)

articles.title: Add Family Portal Login URL to Website
articles.description:
Each 1Core client has its own unique Family Portal URL.  

It is highly recommended that you incorporate the unique 1Core Family Portal Login URL on your company website to make it easier for your parents login to the Family Portal.  


Following is an example of how a client added the Family Portal Login link on their website:


How to obtain your custom Family Portal URL?


You can follow the steps below to get the custom Family Portal URL.  

Company Dashboard --> Functions --> Family Portal Url



The custom Family Portal URL will display the client company banner at the top in the 1Core Family Portal login page:

articles.title: Automatic TAP Processing
articles.description:
Overview

 

The default setting for TAP processing is manual review and submit. Once you are comfortable with the TAP processing, you have the option to turn on the Automatic TAP Processing which will process TAP automatically based on the rules you set.  

 

This user guide describes the Automatic TAP Processing Setup steps and how it works.


Enable Automatic TAP Processing

 

To enable Automatic TAP Processing, you have to do it in two steps.  First you enable at the company level, then at the individual center level.

 

Note: Automatic TAP Processing can be configured at the center level. For multi-site operators, you can choose to enable Automatic TAP Processing center by center, i.e. you don’t have to enable this function for ALL center at the same time.  

 

First you should enable the function at the company level.  Click on the Setup link on the left panel under Company Dashboard.  Then select Billing Configuration – Company Level.

 

 

 

In the Billing Configuration – Company Level page as shown below:  

  • Automatic TAP Processing – select Yes
  • Payment Cycle - Check the box as appropriate for this center.

 


  

As indicated above, Automatic TAP Processing can be configured at the center level. For multi-site operators, you can choose to enable Automatic TAP Processing center by center, i.e. you don’t have to enable this function for ALL center at the same time.  To enable Automatic TAP Processing at the center level, please select Billing Configuration – Center  Level

 


 

Setup Automatic TAP Processing Rule

 

Once you have enabled Automatic TAP processing for a center, you will notice that a new link is shown on the TAP Home page: Automatic TAP Processing.

 


  

To setup Automatic TAP Processing rule, click on the link and then click on “Add New.”

 

You can create an Automatic TAP Processing rule for each payment cycle/frequency as applicable.


 Once you have added the rule you can view and edit the rule. 

 

 


Manage Automatic TAP Processing for Specific Family

 

When Automatic TAP Processing is enabled for a center, you will notice 2 new fields in the “Payment Info” section of the Family record. 


 

By default, ALL enrolled TAP families will have the Automatic TAP Processing flag set to “Yes,” i.e. the family will be included in the Automatic TAP Processing.

 

In special cases, you might have payment plans worked out with a few families which mean you need to handle the TAP processing manually.  To do that, you would change the Automatic TAP processing for that family to “No.”

 

For all TAP families where Automatic TAP Processing are setup to “No”, you can continue to process their TAP payment manually by going to “1. Process TAP Payment based on Ledger Balance”

articles.title: TAP Dis-enrollment
articles.description:
Overview

 

Parents can dis-enroll from the TAP program if they wish. However by default, the system is configured NOT to allow the parents to dis-enroll directly themselves.

 

 

In the Family Portal, when parents click on the "Payment" function on the left panel, they see an option called "Disenroll TAP"

 


When they click on that “Disenroll TAP” link in the Family Portal, the parents will get a pop-up message to contact the Center Director.



  

 

Director to Dis-Enroll Parents from TAP

 

After the parents have contacted you and you have decided to proceed to dis-enroll the parents from TAP, you can do so following the steps below:

 

From the TAP Home page, select the “Total Active Payors Enrolled in TAP” link on the right side.



 

Click on the “Disenroll” icon for the parent you would like to dis-enroll.

 


 Click on the “Yes, I want to Disenroll” button to confirm.

 


 


Allow Parents to Dis-Enroll Directly

 

If you would like to allow the parents to dis-enroll from TAP directly on the own via the Family Portal, please contact support@1coresolution.com.

articles.title: Billing Period Description
articles.description:
For monthly recurring billing, our system automatically populates the effective month as the billing period description in the family ledger by default. 

 



With the new enhancement, you can now edit the billing period descriptions for current and future monthly billings. Instead of using the default month and year format, you can enter custom billing descriptions as needed.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Automatic Recurring Billing Rule

Instead of using the default month and year format, you can enter custom billing descriptions as needed.     Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Automatic Recurring Billing Rule

articles.title: Card Swipe Payment (CSP) - Card Connect Only
articles.description:
What is Card Swipe Payment (CSP)

 

1Core allows the center to accept one-time, in-person credit card payments from parents via card swipe. Unlike the online tuition payment which requires parents to setup a funding account, parents can use any credit card to pay via card swipe.  Card swipe payment will be posted to the family account ledger automatically. 

 

This user guide is only applicable for Card Connect Clients Only


Acquiring the Card Reader

 

In order to enable card swipe payment, you must first acquire the appropriate card reader according to which payment processor you have:

 

Note: The 1Core Card Swipe Payment solution is Point to Point Encrypted (P2PE) certified. Only the following readers from Card Connect are certified to be P2PE.

 


You can order from https://shop.cardconnect.com/ 


Note: You will need your Merchant ID (MID) to order the card reader from Card Connect.  

 

While both card readers will work, we recommend the IDTech SREDKey reader (on the right) as it is bigger and more stable to swipe. 

 

   

 

Request to Enable Card Swipe Payment

 

Once you have received the card reader from Card Connect, please email support@1coresolution.com to request to enable the Card Swipe Payment function in 1Core.  

 

 

 

Connecting the Card Reader


You can simply plug the card reader into a USB port on the computer.  The system should recognize the card reader and you are ready to process card swipe payment in 1Core.

 

  

 

 



Process Card Swipe Payment (within the Family Acct Ledger)


The main way to process card swipe payment is within the Family Account Ledger of a specific family.  On the upper right corner within a Family Account Ledger, when clicking the the Post Ledger Item drop-down, you will notice a Card Swipe Payment option.   Select the "Card Swipe Payment" option when you are ready to process card swipe payment for that family.

 

 

Process Card Swipe Payment via Online Payment Home Page

 

Another way you can select a parent to process card swipe payment from the Online Tuition Payment home page by clicking on the Process Card Swipe Payment.

 

 

 

After clicking on the Process Card Swipe Payment link, you will be prompted to select a family from the drop down list.

 


For the selected family, the system will propose the ledger balance as the default amount. You can accept that amount or change the amount before processing to swipe the parent’s credit card to process the payment. 

 




Once you click on “Ready to Swipe Card” button, system will show you a screen that it is ready for you to swipe the card:

 

 

  

You will see the name, last 4-digit of the credit card number and expiration date on the screen.  When ready, click the "Process Payment" button.

 

 

 

 

 

Payment Posted to Family Account Ledger

 

Once a card swipe payment is processed successfully, the transaction will post automatically to the Family Account Ledger with a description of “Card Swipe Payment.” as shown below:

 

 


Review Card Swipe Payment

 

You can review all your card swipe payment activities by clicking on the “Review CSP Payment Status” link on the online payment home page.

You can accept that amount or change the amount before processing to swipe the parent’s credit card to process the payment.               Once you click on “Ready to Swipe Card” button, system will show you a screen that it is ready for you to swipe the card:              You will see the name, last 4-digit of the credit card number and expiration date on the screen.  When ready, click the "Process Payment" button.                 Payment Posted to Family Account Ledger     Once a card swipe payment is processed successfully, the transaction will post automatically to the Family Account Ledger with a description of “Card Swipe Payment.” as shown below:           Review Card Swipe Payment     You can review all your card swipe payment activities by clicking on the “Review CSP Payment Status” link on the online payment home page.

articles.title: Online Payment Refund
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Introduction
  • Refund Amount
    • FULL Refund UnityFi
    • FULL Refund Card Connect
  • Issue Credit 
    • Partial ACH Refund
    • Partial Card Refund



Introduction

You can do refunds within the 1Core application itself for both UnityFi and CardConnect payment providers and the refund transactions will be posted automatically to the ledger.  

 

Note: User can also submit refund request using the payment processor portal, i.e. outside of the 1Core application.  In this case, the refund transaction will need to be posted manually to the 1Core ledger. 

 

This integrated refund feature is applicable for the following payment transactions: 

  • TAP (Tuition Auto Pay)
  • TPD (Tuition Pay Direct)
  • CSP (Card Swipe Payment) 

 

Refund Amount

FULL Refund UnityFi

If you need to issue a FULL refund of the original payment, follow the steps below:

 

Access path: Tuition Auto Pay à Refund Amount 




Select the relevant family from the drop down menu and the payment period. 

 

Note: We only allow a full refund of an ACH payment within 1Core after there is a confirmation of the original ACH payment was cleared.  This is to prevent potential fraud.  Currently it requires up to 8 business days after the initial transaction was made to confirm there is no NSF/decline.  As a result, you will not see the family in the drop down if the payments have not been cleared.

If you need to issue a refund immediately, you can do so by logging into Unity Manager. If you refund through Unity Manager, you will need to manually void the transaction in 1Core because the refund would not flow back into 1Core from UnityFI

 


Select the transaction that you would like to refund




Click Refund button to confirm the Refund.



Issue Credit 

Partial ACH Refund

 

The Refund feature described above is for instance where you would like do a FULL refund.   In cases where you need do partial refund, you would accomplish this by issuing a credit either for ACH or Card.

 

 

To Issue a Credit for ACH, select the relevant funding account.  You can enter the amount of credit to issue.




After clicking on “Next” you can complete the request by clicking on “Issue Credit Now.”





Partial Card Refund

The same process applies to partial card refund as well.

To Issue a Credit for card, select the relevant payer and the payment period to get a list of payments where you can issue a partial credit.   Under Action, select “Issue Credit” for the relevant payment to issue credit.




You can enter the amount of credit to issue.  After clicking on “Next” you can complete the request by clicking on “Issue Credit Now.”



You can review the status of all the credits issued by selecting “Review Issue Credit Status”


­­On successful refund, a new transaction “Payment Refund” will be posted with a refund amount and the reference number of the original transaction will be displayed in the comments column. 

The final step, you’ll need to manually post a tuition adjustment credit to the family ledger of the same amount to bring the ledger back to $0 or the correct balance. 

 

If you are using the UnityFI payment platform and do not see this feature enabled in 1Core, please contact: "Support@1coresolution.com"

articles.title: Online Forms
articles.description:
What is The Purpose

 

This user guide explains the various features of the Online Forms module in 1Core.

 

The forms must be first setup in the backend by 1Core Admin User. Then parents can interact with the forms online via the Family Portal.

 

1Core has also created functions to help manage mandatory forms.



Note: If you do not see the Online Forms on the 1Core Company Dashboard, please contact Support@1coresolution.com to request the module be enabled for your center.

 

  

Online Forms Setup

 

Before you can take advantage of the Online Forms module, you must do the following setup:

· Forms Category Setup 

· Add New Forms

 

The Form Category is designed to help organize the online forms and determine if the forms are up loadable by parents or not.

 

Access Path: Company DashboardàOnline FormsàCategory SetupàAdd New Category





After you have setup the Form Category, you can now Add New Form.

 

When adding new form, you must select a form category. Depending on whether the form category is up loadable, you will have the choice of making the upload mandatory or not.




Following is a List of Forms Added:

 

Note: All the forms you added in the backend will appear to the parents in the Family Portal.


 

Family Portal Form Functions:

 

When parent’s login to the Family Portal, they will see the Forms option in the left panel. If they click on View, they will see all the online forms you added.

 

They can download the form by clicking on the download icon under the Action.



Parents can choose to upload a form by selecting the “Upload” link

 

Parents can view all the forms they uploaded when they click on the “Your Documents” link.



                                         

Parent Up loadable Forms:

 

This section explains how you can view and add to the parent up loadable forms.

 

Access Path: Center DashboardàFamiliesàOnline FormsàUpload Forms

 

Within each family record, you should see a “Online Forms” link.

 

 

 

 

When you click on the “Online Forms” link, you will see all the forms uploaded by the family.

 

We understand some families will not upload the forms online. Instead they might simply turn in the completed/signed form at the office. In this case, you can scan the completed form into PDF and upload the form for each family within 1Core.

 

 

 

 

Mandatory Forms Management:

 

1Core has developed the following two features to help with the management of mandatory forms needed from the parents.

 

Any form that is tagged as mandatory, it will be prominently displayed on the Parent Portal home page as shown below. Once the parent has uploaded the mandatory form, the alert will disappear.



The second feature to help manage mandatory forms is that you can view the status of mandatory forms from all parents and send out reminders as needed.

 

Access Path: Center DashboardàOnline FormsàMandatory Form Status

 

 

Click on the number of uploaded and not uploaded to view the status.


 

For the list of parents who haven’t uploaded the form, you can select to send them an email reminder.

articles.title: Process of Integrating the E-Sign into a Center
articles.description:
1Core offers a completely online and paperless enrollment registration process for childcare centers. We truly believe in digital documents and paperless records. E-Sign / Digital Signature is essential to validate the authenticity of the childcare center's digital documents. So we offer our clients digital E-Sign integration to their registration documents.


Using the E-Sign / Digital Signature, parents can digitally acknowledge their registration and enrollment process. Center directors can counter verify and acknowledge the parent's enrollment with their E-Sign / Digital Signature. 


Both parents and center directors can download the uploaded documents for their record through their respective portals.


Steps to be followed while integrating the E-Sign document to a center



Step 1:                             " Client Request "


The very first step is getting the request from the client. The client should express their wish to add E-Sign to their Parent Registration process. The client needs to provide their document list and document pdf for the integration of the E-Sign into their registration process. 



Step 2:                     " Supportable Forms list for Integration"


We provide E-Sign service to the following list of forms :


1. Center's Admission Agreement Forms


2. Mandatory Licensing Forms for various states


3. Child Health Forms


4. Center's Terms and Condition Forms


5. Emergency Release Forms 


6. All Forms Related to Children data


The forms other than the mentioned above are not encouraged for the E-Sign integration. (Example: Parent Hand Books)


There are some constraints present in the integration process of the document,


1. We only allow two digital signatures per document. One for the 'Center side', that can be the Center Director's signature. And one for the 'Parent Side', that can be any one of the parent's signature.


2. We are not encouraging any document that requires digital attestation or signature from the medical professional.



Step 3:            " Editing the Client Document Pdf to Create fields "


After getting the document and verifying with the set conditions, the next step is to edit the forms to a format that supports the integration process.


We use "esigngenie" online tool to create a new template and edit the pdf forms to add Text fields, Date fields, Dropdown fields, Check, and Radio buttons.


esigngenie - Process of creating a digital form 


I. Combine all pdfs into a single file


We use Adobe Acrobat's pdf editing option to combine all pdf forms into a single file. While combining the forms, we keep the form order prescribed by the client. This process is carried out to ease the registration process by providing all the necessary documents at the end of the registration process to save time.


II. Upload the documents to the esigngenie online tool


Choose the 'Create a New Template' option to upload the combined pdf form file.



III. Edit the prescribed fields into text, date, radio, dropdown, and check button fields. We can add mandatory fields to the forms as per the client's request. 



IV.  Data Transfer is a process of auto-filling the data and storing the collected data. The parents will encounter the E-Sign document while they registering for program enrollment. 


Basically, the parents will start with an online application form to enter their basic details. We use the entered data in the online application to fill the fields of the digital document created by the esigngenie and also we can collect and record the new data entered in the Digital document which are not present in the application fields to the parent account. 


This process is called "Data Transfer" and we allow three types of Data Transfer.


Application to Digital DocumentDigital Document to ApplicationCustom Fields in the Digital Document to Application
Center InformationChildren Health Check-Up Date InformationChild's Dress Sizes
License InformationParent's Employer DetailsChild's Primary Language Information
Parent Information
Medical Insurance Details
Child Information
Parent's Driver License Details
Program Information
Child Policy Field
Dental Records

Hospital Details


Authorized person Details

Emergency Contact Information



At 1Core, Parent (Primary Parent), Child, and Program Information are mandatory. Like this, we can also mark the secondary Parent Details, Doctor Records, Dental Records, Hospital Details, Authorized Person Details, and Emergency Contact Information mandatory based on the client's requirement.


V. After marking all the fields, the next step is to map the field present in the forms and the created template document to the center. 


Step 4:            " Enabling the Document Manager and Online Forms in the System Admin"


To integrate the E-Sign into the registration process of a company, you should enable the "Document Manager" and "Online Forms" options in the System Admin.


Document Manager option enables the E-Sign feature for a center. Otherwise, the E-Sign stage will be skipped and the parents will be taken to the family portal password creation page in the enrollment flow.


Online Forms option enables the parents and directors to download the signed document using their respective portals after a successful registration. 


To enable the Document Manager and Online Forms for a Company, 


Access Path : System Utilities  > Company/Location Setup > Company Summary > Company > Edit


You can enable the Document Manager using the 'Module Configuration' tab.


You can enable the Online Forms using the 'Modules Activated' tab.



To enable 'Online Forms' for a center,


Access Path : System Utilities  > Company/Location Setup > Company Summary > Company > List Locations


You can enable the 'Online Forms' for a center using the 'Feature Configuration' tab.





Step 5:                    "Testing the Integration"


After the successful integration,  we will test the integrated online form for its seamless function in the test environment. 


Once the Document Manager and Online forms are enabled to the client after the successful integration, the parent and the directors can attest their forms with their E-Sign / Digital Signature.

articles.title: 1Core – KinderConnect For Providers
articles.description:
1Core – KinderConnect For Providers

Overview:
This feature enables the integration of Kinder Connect with 1Core. Once integrated, the system will support syncing of 1Core companies, centers, subsidy agencies, and child records with Kinder Connect. Additionally, child attendance logs can be uploaded from 1Core to Kinder Connect on a regular basis.

Provider Mapping:

If the agency name matches with the 1Core agency name, then the system will do an agency mapping, otherwise a new agency will be added to their 1Core Agency list.

 

Note: In general, the KinderConnect agency name has not been matched with the agency name in 1Core.

Through the backend we need to map the KinderConnect agency with the 1Core agency.

 

 

Subsidy Child Mapping:

The following are the key values considered to enable KinderConnect subsidy mapping for the child.

  • Child’s First Name
  • Last Name
  • Date of Birth

If the above values are matches between the 1Core and KinderConnect, then KinderConnect mapping will be enabled for the child.

If the KinderConnect subsidy child(ren) record does not match the records in 1Core, 1Core will automatically send a KinderConnect mapping failure notification to the center director.

 

Directors can access the KinderConnect subsidy children through the below path:

Login to Company/Center --> Center Dashboard --> Children (from the side menu) --> Click on the ‘9 Dots’ --> Subsidy Attendance

 

 

Note: 

If KinderConnect subsidy mapping does not occur for any child, the center or parent must correct the data in either 1Core or KinderConnect to enable the mapping

Subsidy Attendance Submission:

 

Once the integration is enabled, centers can submit a child’s attendance to KinderConnect for subsidy.


Currently, attendance can only be submitted for a single day at a time.

  • Subsidy Count = No of children having KinderConnect subsidy schedule on that date 
  • Attended = No of children having attendance on that date 
  • Absent= No of KinderConnect subsidy children are marked as absent  
  • Incomplete Time Log = No of KinderConnect subsidy children’s timecard is incomplete, i.e   timecard available without sign out entry 
  • No Time Log = No of children who had a KinderConnect subsidy schedule on that date but were not present.

 

By clicking the count, the director can view the details of that summary as shown in the screen below.

 

 

By clicking on the ‘Submit’ button displayed in the ‘Not Submitted’ column, the page will display the list of KinderConnect subsidy children who have attendance for the date.

Select the children and proceed to submit the attendance.

On clicking the ‘Submit’ button, attendance will be submitted to KinderConnect.

 

 

View History of Subsidy Attendance Submission:

The ‘Logs’ option in the ‘Quick Links’ helps to view the history of subsidy attendance submission details by child / date.

articles.title: Authorized Person Code
articles.description:
1Core allows it's parents to have their own Authorized  Code for Sign in / Sign out their child to the Center.


The Authorized Id Code for both Sponsor and Co-Sponsor will automatically created when the family is added to 1Core.


The Admin User can find the Authorized person Id Code under Families.


Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Families--->Authorized Person



If the Family has additional contact who needs to be added as Authorized Person for their child, then the Admin User can add those family members by following the same Access path mentioned above and use the "Add New" button.


* Click on "Add New" / Enter the First and Last name, enter the relationship.

* The system will  automatically generate the Id Code.


For Multiple Child Family, if the Authorized Person is allowed to pick only one child and not the other one, then the Admin User can go and check the child name under " Not Authorized for these children "


The Admin User can make the Authorized person status Inactive anytime whenever required.



Note: A family can have any number of authorized person.


The Parent will be able to view the Authorized person Id code list in their Parent portal as follows.


Access path : Family--->Authorized Person



The Admin User will have the ability to generate a report for Authorized Person as follows.


Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Reports--->Id Code By Authorized Person

For Multiple Child Family, if the Authorized Person is allowed to pick only one child and not the other one, then the Admin User can go and check the child name under " Not Authorized for these children "     The Admin User can make the Authorized person status Inactive anytime whenever required. articles.title: Enroll / Transfer Families from One Center Into a Different Center
articles.description:
Users can move the Family Records from one center to another using this feature.

 

 

Center Dashboard --> Functions --> Enroll Families into Different Center:

 

 

 

 

Select the relevant family that must be moved to another center and click Next. The parent and child details will be displayed.

 

 

 

-Select the children records that need to be moved.

-Select the center to which the selected family and child record need to be moved. 

-Click Next, a confirmation message will be displayed


 

 

Confirmation


 

 

 

The following details of Parent and Child Files will not be moved to the new center. 

 

Parent Information:

1. Employer

2. Payment Frequency

3. TAP- They will have to re enroll for the new school

 

Child Information:

1. Classroom 

2. Age Group

3. Enrollment Start Date 

4. Child Id code

5. Child Program 

6. Child Tuition

7. Subsidized Billing Information

8. Emergency Contact: Cellphone & Address


Ledger

1. The family ledger entries will not be moved

articles.title: Family Portal - Online Parent Enrollment
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. Family Portal
    • 1.1. Enrolling in a Program using the Invite Send by the Center
      • 1.1.1.Single Ledger Family
      • 1.1.2. Multiple Ledger Family 


1. Family Portal

1.1. Enrolling in a Program using the Invite Send by the Center

1.1.1.Single Ledger Family 

You can enroll in a program using the invite sent by the center. When you select the link provided by the center to enroll the child into the program offered.


When you select the Decline link:




When you like to proceed with the registration :


Selecting the link (accepting the enrollment) will take you to the online enrollment landing page of the center.


On the Program Offered page, you can download the Parent Hand Book of the center. 


 

If you select the Contact Us button:



If you select the Next button :


Enter the Parent #1 Info and their Employer Details.

.


Enter the Parent #2 Info and their Employer Details.


Enter the Child's basic, Insurance, Medical checkup, allergy, and diet details on the Child Info page.

 


Enter the details of the child's medical providers.


Note : For New Family Registration, you will not be able to view the 'Copy Contact into from' option. Instead you need to enter the details in the respective columns. 





After the Authorized Pick Up details page, you will be taken to the confirmation page where you can review the entered details one last time before the payment.


If the selected family is an existing one, you will see the configured funding account, if not you may need to add your card or funding account on the Payment Info page. 


For Existing Families :


The pre-existing payment accounts and cards will be available here for the parents to select and pay. 



For New Families :


If you are a new family to the 1Core, you will need to enter your payment account or card here to pay the specified fees. 




Note : If the center is not enabled with Online Enrollment With eSignature, you will be taken to the family portal after the Payment Info page.


If the center is enabled with Online Enrollment With eSignature :


After the Payment Info page, you will be taken to the Online Enrollment Forms page for you to digitally sign it with eSignature (By drawing on the screen with a mouse or uploading your signature).



The entered child info, insurance details, hospital details, authorized pick up will be auto-populated here in the Online Enrollment forms. 




Note: If you are a new family, then you will be asked to create your family account's password after this. 




Note: If the eSign document requires two parent signatures, after the Parent #1 completes the eSign process. An email will go to the Parent #2 for their Signature. 



1.1.2. Multiple Ledger Family :


After the primary parent (Parent #1) signing the online enrollment forms, the secondary parent (Parent #2) will receive an email from the center to enter the details and signature.


Note : If you are a new family, then the parent #2 needs to create his/her family account by creating their account password. If you are an existing family, then you dont need to create the family account details here, you will be taken to the family portal log in page at the end of the process.  



Select the link present in the email to enter the Review Info page. If the parents are together (couple), parent #1 will fill out both parent #1 and #2 details while they filling out their online form.



If the selected family is an existing one, you will see the configured funding account on the Payment Info page, if not you may need to add your card or funding account on the Payment Info page. 


For Existing Families :


The pre-existing payment accounts and cards will be available here for the parents to select and pay. 



For New Families :

If you are a new family to the 1Core, you will need to enter your payment account or card details here to pay the specified fees.

articles.title: Multiple Ledger
articles.description:
If your center has divorced families where both parents of a child is paying for the child tuition and they would like to keep their finances separate, then the "Multiple" Ledger selection can be used.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                                                                                         

 

Ledger Type Selection

When you have enabled ledger to be multi-ledger, you will notice a Sponsor and Co-sponsor in the drop-down in the following places:

 

 

Add New Program Billing in the Child Record - You can setup Tuition Amounts when adding a New Program in the Child Record to Sponsor and or Co-Sponsor separately.

 

 

 

 

 


Ledger Posting Screen - When you Post Ledger Items for a family, you can select which ledger to post. 

 

 

 

 

 

The Family Account Ledger Screen- There is a filter to view the ledger items by ledger type. By default, system will show all ledger items. You can filter the view to show only Sponsor or Co-Sponsor items only.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Family Account Statement

 

When generating Family Account Statement, if a family is single ledger, all transactions will be shown within the same ledger under Sponsor.

 

However, when you have a multi-ledger family, the system will automatically generate a separate statement for Sponsor and Co-Sponsor.




 

 

 

 

An account statement is generated for Sponsor

 

 

 

 

A separate Account Statement is generated for Co-Sponsor

 

 

 

 

 


Online Tuition Payment and Family Portal with Multi Ledger

 

 

The multi-ledger function has the following impact on the 1Core Online Tuition Payment solution.

 

Each online payment funding account is associated with a family account ledger.

 

In a typical Single Ledger family, the parents can enroll with one funding account. Whichever parent logs in and enrolls in the online tuition payment first gets to choose the funding account to use. The second parent can only edit and change the funding account to another one if needed.

 

However, in a Multiple-Ledger family, there are TWO ledgers and Family Portals setup per Family. In that case, Sponsor and Co-sponsor can choose to setup different funding account for each ledger. They can separately update information and make payments without each other seeing, however, all of the info will be shown in the Family Account in 1Core that the Director or Owner would see.  

 

 

 

 

Making Payments for Alternate weeks

 

Payors can make payments for alternate weeks when the Ledger Type in the Recurring Billing section is set as ‘Alternate Sponsor/Co-sponsor’. This option is available only for families with Ledger Type ‘Multiple’ and ‘Program Schedule Based’ billing .

 

The billing items with this ‘Alternate Sponsor/Co-Sponsor’ ledger type option will be  posted to the Sponsor and Co-sponsor ledger in alternate weeks so, the payors can make payment for the alternate week when the billing item is posted to their ledgers.

 

 

Access Path: Center Dashboard à Children à Child’s Program & Billing à Recurring Billing  à Edit Recurring Billing

articles.title: Parent can use same email address across companies
articles.description:
1Core allows the parents to use the same email address across companies

  • When a parent logs in using Family Portal, they will be provided with a center selection screen.
  • When a parent registers via Program/Camp enrollment unique link of 1Core, 1Core detects and redirect them to the respective center.  Here, parent will not be provided with the center selection.
  • When the parent changes the email address on the Family Portal, it will be updated on the family records of associated companies and its centers.

Example:

 

“ABC Schools” has two centers namely “DAV School” and “SBOA School”.

“XYZ Schools” has one center namely “Manhattan”.

 

Multi-center selection across companies:

This feature allows you to post 3rd party (Agency) billing for multiple families/children as a batch billing.

After selecting the agency, family, and child status, select the 'Submit' button to move to the next page.


On the second page, select the posting date, transaction type, description, amount, and family/children (from the list at the bottom).


Note : The amount that you have specified in the 'Amount' text box is same for each of the selected family. For example - Here, $600 is set as the 'Amount' and each family receive the same $600 against their standing balance.

articles.title: Agency Batch Payment
articles.description:
This feature helps you to process 'Agency Payments' using an Excel sheet. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Functions > Agency Batch Payment



After downloading the Excel sheet, you need to enter the agency payment details for the outstanding family bills. The excel should have the details of subsidized families that have outstanding balances. 


You can do subsidy credit, parent credit, transfer, adjustment, and payment using this excel sheet.



Once you have filled the excel sheet, Select the 'Step 2' button on the 'Agency Payment/ Transfer/ Credit / Adjustment Posting page to upload the filled excel sheet.



After uploading the excel sheet, select the 'Step 3' button to move to the 'Review and Submit' page.


. 

After checking the details on the review page, select the 'Next' button to move to the next page.


 

On the final page, select the 'Post to Ledger' button to post the billing into the family ledger. 


On the Ledger Page: 


Check Amount $147 (Underpayment with $50 Transfer & $25 Adjustment)

articles.title: Agency Payment / Transfer / Adjustment Posting
articles.description:
This feature allows you to transfer and adjust the underpayment situation for the agency payment. Say that the agency check for a family is $80 for a month but the family's bill for that month is $100, you can do two things here using the Agency Payment / Transfer / Adjustment Posting feature,  


1. Transfer - You can transfer the difference to the parent/family as an 'Other Charge' and they need to pay this fee in their next payment. 


2. Adjustment - You can transfer the difference as a credit to the 'Agency'



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Functions > Agency Payment / Transfer /Adjustment Posting

 



The 'Check Amount' and 'Payment' need to be the same in order to process the adjustment and transfer. Here, 


Check Amount - $80

Transfer - $10 

Adjustment - $10





On the Family Ledger

articles.title: Agency Payment Automatic Application Rule (Company Dashboard)
articles.description:
To Manage the under/ overpayment eventualities in the 'Agency Billing', 1Core has provided the 'Agency Payment Automatic Application Rule' in the company level setup.


Access Path : Company Dashboard > Setup > Agency Payment Automatics Application Rule


UnderPayment Situation and Rules :


UnderPayment is when the agency paid less than the original ledger amount for the parent. To tackle this situation, you can do 'Three' things, 


1. Transfer to Parent Ledger: This option will automatically transfer the difference amount as an 'Other Charge' to the concerned parent's ledger. 


2. Write Off: This option will automatically 'Write Off' the difference amount. 


3. Do Not Apply Automatically: This option will allow you to manually decide whether you want to 'Transfer the difference to parent ledger' or 'Write Off'.


OverPayment Situation and Rules :


OverPayment is when the agency paid more than the original ledger amount for the parent. To tackle this situation, you can do 'Four' Things,


1. True-Up: This allows you to categorize the difference as 'True-Up' and help you to provide subsidy credit or parent credit.


2. Do Not Apply Automatically: This option will allow you to manually decide whether you want to provide 'True-Up' or 'Parent/ Subsidy Credit' (If those options are enabled).


Maintain as Agency Credit: The amount transferred to 'Agency credit' can be used for other payment billings or you can refund the additional amount to the agency. 


Transfer to Parent Ledger as a Credi: The amount transferred to 'Parent Credit' can be only used for other payment billings, parents won't be able to get any refund out of this.

articles.title: Apply Payments From Subsidy Credit and Refunds
articles.description:
The Subsidy Credit can be used in two ways,


1. You can use the subsidy credit amount for paying bills.

2. Agency can be refunded with the Subsidy Credit amount.


Access Path : Company Dashboard > Functions > Apply Payments From Subsidy Credit and Refunds



View Summary

 

Post Payment

articles.title: Deposit on Account
articles.description:
What is The Purpose


The Deposit On Account function allows you to manage the funds and accounting when you take refundable security deposit from parents.

 

The proper accounting for Deposit On Account is as follows:

· When you receive Refundable Deposits from parents, you should record a liability on your company books.

·When you refund the deposit, it should then offset/reduce that liability. 

·Any forfeited deposit can be recognized as income, when it occurs.

 

If you have the 1Core General Ledger (GL) function enabled at your company, you can get a GL data extract with entries to post to the General Ledger.



Billing Items Setup


1Core will automatically setup the 2 billing items to accommodate the processing of Deposit On Account. You will find them in the Billing Setup.

·    Other Charges --> Deposit Charge ·      Credit --> Deposit Refund

 

You should setup an Other Charges billing item to account for Forfeited Deposit.



Record Receipt of a Deposit on Account

 

When you receive a deposit on-account from the parents, you should make the following 2-item entry:

 

·    Other Charges --> Deposit Charge ·   Payment



When you look at the account ledger for this family, you will note that the dual-item entry will net to zero in the account ledger.

 

However, the Deposit On Account amount will remain in the bucket as shown in the family ledger balance table.



Refund of Deposit

 

When a family leaves your program and you have to manage the Deposit on Account, there are 3 scenarios:

 

a. Ledger balance equal to deposit amount

When the ledger balance (after the last billing) is equal to the deposit amount, you simply need to apply the deposit on account amount via a Deposit Refund transaction to bring the ledger balance to zero.

 

 

b. Ledger balance less than deposit amount

In this case, you need to record a credit (Deposit Refund) AND issue a check refund to the family


c. Ledger balance greater than deposit amount

In this case, you need to record a credit (Deposit Refund) and expect to collect payment for the remaining balance from the parents.



Deposit On Account Report

 

1Core provides a Deposit on Account report to help manage the Deposit on Account.



Select date and click Submit to generate the report. 



The report details the Deposit On Account booked and refund made for each family.

articles.title: Different Ways Posting Agency Billing
articles.description:
You can post the Agency Billing for a child in three different ways. They are


1. Post Ledger Way

2. Add New Program / Add New Recurring Program  

3. Agency Batch Billing 



Post Ledger 


In this method, you can post an agency billing/subsidy for a child using the Ledger Records. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Ledger > Select a Family 




On the 'Post Ledger Item' pop-up, select the 'Agency' from the Ledger drop-down.



Fill all the necessary details in the relevant boxes and choose the 'Transaction Type' and 'Child' from the respective drop-downs.


After entering the details, select the 'Post' button to post the subsidy.



Posted Agency Billing in the Ledger List, 




2. Add New Program / Add New Recurring Program:


You can add a 3rd Party (Agency) Billing using the 'Add Program'  and 'Add New Recurring Billing' options available on the program and billing page.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Children > Program & Billing 

 


Add Program :


On the 'Add Child Program' page, select the Age Group, Program, and Program End Date.



After adding the program to the child, you need to enter the 'Fees' details and select the 'Subsidy' status of the Selected Program for the child.




Added Agency Billing,



Add New Recurring Billing:


On the Add Child Recurring Billing pop-up, select the 'Billing Type'.



On the next page, Enter all relevant details and select the 'Ledger Type' as 'Agency'.


Successfully Posted 3rd Party Recurring Billing :

 


Agency Batch Billing:


This feature allows you to post 3rd party (Agency) billing for multiple families/children as a batch billing.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Functions > Agenct Batch Billing



After selecting the agency, family, and child status, select the 'Submit' button to move to the next page.


On the second page, select the posting date, transaction type, description, amount, and family/children (from the list at the bottom).


Note : The amount that you have specified in the 'Amount' text box is same for each of the selected family. For example - Here, $600 is set as the 'Amount' and each family receive the same $600 against their standing balance.  


 


Successfully processed Agency Batch Billing on the Ledger Page :

articles.title: No Service Day
articles.description:
The concept of a 'No Service Day' is related to 1CoreSolution's prorated billing system. With this system, you can define the working days of your center on your calendar and allow customers to make no payments for the days marked as 'No Service Days'. 



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Prorated Tuition Billing 






Federal holidays will automatically be added to the 'No Service Days Listing' as no service days. You have the option to remove them from the list by clicking the close icon next to each holiday.



To update the default list of no service days for your center's holiday or local holidays, you can simply select the date on the calendar.

articles.title: Franchise Admin Role Management
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. Add/Edit - Franchise 
  • 2. Map a company under the Franchise 
    • 2.1. View the Company List under a Franchise
  • 3. Add a Franchise Admin User 

 


1. Add/Edit - Franchise 


a. Open the System Admin portal. 

b. Select the 'Franchise Setup' option 



c. On the Franchise setup page, select the 'Add New Franchise' option from the top right corner to create a new franchise setup.



d. Fill out the Franchise Details on the 'Add/Edit Franchise Details' page.




2. Map a company under the Franchise 


a. After creating a franchise in the 'Franchise Setup', go to the 'Company/Location Setup'. 



b. Select a company from the 'Company Summary' page to map a franchise.  A client can map multiple companies under a franchise.



c. Select the 'Module Configuration' tab on the Company Setup page. 



d. Use the 'Select Franchise' drop down to map this company under a franchise and Select the 'Save' button to save the selected franchise setup.





2.1. View the Company List under a Franchise


a. Select the 'Companies List' to view the mapped companies under the franchise.



3. Add a Franchise Admin User 


a. Select the 'Manage Users' option under the 'Role/User Management. 



b. On the 'User Management' page, select the 'Franchise Admins' tab. To create a new franchise admin user, select the 'Add New User' button from the top right corner. 



c. Creating a franchise admin user :

 Enter the first and last name of the user, username, password, email, and employee id. Select the 'Yes' radio button for the 'Is Franchise Admin' option to give franchise admin privileges to the user. 


d. Users can choose a company to enter from their home screen after their login.

 



e. After their login, they can switch between companies using the 'Select Different Company'.

articles.title: Frequently Asked Questions - Center Director Portal
articles.description:
FAQ

a) How to buy additional licenses in order to serve more classrooms? 


you can request additional licenses to the 1Core support team by writing a mail to 'support@1coresolution.com' or you can use the 'Buy More Learn@Home Classrooms' option from the 'Scheduled classes' section to send a request mail. 



By Clicking the 'Buy More Learn@Home Classrooms' icon, you can send a request to the 1Core Support Team.
articles.description_text: FAQ  a) How to buy additional licenses in order to serve more classrooms?      you can request additional licenses to the 1Core support team by writing a mail to 'support@1coresolution.com' or you can use the 'Buy More Learn@Home Classrooms' option from the 'Scheduled classes' section to send a request mail.           By Clicking the 'Buy More Learn@Home Classrooms' icon, you can send a request to the 1Core Support Team.

articles.title: How to Setup a Live Meeting
articles.description:
1Core allows center directors to create a live meeting with staffs and parents. 


Log in to https://360.oncareoffice.com/ with valid credentials. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Live Meetings



Clicking the Live Meeting tab will take you to the Live Meeting page. Click the Add New Meeting button from the upper right corner of the Live Meeting page.




You can add staff(s) and parent(s) to a live meeting by using the Staff and Parent tab present on the 'Add New Meeting' page.



After selecting the parents, click the 'Next' button to view the entered details one last time before creating the meeting.



Click the 'Save' button to create a live meeting.
articles.description_text: 1Core allows center directors to create a live meeting with staffs and parents.      Log in to https://360.oncareoffice.com/ with valid credentials.      Access Path: Center Dashboard > Live Meetings          Clicking the Live Meeting tab will take you to the Live Meeting page. Click the Add New Meeting button from the upper right corner of the Live Meeting page.         You can add staff(s) and parent(s) to a live meeting by using the Staff and Parent tab present on the 'Add New Meeting' page.          After selecting the parents, click the 'Next' button to view the entered details one last time before creating the meeting.          Click the 'Save' button to create a live meeting.

articles.title: Manage Live Meetings
articles.description:
You can manage and edit the participants of the live meeting by using the 'View' button from the 'Live Meetings' page.


 

Access Path : Center Dashboard > Live Meetings > View



Clicking the 'View' button will take you to the Meeting Details page. Before the commencement of the meeting, you can edit the participants and cancel the meeting.



The 'start' button will appear on the 'Meeting Details' page 15 minutes before the scheduled start time of the live meeting. Using this 'Start' button, you can start a live meeting.  



Once the live meeting starts, the 'Start' button will be automatically renamed as 'Restart' using this you can restart the live meeting in case the meeting got ended before the scheduled end time due to poor internet connection/other issues. 


After the live meeting got completed, you can view the attendance list and able to download the recorded video of the meeting session.

articles.title: How to Download Enrollment and Scheduled Classes List
articles.description:
You can download the enrollment list and scheduled class list on the Learn@Home page.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Learn@Home




You can download the Current/Incoming/Completed/Deleted Enrollment list in both .pdf and .csv format. Use the 'Filter by' option to choose the type of enrollment. 

Both the downloadable .pdf and .csv format of enrollment lists will have the children's name, age group, date, class, day, time, and teacher’s name.

 

 



You can also download the 'Scheduled Classes' list by using the download options available under the Scheduled Classes section of the home page.  Using this option, you can download the current, past, and future schedules of the classes.

articles.description:
You can download the Learn@Home class report by selecting the 'Learn@Home Class' icon on the Learn@Home Setup. 


Class Report is a unique report consist of staff name, class details, category, date, day, participants name, center's time zone, and participant's time zone information.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Learn@Home > Learn@Home Setup > Report > Learn@Home Class

articles.title: How to Cancel a Scheduled Class
articles.description:
You can cancel a scheduled class using the 'Cancel Class' button from the Class Details page.



After you select the ‘Cancel Class’ button, you will be directed to the next page where you can able to mention the reason for the cancellation of the class, then select the 'Cancel Class' button. 

The entered reason will be featured in the cancellation mail.



There is a provision to send an email to the participants about the cancellation of the class.

After you have selected the 'Cancel button', you will be directed to the next page from where you can select your preference to send an email to participants.


 

The Participants email list will be based on the Parent's email preference. 



At the ‘Compose Email’ stage, you can enter the subject and body of the email. The reason that you have entered in the ‘Reason for Cancellation’ will be automatically featured in the body of the email.

The reason that you have entered in the ‘Reason for Cancellation’ will be automatically featured in the body of the email.

articles.title: How to Send Emails to Participants of a Classroom
articles.description:
You can now send emails to participants of a classroom by using the ‘Send Email to Participants’ button from the Class Details page.



Participants to Email list will be based on the parent's email preference list.
articles.description_text: You can now send emails to participants of a classroom by using the ‘Send Email to Participants’ button from the Class Details page.          Participants to Email list will be based on the parent's email preference list.

articles.title: How to Send Class Reminders to the Participants of a Virtual Classroom
articles.description:
You can send Class Reminders to Parents. This can be configured at the Operations setup stage on the Learn@Home setup.

 

 

You can set the time period for classroom reminders. If you set the ‘Send Reminders At 1 Hr Before’, then a reminder mail will be sent to the parents 1 hour before the scheduled start time of the classroom.

 

 

You can alter the time period for a reminder at any time by changing the before time in the ‘Send Reminders At’ drop-down list box. But the change will take 24 Hrs to reflect.
articles.description_text: You can send Class Reminders to Parents. This can be configured at the Operations setup stage on the Learn@Home setup.          You can set the time period for classroom reminders. If you set the ‘Send Reminders At 1 Hr Before’, then a reminder mail will be sent to the parents 1 hour before the scheduled start time of the classroom.          You can alter the time period for a reminder at any time by changing the before time in the ‘Send Reminders At’ drop-down list box. But the change will take 24 Hrs to reflect.

articles.title: How to join virtual class sessions through the family portal
articles.description:
You can join the scheduled classroom using the 'Enrolled Classes' tab from the Learn@Home tab.


The 'Join Now' button will appear before you in Today's Classes section when the staff starts the virtual classroom. You should click the 'Join Now' button to join the virtual classroom meeting.



Once you join the classroom, the status of that particular class will be changed to in-progress from scheduled.


If you got disconnected during the class, you can rejoin the same by clicking the 'Rejoin' button.
articles.description_text: You can join the scheduled classroom using the 'Enrolled Classes' tab from the Learn@Home tab.     The 'Join Now' button will appear before you in Today's Classes section when the staff starts the virtual classroom. You should click the 'Join Now' button to join the virtual classroom meeting.        Once you join the classroom, the status of that particular class will be changed to in-progress from scheduled.     If you got disconnected during the class, you can rejoin the same by clicking the 'Rejoin' button.

articles.title: How to Join a Scheduled Live Meeting
articles.description:
You can join a scheduled live meeting using the 'Live Meetings' tab from the center dashboard.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Live Meetings > View Meetings



Clicking the 'Join Now' option will open the Zoom Meeting in your browser / Desktop Zoom app (If you have already installed Zoom app on your system) to connect you to the live meeting session.



In case you got cut from your live meeting session, you can reconnect to the live meeting session by clicking the 'Restart' button from the 'Meeting Details' page.


In the Attendance list,


1. Scheduled - Indicates those persons who got the live meeting session invitation.

2. Attending - Indicates those persons who are currently attending the live meeting session.

In case you got cut from your live meeting session, you can reconnect to the live meeting session by clicking the 'Restart' button from the 'Meeting Details' page.     In the Attendance list,     1. Scheduled - Indicates those persons who got the live meeting session invitation.  2. Attending - Indicates those persons who are currently attending the live meeting session.

articles.title: How to view scheduled classes on staff portal
articles.description:
You can view your assigned class schedule by using the 'View Schedule' icon from the Learn@Home home page.


Classroom Schedules are classified into three categories.

  1. Today' Classes: Classes scheduled for the day will be displayed.
  2. Upcoming Classes: Classes scheduled for future dates will be displayed.
  3. Past Classes: Classes completed on the past dates will be displayed.



You can view the class details by clicking the 'View Class' icon from the Learn@Home home page.

The 'Class Details' page contains information on the Scheduled Time, Time Zone, Participant Count, and Participant's list.
articles.description_text: You can view your assigned class schedule by using the 'View Schedule' icon from the Learn@Home home page.     Classroom Schedules are classified into three categories.   Today' Classes: Classes scheduled for the day will be displayed.  Upcoming Classes: Classes scheduled for future dates will be displayed.  Past Classes: Classes completed on the past dates will be displayed.         You can view the class details by clicking the 'View Class' icon from the Learn@Home home page.  The 'Class Details' page contains information on the Scheduled Time, Time Zone, Participant Count, and Participant's list.

articles.title: Hosting a virtual class
articles.description:
Start /Host - Virtual Class

You can start the virtual classrooms by clicking the 'Start Now' icon from the Learn@Home home page.


'Start Now' icon will appear before you on the Today's Classes tab 15 minutes before the scheduled classroom session.


                                                                                                                                                  

Once the 'Start Now' icon clicked, the classroom session will start and the participants can join the virtual classes.


Once the classroom session is started, the 'Start Now' icon will be renamed into 'Restart', using this icon you can rejoin the session if you got disconnected in the middle.




After the completion of the class, you can download the classroom video from the 'Class Details' page.
articles.description_text: Start /Host - Virtual Class  You can start the virtual classrooms by clicking the 'Start Now' icon from the Learn@Home home page.     'Start Now' icon will appear before you on the Today's Classes tab 15 minutes before the scheduled classroom session.                                                                                                                                                         Once the 'Start Now' icon clicked, the classroom session will start and the participants can join the virtual classes.      Once the classroom session is started, the 'Start Now' icon will be renamed into 'Restart', using this icon you can rejoin the session if you got disconnected in the middle.           After the completion of the class, you can download the classroom video from the 'Class Details' page.

articles.title: Staff Portal - Live Meeting
articles.description:
You can host/start or participate in a live meeting using the staff portal account.

 

Access Path: Staff Portal Dashboard > Live Meeting 



Clicking the 'View' button will take you to the 'Meeting Details' page.


Meeting Details page will have the details of participants, meeting time schedule, host details, and date.



Staff can start the live meeting using the 'Start' button from the 'Meeting Details' page. The 'Start' button will appear before the staff 15 minutes before the scheduled start time.



The 'Start' button will be renamed as 'Restart' after the live meeting got started. If the live meeting got cut in the middle of session, you can restart the live meeting using this 'Restart' button.
articles.description_text: You can host/start or participate in a live meeting using the staff portal account.     Access Path: Staff Portal Dashboard > Live Meeting           Clicking the 'View' button will take you to the 'Meeting Details' page.     Meeting Details page will have the details of participants, meeting time schedule, host details, and date.          Staff can start the live meeting using the 'Start' button from the 'Meeting Details' page. The 'Start' button will appear before the staff 15 minutes before the scheduled start time.        The 'Start' button will be renamed as 'Restart' after the live meeting got started. If the live meeting got cut in the middle of session, you can restart the live meeting using this 'Restart' button.

articles.title: Learn@Home - Onboarding
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS


1. Enable / Disable Learn@Home and Live Meetings


2. New and Additional License for Learn@Home

1. Enable / Disable Learn@Home and Live Meetings


Steps to be followed to enable/disable Learn@Home and Live Meetings for a customer. The steps are constructed systematically to ensure successful enrollment. So the support member should adhere to the steps as described.


Log in to https://360.oncareoffice.com/ with valid credentials. 



Access Path: System Utilities homepage > Company Setup/ Location Setup > Company summary > Edit


Step 1: Choose the company on the list, click the ‘Edit’ option from the Action column.

 

Step 2 : Clicking the Edit option will lead you to the ‘Company Setup’ page. 

                                                                                                                                            [^Up^]


Step 3 : Click the ‘Modules Activated’ tab to enable/ disable the ‘Live Meeting’ and ‘Virtual Classroom’. Click ‘Save’ to save the changes.



Step 4 : Click ‘ListLocations’ from the Action column to enter the center summary page. Center Summary page will display all registered centers under the chosen company.

                                                                                                                                                [^Up^]


Step 5 : In the center summary page, click the ‘Edit’ option from the action column.


Step 6 :  Now you will be directed to the ‘Center Setup’ page. Click on the Feature Configuration tap and choose the Live meetings and virtual classroom radio buttons to enable the options for the centers. Click ‘Save’ to save the changes.

                                                                                                                                                [^Up^]

Note: Live meetings and Virtual Classroom options will only visible on the center setup page if the same options were enabled on the Company setup page. Otherwise, you won’t find those two options here. 


Screenshots of before and after the addition of live meetings and Learn@Home (virtual preschool) to the company director portal.


Before:


                                                                       

After:


                                                                                                                                                                                    [^Up^]

2. New and Additional License for Learn@Home

Centers can send License request through their portal to customer support or write to 'support@1coresolution.com'. Receiving upon their request, customer support will add licenses to their account. The number of licenses, users, and maximum meeting per day are decided based upon the customer’s requirement.


Log in to https://testadmin.1core.com/ with valid credentials.


Access Path: Admin Homepage > Virtual Classroom > Live License


Step 1: Clicking the ‘Live License’ option will take you to the License list page. Click the ‘Add New License’ option (from the upper right corner)  to add a new license to the existing user.

                                                                                                                                                    [^Up^]


Step 2: Clicking the ‘Add New License’ option will lead you to the Add new license page.


Select the company name and center name from the respective drop-down list boxes. Fill in the API key, API secret, and PMI passcode details. Specify the maximum licensed user information for the company. Pick a status of the license from the ‘Status’ drop-down list.


Click on the ‘Submit’ button to save the entered details.

                                                                                                                                                [^Up^]


Step 3 : To add a new user to the entered license, go to the license list page, and click the ‘Add User’ option from the ‘Action’ column. 


                                                                                                                                            [^Up^]

Step 4 :  Clicking upon the ‘Add User’, you will be taken to the license details page. From where you can select the ‘Add New User’ option to add a new user to the entered license.


Step 5: Clicking upon the ‘Add New User’ option, you will be taken to the ‘Add New User’ page. 


Enter the first and last name, email id, and enter the ‘Maximum Meeting Count’ which is the maximum number of meeting per day for the user. 


Choose the status of the user from the ‘Status’ drop-down list. And click the ‘Submit’ button to submit the details.


Now the License is successfully added for the company.

                                                                                                                                                    [^Up^]

Step 6 : To edit the user details, go to the ‘License Details’ page and click the ‘Edit’ option from the ‘User List’ section at the bottom.


                                                                                                                                                [^Up^]

articles.title: 1Core - ChildcareCRM Integration
articles.description:
Integration between 1Core and ChildcareCRM facilitates the export of parent and child information from ChildcareCRM to 1Core, saving the time of having to re-enter this information.


Activation Process
1. At 1Core SA Login:

    a. Enable OnCare CRM Integeration

    b. Create an username and password. This is a company level integration.


2. Submit Support Ticket to ChildcareCRM (currently support@childcarecrm.com) with the client details and 1Core username and password.

3. Upon ChildcareCRM enables 1Core integration steps, the integration is set to go.


Document Reference:

OnCare_ChildcareCRM_Integration_Jun2014.pdf - Briefs the process with ChildcareCRM screenshots.

OCO_CRM_Webservice_23Mar2012.pdf - Web service document for ChildcareCRM to consume the APIs


SA Screenshot reference:

articles.title: ADP Payroll Report for Upload
articles.description:
This user guide is intended for the users who use 1Core to capture their staff time sheet data for hourly payroll and use ADP as your payroll service provider. If so, you can request the 1Core team to enable the ADP Payroll Report which allows you to upload your periodic payroll file directly to ADP.

 

Before the 1Core team can configure this feature in 1Core for your company, you must provide us with the following 2 pieces of information required in the ADP Payroll Report:

  • ADP Co Code
  • ADP Batch ID

 

Next you must update each staff record in 1Core to capture the ADP Employee ID within the Staff ID field:

The three pieces of data will automatically be included on the ADP Payroll Report.


After the above set up is done, you can now access the ADP Payroll Report with the path below:

 

Under Company Dashboard --> Report


Select Multi-Location Reports


 

Select Report Category for “Others”



Select “ADP Payroll Report”



Enter the pay period you would like the 1Core system to generate the ADP Payroll Report.

 


After you click “Submit”, the system will download a payroll file for the selected period.  You can open the file in Excel.


Once you have reviewed the ADP Payroll Report and deemed that it is accurate, you can choose to upload the file to ADP.

articles.title: Add New Staff User
articles.description:
You can add a 'New Staff' to your center using the 'Staff' module of 1Core. To create a staff profile, you may need staff's personal information, training & certifications, medical & emergency details, schedules, and classroom details. 



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Staff > Add New 





If you provide the 'Virtual Classes - Learn@Home' feature to your children, you can designate the staff as 'Virtual Instructor' using the virtual instructor radio button.  


You can also choose the staff's lesson plan approval here, using the Lesson Plan Approval Required radio button. 


If 'Yes' is chosen - Lesson Plans made by this staff 'needs' approval from the approver. 

If 'No' is chosen - Lesson Plans made by this staff will automatically be published without any approval. 


You can upload staff's training and certifications here,


For the immunization info, enter the date of the immunization on the text boxes. You can customize the 'Immunization Information' using the 'Immunization Setup'.  



The center information and staff schedule information can be recorded at the bottom of the staff profile page.

You can customize the 'Immunization Information' using the 'Immunization Setup'.          The center information and staff schedule information can be recorded at the bottom of the staff profile page.

articles.title: Staff - Record Absence
articles.description:
1. Open the 'Staff' Module


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Staff 



2. Select the 'Absence' option.



3. Select the 'Absence Code' and enter your notes regarding the leave (Not mandatory).



You can take a printout of the absence record of this staff by selecting the 'Print' button at the upper right. 


Note: You can use the 'Filter' option to change the date range for staff absence.



4. Select the 'Submit' button to record the absence.

articles.title: Paid Time Off for Staff
articles.description:
You can add PTO records of staff using the 'PTO' option on the staff page. It covers staff's used, earned, and balance PTO hours. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Staff




Add - PTO :



Note : Use the 'Filter' option to configure the date range of the Staff PTO result. 



Select the date and specify the 'PTO' type from the drop-down.



For Time, you need to choose between 'Used' and 'Earned'. Specify the PTO hours and add notes.



Edit - PTO :


To edit an existing PTO, select the 'edit' icon near the entered PTO record. 



You can only edit the 'Date', 'Hours', and 'Notes' of an existing PTO record. 'PTO Type' and 'Time' once recorded cannot be changed.

articles.title: Add/Edit - Staff Time Card
articles.description:
You can add/edit staff time cards using the staff module. The staff time card page will give you a complete insight into staff's sign-in/out timings, total weekly hours, standard hours, and payroll hours.

 

Access Path : Center Dashboard > Staff

 


On the 'Time Card' page, enter the date, time in & out of the staff, classroom, and notes (Not mandatory). 



Edit - Time Card :


In case of any wrong time card entry was recorded, you can adjust the time card entry using the 'Edit' option.



Edit the recorded time card entry in the Add/Edit Time Sheet and select the 'Save' button.
