articles.title: How to allow / remove staff Sign-in after scheduled hours?
articles.description:
STAFF SIGN-IN OUTSIDE THE SCHEDULED HOURS

 

At the Company level, the Company super user can restrict the Regular staff from sign-in outside their scheduled hours. Once the Sign-in restriction is setup at the Company level, it is automatically applied to all the Centers in the Company[KK1] .

 

The Company Super User / any other role that is granted rights to edit can allow the staff to sign-in outside their scheduled hours, by navigating to their individual profile page, if needed.

 

a. How to restrict Staff Sign-in outside the scheduled hours?

 

The Company Super User can apply Sign-in restriction to Regular staff at the Center, by configuring the Staff Payroll Hours Setup.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Access Path: Company Dashboard  Setup  Staff  Staff Payroll Hours Setup

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The restriction is applied by

  1. Clicking ‘Yes’, for ‘Do you want to restrict staff sign-in based on scheduled time and
  2. Entering the grace time for Sign-in in minutes for ‘How early can the staff Sign-in before their scheduled time?’

 

Fig. 1 Staff Payroll Hours Setup

 

b. How to allow the Staff to Sign-in after scheduled hours?


To remove the Sign-in restrictions for the staff, navigate to the individual staff profile using the path given in Fig. 2.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Access Path: Center Dashboard  Staffing  Staff Records

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Fig. 2 Staff Records


To apply the restriction to a staff, click the Action icon against a staff record. This displays the options – Timecard, PTO, Absence, Notes and Staff Schedule. Clicking the Staff Schedule option displays the profile page of the staff. (Fig. 3).


 

Fig. 3 Profile page of the Staff


By default, the Sign-in restriction is set to ‘’Yes’’. Click on the Edit icon near Sign-in, in the profile page


Fig. 4 Edit the Sign-in restriction 


This displays the pop-up where the checkbox can be checked to apply the sign-in restriction to the individual staff.


 

Fig. 5 Checkbox to set the sign-in restriction to the individual staff

 

In summary,

  • The Company Super User can restrict Sign-in outside the scheduled hours by Regular staff in all the Centers, through setup at the Company level and 
  • The Company Super User or any other user role that is granted permission to allow sign-in of a staff, outside the scheduled hours can do so at the Company level through the individual staff profile.
articles.description_text: STAFF SIGN-IN OUTSIDE THE SCHEDULED HOURS     At the Company level, the Company super user can restrict the Regular staff from sign-in outside their scheduled hours. Once the Sign-in restriction is setup at the Company level, it is automatically applied to all the Centers in the Company[KK1] .     The Company Super User / any other role that is granted rights to edit can allow the staff to sign-in outside their scheduled hours, by navigating to their individual profile page, if needed.     a. How to restrict Staff Sign-in outside the scheduled hours?     The Company Super User can apply Sign-in restriction to Regular staff at the Center, by configuring the Staff Payroll Hours Setup.  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Access Path: Company Dashboard  Setup  Staff  Staff Payroll Hours Setup  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  The restriction is applied by   Clicking ‘Yes’, for ‘Do you want to restrict staff sign-in based on scheduled time and  Entering the grace time for Sign-in in minutes for ‘How early can the staff Sign-in before their scheduled time?’        Fig. 1 Staff Payroll Hours Setup     b. How to allow the Staff to Sign-in after scheduled hours?     To remove the Sign-in restrictions for the staff, navigate to the individual staff profile using the path given in Fig. 2.     ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Access Path: Center Dashboard  Staffing  Staff Records  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------       Fig. 2 Staff Records     To apply the restriction to a staff, click the Action icon  against a staff record. This displays the options – Timecard, PTO, Absence, Notes and Staff Schedule. Clicking the Staff Schedule option displays the profile page of the staff. (Fig. 3).          Fig. 3 Profile page of the Staff     By default, the Sign-in restriction is set to ‘’Yes’’. Click on the Edit icon near Sign-in, in the profile page       Fig. 4 Edit the Sign-in restriction      This displays the pop-up where the checkbox can be checked to apply the sign-in restriction to the individual staff.        Fig. 5 Checkbox to set the sign-in restriction to the individual staff     In summary,   The Company Super User can restrict Sign-in outside the scheduled hours by Regular staff in all the Centers, through setup at the Company level and   The Company Super User or any other user role that is granted permission to allow sign-in of a staff, outside the scheduled hours can do so at the Company level through the individual staff profile.

articles.title: Staff Schedule
articles.description:
To add a schedule for a staff member, you must select the 'Staff Schedule' option from the staff module. By doing so, you can ensure your center's program functions seamlessly with the required staff, avoiding any confusion over the staff schedule.



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Staff > Select a Staff > Staff Schedule




Assigning a classroom :


Select the Edit icon next to the 'Assigned Classroom' to add/edit the classroom for the selected staff. 



Staff Absence : 


If you want the staff absence to be automatically checked based on their sign-in/out records for the day, select 'No' or leave the check box unchecked for the 'Do not check for absence' option. 


However, if you check the 'Do not check for absence' option, then the absence will not be marked for the staff automatically.



Add Schedule :


You can create a schedule from scratch or choose from available templates. 1Core provides three staff schedule templates (AM/ Full Day / PM)  for centers to work on. But centers can also create their own templates (Article: Staff Schedule Templates)


Fill out the schedule in the Add Schedule pop-up,




Along with your current schedule, you can also have your future schedules as 'Upcoming Schedules' on your staff schedule page. 

The end date for the current program will be automatically updated once we add a future schedule.

1Core provides three templates for the customer to work on, you can add multiple templates using the 'Add Schedule Template' option.

articles.title: FamilyChildStatus Job
articles.description:
The "FamilyChildStatus" Job Timing is 20:00(PST) 23:00(EST) 08:30(IST) 03:00(UTC)


Two items will run in this job.


Item 1: Active To Inactive


Active to Inactive job will run for the current date. i.e If the Active child having "Withdrawal Date" as 11/10/2020 , then the child status is changed from ACTIVE to INACTIVE on 11/10/2020.


Item 2: Incoming to Active


Incoming to Active job will run for the next date. i.e If the Incoming child having "Enrollment Start Date" as 11/11/2020 , then the child status is changed from INCOMING to ACTIVE on 11/10/2020.

Item 2: Incoming to Active     Incoming to Active job will run for the next date. i.e If the Incoming child having "Enrollment Start Date" as 11/11/2020 , then the child status is changed from INCOMING to ACTIVE on 11/10/2020.

articles.title: Staff Schedule Report
articles.description:
This report helps you generate the company's weekly staff schedule. This report is based on the staff hire and termination date in the staff profile. 


Access Path : Company Dashboard > Report > Staff Schedule Report


You can use the 'Select center' option to choose a specific center and generate its weekly staff schedule report. Alternatively, select the 'All' option to generate the weekly staff schedule report for the entire company.


If you wish to exclude non-scheduled staff in this report, choose 'No' to the 'Do you want to include non-scheduled staff to this report' option.

articles.title: Billing by Attendance
articles.description:
This report calculates actual hours through attendance, considering scheduled or contracted hours.

Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Billing by Attendance



This report provides two filtering options

The 'Scheduled Hours' represent the hours scheduled in the child’s program schedule. This report displays the comparison between scheduled hours and actual hours, and its variance.


The 'Contracted Hours' represent the 'monthly contracted hours' that are pre-recorded in the child's profile. This report displays the comparison between the contracted hours and the actual hours, and its variance.



Scheduled Hours

Comparing a child's scheduled hours against the actual hours.


For example, when a child enrolls in the program, the scheduled hours are calculated from the program schedule. If the child attends for 162 hours, a variance is calculated using the scheduled and actual hours.



Contracted Hours


In the child's profile, there's a section for 'monthly contracted hours', this generates a report by comparing the contracted hours against the actual hours attended.

For instance, the contracted hours initially set for 140 hours, is recorded in the child's profile. If the child attends for 162 hours, a variance will be generated based on this difference.

articles.title: Family Information Sheet/ Family Notes Report
articles.description:
This “Family Information Sheet/ Family Notes Report” generates two distinct reports,

  • The Family Information Sheet contains all family-related details, including parent and child information, allergies, special diets, hospital and doctor information, emergency contacts, and more.
  • The Family Notes Report complies all the notes added to the family profile.
Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Family Information Sheet/Family Notes Report


Family Information Sheet

The report is generated based on the information provided in the family profile.



By default, the family and child status will be active, you can also change the status.

If you selected the family information sheet, 

You can also include or exclude these filters in the report.

  •  Print Child Questions
  •  Print Child Address
  •  Print Restricted Person details
  •  Print Child Photo
  • Print Doctor Information
  •  Print Additional Information
  • Print Immunization Information




Family Notes Report 

Any information added to the family profile will be displayed in this report.


Finally, you will receive the family notes report based on the selected category.

By default, it will display the active status for the Authorized person. However, you also have the option to select status.

articles.title: Sign Out (Late pick up) Report
articles.description:
A child signs in for the day, an attendance record is created to track their activities throughout the day. This report helps to monitor late pick-up using sign-out times. You can verify who are all qualifies for attendance-based billing.

Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Sign Out (Late Pick-up) Report



Click 'Select a period' and choose dates.

Sign Out Times options are:

After: This option allows you to enter a specific time. The report will include children who signed out after the time you've specified.

Before: Here, you enter a specific time. The report will include children who signed out before the time you've specified.

Between: This option involves setting a time range and enter a start time and an end time ("From-To"). The report will then include children who signed out within that specified time frame. 

For instance, if you set the range from 6 PM to 6:30 PM, the report will display children who signed out between these hours.



This report includes ‘Child's Name’, ‘Classroom’, ‘Authorized Person’, and the Out Time of the children.

articles.title: Children Sign In Report by Time and Date Range
articles.description:
The 'Children Sign In Report by Time and Date Range' displays children's 'Sign In' records, specifying the exact time and date they entered the school.

This report helps the Director to know at what time the children are signed into the school.

The report is generated in 3 Sign In Time types:

  • After – If the time is set as "After 9 AM", the report will display the children who are all signed in after 9 AM to the school.
  • Before - If the time is set as "Before 9 AM", the report will display the children who are all signed in before 9 AM to the school.
  • Between - If the time is set as "Between 9 AM to 9.30 AM", the report will display the children who are all signed in between 9 AM to 9.30 AM.
Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Children Sign In Report by Time and Date Range





This report displays the Sign In Time”, “Authorized Person” and “Classroom” for the children.

This “Failure to Sign Out” report provides the details of children who have “Signed In” but missed to “Sign Out” from the school.

It also provides the “Classroom” and “Authorized Person” details i.e., who has signed in the child from the school. 

Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Failure to Sign Out




This report displays the “Sign In Time”, “Authorized Person” and “Classroom” for the children.

This “Child Time Clock Entries” report includes child’s “Time In” and “Time Out” along with the “Classroom” and “Authorized Person” details i.e., who signed in and signed out the child from the center.

Date :  Child time clock entries ( child name, authorized person, time in/out) will be grouped by the date for the selected period.

You can include the classroom summary in the report by using the 'Do you want to include classroom summary' option.

A “Weekly Attendance Details” report allows you to view a child's “Sign IN/OUT” and “Total Hours” for a selected week.

Child Sign-In by an Authorized Person: You can apply this filter to generate a report for Sign-IN/OUT recorded through the 1Core Web, Attend app, or Family app.

Meals claimed under Free (FR), Reduced (RD), Paid/Base (PB), or Not Assigned (NA) categories for appropriate CACFP Reimbursement. These details are already recorded in the child’s profile and will be reflected here.

articles.title: Staff Time Sheet
articles.description:
This report generates the Time IN and OUT and also displays whether the staff have used PTO during the selected period.

Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Staff > Staff Time Sheet



Pay Period     - Select a date or it will generate based on the pre-set of Staff Payroll Hour


Date Range     - Enter custom dates or click the   icon to choose a date.



There are two filters available

 

'Group by Time Interval' allows you to generate reports based on 5, 10, 15, and 20-minute transition intervals.


By selecting 'Do you want to include staff absence', you can include staff absences in the report. 

 

By selecting 'Include Supervisor Name,' you can include the supervisor's name in the report. The center supervisor's name will be displayed by default, but you can edit the name if required. 




Standard Hours (Std Hrs) - Scheduled hours 

Actual Hours (Hrs) - Actual hours 

Variance (Var) - Difference between ‘Standard hours’ and ‘Actual hours’


Payroll Hours - Considering both regular and overtime hours based on their schedule

If a staff member's scheduled hours are 9 hours and they work for 9 hours and 30 minutes, the additional 30 minutes will be counted as overtime. Overtime hours are determined by their scheduled hours.


If your staff time clock entries report includes multiple sign ins and sign outs with minimal intervals due to frequent classroom movements, and you prefer a more concise report, you can use the 'Time Interval' option.

 

Group by time interval helps the centers to consolidate the entries of the staff by an interval period, 


Let's say the interval is set to '5 minutes'. A staff member signs in at 08:00 AM and signs out at 10:00 AM. They then sign back in at 10:04 AM and sign out again at 11:30 AM. Since the time interval between the sign-out at 10:00 AM and the next sign-in at 10:04 AM is less than 5 minutes, these two sign-ins and sign-outs are considered a single entry i.e.,  08:00 AM to 11:30 AM.

articles.title: Staff Hours Summary Report
articles.description:
This report provides the Staff Hours Summary along with Staff Name, Staff ID, Staff Position, Staff Department, Payroll Group (Hourly or Salaried), Time Clocked Hours, Adjusted Hours, AM Hours or PM Hours, PTO Types, and Payroll Hours.

Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Staff > Staff Hours Summary Report



You can use three filter options: Staff Position, Staff Department, and Payroll Group for inclusion in the report.



Time Clocked Hours - In this Staff total hours will be shown including their OT hours.

Adjusted Hours - Only the scheduled hours are accounted for, irrespective of whether the staff works more or fewer hours than scheduled.

AM & PM Hours - In this Staff hours are displayed as how long they have worked in AM and PM hours.



PTO Hours        - Designated for staff, PTO (Paid Time Off) Hours have already been created within the PTO Types.

Payroll Hours  - This section displays the total payroll for staff members. It calculates both regular and overtime (OT) hours, irrespective of their payroll group, whether they are hourly or salaried.

Payroll Group - The preference set in the profile—whether salaried or hourly.

Position           - The positions or departments that have been mapped in the staff profile.
articles.description_text: This report provides the Staff Hours Summary along with Staff Name, Staff ID, Staff Position, Staff Department, Payroll Group (Hourly or Salaried), Time Clocked Hours, Adjusted Hours, AM Hours or PM Hours, PTO Types, and Payroll Hours.  Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Staff > Staff Hours Summary Report          You can use three filter options: Staff Position, Staff Department, and Payroll Group for inclusion in the report.          Time Clocked Hours - In this Staff total hours will be shown including their OT hours.  Adjusted Hours - Only the scheduled hours are accounted for, irrespective of whether the staff works more or fewer hours than scheduled.  AM & PM Hours - In this Staff hours are displayed as how long they have worked in AM and PM hours.          PTO Hours        - Designated for staff, PTO (Paid Time Off) Hours have already been created within the PTO Types.  Payroll Hours  - This section displays the total payroll for staff members. It calculates both regular and overtime (OT) hours, irrespective of their payroll group, whether they are hourly or salaried.  Payroll Group - The preference set in the profile—whether salaried or hourly.  Position           - The positions or departments that have been mapped in the staff profile.

articles.title: Hourly Staff Actual vs. Budgeted Hours Report
articles.description:
The 'Hourly Staff Actual vs. Budgeted Hours Report' displays the actual and budgeted hours of the active staff, including the number of staff members, their actual staff hours, and budgeted hours, along with their break hours, variance and percentage.


This report will be generated exclusively for active staff and will include break hours for budgeted hour calculations.


Access Path: Company Dashboard > Reports > Hourly Staff Actual vs. Budgeted Hours report

 



 

It can be generated in two ways as mentioned below: 


  1. Based on Days Worked:   Compares the actual hours with the budgeted hours only for the days when staff are present.
  2. Based on Staff Schedule: Compares the actual hours with the total budgeted hours set in the staff schedule.


1. Based on Days Worked

The report compares the actual hours worked to the total budgeted hours but only for the days when staff are present.

 

Budgeted Staff Hours

When a staff member has attendance, then their scheduled hours will be calculated and displayed.

For instance, if a center has 6 staff members scheduled for 8 hours, but only 2 staff members have recorded attendance, the budgeted staff hours will be calculated as follows:

2 Staff * 8 Hours Schedule = 16 hours.

Actual Staff Hours

The staff actual attendance hours are calculated and displayed as follows.


For instance, if a center has 6 staff members scheduled for 8 hours, but only 2 staff members were present for 1 hour, then...

The calculation would be 2 Staff * 1 hour = 2 hours in total.

 

The variance will be determined by subtracting the Actual Staff Hours from the Budgeted Staff Hours 

Variance = (2 – 16 = -14)

2. Based on Staff Schedule

The report generates a comparison of actual hours to the total budgeted hours set in the staff schedule.

Budgeted Staff Hours

 When a staff member has a schedule, Budgeted Hours will be displayed.

 

'Budgeted Hours' refer to the scheduled hours/planned hours, including breaks, for active staff. 

 

For instance, if a staff member is scheduled for 9 hours on Monday (10/30/2023), including a break, their budgeted hours for that day would be 9 hours.

 

Consider this scenario: If a center has 6 staff members scheduled for 8 hours, 

The calculation would be: 6 Staff * 8 Hours = 48 hours in total.

 

Actual Staff Hours

‘Actual Hours’ refers to the actual staff hours of active staff, irrespective of their scheduled hours on a day.

For instance, if a center has 5 staff members scheduled for 8 hours but only 2 staff members are present for 1hour,

The calculation would be: 2 Staff * 1 hours = 2 hours in total.


 The variance is calculated by subtracting the Budgeted Staff Hours from the Actual Staff Hours

 

Variance = (2 - 48 = -46)


Note: If staff Sign-IN at the center but forget to Sign-Out on a day, their actual hours won't be calculated in the report.

articles.title: Child Immunization / Physical Health Exam Report
articles.description:
This report helps you to prepare a holistic report on child immunization history & missing and physical health expiration reports. You can generate this report based on the child status and classroom. 



You can generate three types of reports using this feature :


1. Immunization History Report  :


Using this option, you can generate a sheet that has children's details (Name, Age, DOB) and all immunization types (DtaP, Polio, Hep A, etc). You can manually enter the immunization status of each vaccine in the space provided.


2. Immunization Missing Report :


Using this option, you can generate a sheet that has the information regarding the immunization due of children.



3. Physical Health Exam Expiration :


This option helps you to generate physical exam expiration report with three different parameters.


I. Report on 'Upcoming' physical health exam expiry for children 

II. Report on children with 'Already' expired physical health exam 

III. Report of children who are all with missing expiration date

articles.title: Sign In/Out Sheet
articles.description:
You can generate a Daily/Weekly/Monthly - Sign In/Out sheet with children's details and columns with space to mark the timings and comments.


Primary Classroom: Program the classroom(s) for the children during the chosen period. If no program is available for a child during the chosen period, the system will use the classroom listed on the child's profile page as the primary classroom for that period.


Secondary Classroom: Secondary classroom of the children from their profile page.


Scheduled: Scheduled classroom(s) of the children during the chosen period.


Generated Report 


Daily

 

Weekly 


Monthly



 FAQ


1. How is the report generated for a child who enrolled in two programs in one month?


Let's say a child is enrolled in two programs in a month, each with a different classroom.

For the month of July 2024, a child enrolled in the Infant - 3 Day program (Class A)  and the Infant - 2 Day program (Class B).

 

Now, when you generate the report for July 2024:

With the ‘Program’ filter: This child will be grouped under both the Infant - 3 Day program and the Infant - 2 Day program.

With the ‘Primary Classroom’ filter: This child will be grouped under both Class A and Class B.

With the ‘Secondary Classroom ’ filter: This child will be grouped under the ‘Not Assigned’ classroom.


2. What is the report for a child who has a program in the current month/week/custom period but not in the next?

 

To explain this scenario, let's take a child who is enrolled in 'Class A' for the month of July 2024 in the Program of Infant - 2 Day program and does not have any program for the next month (August 2024). 


With the ‘Program’ filter: This child will be grouped under the Infant - 2 Day program for the current month and next month the child will not be included in this program.


With the ‘Primary Classroom’ filter: The child will be displayed under ‘Class A’ for the current month and ‘Not Assigned’ classroom for the next month.


With the ‘Secondary Classroom’ filter: If a child has a secondary classroom for the current month/ next month, they will be displayed. If not, they will be shown as ‘Not Assigned’.



3. A new child will be enrolling in the center next month in the program classroom ‘Class A’. Will this child be included in next month’s report?

 

Yes, this child will be grouped under ‘Class A’ in next month’s report.


4. A child currently enrolled in the program, which ends on July 31, 2024, is assigned to ‘Class A’. Starting August 1, 2024, the same child will continue enrollment in a different program, assigned to ‘Class B’.

 

What will happen to this child in the report with the primary classroom filter?

 

In the July 2024 report, this child will be listed under ‘Class A’.

 

In the August 2024 report, this child will be listed under ‘Class B’


5. What will be the primary classroom for this report?

The primary classroom for this report will be the designated classroom(s) for children during the chosen period. If no program is available for a child during that period, the system will use the classroom listed on the child's profile page as the primary classroom for that period.

articles.title: Chargeback
articles.description:
Chargeback - is an amount that has been successfully returned to the payment card of the parents after being deposited into the center's account. This happens when the parent has any dispute regarding the payment made and they take it to the banks for a chargeback. 


A chargeback can happen for both card and ACH transactions. It can happen for direct family portal payments and director initiated batch payments.


Example :


Willie Wolf made a payment of 50 USD to the center's account and it got successfully deposited on 12/23/2021.



The same transaction reflected on the family's ledger records,



After some days Willie Wolf raised a dispute with the bank regarding the 50 USD payment and got the chargeback. So the status of the 50 USD payment in the family's ledger records has been changed to Card Payment Disputed (Chargeback).



An email notification is sent to the director stating the chargeback after the successful card payment dispute.
articles.description_text: Chargeback - is an amount that has been successfully returned to the payment card of the parents after being deposited into the center's account. This happens when the parent has any dispute regarding the payment made and they take it to the banks for a chargeback.      A chargeback can happen for both card and ACH transactions. It can happen for direct family portal payments and director initiated batch payments.     Example :     Willie Wolf made a payment of 50 USD to the center's account and it got successfully deposited on 12/23/2021.          The same transaction reflected on the family's ledger records,          After some days Willie Wolf raised a dispute with the bank regarding the 50 USD payment and got the chargeback. So the status of the 50 USD payment in the family's ledger records has been changed to Card Payment Disputed (Chargeback).          An email notification is sent to the director stating the chargeback after the successful card payment dispute.

articles.title: Withdrawal Report
articles.description:
You can use this report to find out the withdrawing children from your center for a specified period of time. This report is based on the enrollment start and withdrawal date. 


This report has been added to the center and company level reports. 


Center Level 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Reports > Operations > Withdrawal Report



Company Level:


At company level, you can generate the report for a single center or for all centers. 


Access Path : Company Dashboard > Reports > Operations > Withdrawal Report
articles.description_text: You can use this report to find out the withdrawing children from your center for a specified period of time. This report is based on the enrollment start and withdrawal date.      This report has been added to the center and company level reports.      Center Level      Access Path : Center Dashboard > Reports > Operations > Withdrawal Report          Company Level:     At company level, you can generate the report for a single center or for all centers.      Access Path : Company Dashboard > Reports > Operations > Withdrawal Report

articles.title: Rollcall Sheet
articles.description:
1. Download your center's 'Rollcall Sheet' using this report. Rollcall Sheet is based on the enrollment start and withdrawal date. 



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Reports > Attendance > Rollcall Sheet


1.1. Type :


Program - Generates the report based on the classrooms from the program schedule. Those who enrolled with out any program will be left out in this report. 


Classroom - Generates a rollcall sheet based on the classrooms from the children profile page. It includes the children irrespective of the program schedule (With / Without programs), all enrolled children will be included in this report. 


1.1.1. Type - Program


Select the 'Program' on the 'Select Type' option to generate a rollcall sheet based on the center's program.


For Program based  rollcall sheet, you need to select the program(s) to generate the report. 

 

1.1.2. Classroom Type 


Primary Classroom: Program the classroom(s) for the children during the chosen period. If no program is available for a child during the chosen period, the system will use the classroom listed on the child's profile page as the primary classroom for that period.


Secondary Classroom: Secondary classroom of the children from their profile page.


Scheduled: Scheduled classroom(s) of the children during the chosen period.



1.1.3. Type - Classroom


Select the 'Classroom' on the 'Select Type' option to generate a rollcall sheet based on the center's program.


For Classroom based rollcall sheet, you need to select the classroom(s) to generate the report. 



Note : You can include children with active/incoming/waitlist/inactive/covid-19 status to this report.


2. Generation Period:


You can generate both weekly and monthly rollcall sheet.


Weekly


You have three options to generate weekly rollcall sheet.


1. Roll call Sheets - Regular Rollcall Sheet for the center with day & date column with comments.

2. Current In/Out Schedule - Rollcall Sheet with In/Out timings from the children's program schedule.

3.AM/PM Schedule - Rollcall Sheet with marked AM/PM schedule of the children. 


Print Report - Rollcall Sheets



Monthly 


For monthly rollcall sheets, you only have rollcall sheet option in the 'Monthly' drop-down.



Print Report - Rollcall Sheets


FAQ


1. How is the report generated for a child who enrolled in two programs in one month?


Let's say a child is enrolled in two programs in a month, each with a different classroom.

For the month of July 2024, a child enrolled in the Infant - 3 Day program (Class A)  and the Infant - 2 Day program (Class B).

 

Now, when you generate the report for July 2024:

With the ‘Program’ filter: This child will be grouped under both the Infant - 3 Day program and the Infant - 2 Day program.

With the ‘Primary Classroom’ filter: This child will be grouped under both Class A and Class B.

With the ‘Secondary Classroom ’ filter: This child will be grouped under the ‘Not Assigned’ classroom.


2. What is the report for a child who has a program in the current month/week/custom period but not in the next?

 

To explain this scenario, let's take a child who is enrolled in 'Class A' for the month of July 2024 in the Program of Infant - 2 Day program and does not have any program for the next month (August 2024). 


With the ‘Program’ filter: This child will be grouped under the Infant - 2 Day program for the current month and next month the child will not be included in this program.


With the ‘Primary Classroom’ filter: The child will be displayed under ‘Class A’ for the current month and ‘Not Assigned’ classroom for the next month.


With the ‘Secondary Classroom’ filter: If a child has a secondary classroom for the current month/ next month, they will be displayed. If not, they will be shown as ‘Not Assigned’.



3. A new child will be enrolling in the center next month in the program classroom ‘Class A’. Will this child be included in next month’s report?

 

Yes, this child will be grouped under ‘Class A’ in next month’s report.


4. A child currently enrolled in the program, which ends on July 31, 2024, is assigned to ‘Class A’. Starting August 1, 2024, the same child will continue enrollment in a different program, assigned to ‘Class B’.

 

What will happen to this child in the report with the primary classroom filter?

 

In the July 2024 report, this child will be listed under ‘Class A’.

 

In the August 2024 report, this child will be listed under ‘Class B.

articles.title: Weekly RollCall Sheet

Primary Classroom: Program the classroom(s) for the children during the chosen period. If no program is available for a child during the chosen period, the system will use the classroom listed on the child's profile page as the primary classroom for that period.


Secondary Classroom: Secondary classroom of the children from their profile page.


Scheduled: Scheduled classroom(s) of the children during the chosen period.

For those children, who don't have any program schedule the In/Out timings column will be left blank.

articles.title: Classroom Capacity Planning Report
articles.description:
This report helps you to prepare an effective classroom capacity plan for your center based on the children's enrollment start and withdrawal date.



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Reports > Operations > Classroom Capacity Planning Report



Note : If a Child has a schedule means the associated days column will be marked with 'X' otherwise left blank.


You can generate this report based on the date, child status, classroom type, and classroom. The generated report contains both children and teachers of the selected classrooms. 


Classroom Type :


Primary Classroom: Program the classroom(s) for the children during the chosen period. If no program is available for a child during the chosen period, the system will use the classroom listed on the child's profile page as the primary classroom for that period.


Secondary Classroom: Secondary classroom of the children from their profile page.


Scheduled: Scheduled classroom(s) of the children during the chosen period.



Note: You can download this report in pdf and csv format. 



FAQs


1. How is the report generated for a child who enrolled in two programs in one month?


Let's say a child is enrolled in two programs in a month, each with a different classroom.

For the month of July 2024, a child enrolled in the Infant - 3 Day program (Class A)  and the Infant - 2 Day program (Class B).

 

Now, when you generate the report for July 2024:

With the ‘Program’ filter: This child will be grouped under both the Infant - 3 Day program and the Infant - 2 Day program.

With the ‘Primary Classroom’ filter: This child will be grouped under both Class A and Class B.

With the ‘Secondary Classroom ’ filter: This child will be grouped under the ‘Not Assigned’ classroom.


2. What is the report for a child who has a program in the current month/week/custom period but not in the next?

 

To explain this scenario, let's take a child who is enrolled in 'Class A' for the month of July 2024 in the Program of Infant - 2 Day program and does not have any program for the next month (August 2024). 


With the ‘Program’ filter: This child will be grouped under the Infant - 2 Day program for the current month and next month the child will not be included in this program.


With the ‘Primary Classroom’ filter: The child will be displayed under ‘Class A’ for the current month and ‘Not Assigned’ classroom for the next month.


With the ‘Secondary Classroom’ filter: If a child has a secondary classroom for the current month/ next month, they will be displayed. If not, they will be shown as ‘Not Assigned’.



3. A new child will be enrolling in the center next month in the program classroom ‘Class A’. Will this child be included in next month’s report?

 

Yes, this child will be grouped under ‘Class A’ in next month’s report.


4. A child currently enrolled in the program, which ends on July 31, 2024, is assigned to ‘Class A’. Starting August 1, 2024, the same child will continue enrollment in a different program, assigned to ‘Class B’.

 

What will happen to this child in the report with the primary classroom filter?

 

In the July 2024 report, this child will be listed under ‘Class A’.

 

In the August 2024 report, this child will be listed under ‘Class B’.

articles.title: How to Create and Assign a Bus Run for a Child
articles.description:
To create a bus run for a center, 


 1. You need to create a bus run setup at the center level.

 2. Assign the children with a created bus run. 


Create - Bus Run Setup,


You can create multiple bus runs using the bus run setup. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Center and Child > Bus Run Setup


To create a new bus run, select the 'Add New' button from the top right corner of the page.

 


On the new bus run pop-up, enter the name of the bus run and choose the status of it.




Assign - Bus Run to a Child


You can assign the bus run to a child using their child profile.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Children > a Choose a child profile


Select the edit button from the bus run setup of the child profile page to assign a bus run to the child.


On the bus run pop-up window, you can add/remove the bus run to the child profile.

Assign - Bus Run to a Child     You can assign the bus run to a child using their child profile.     Access Path : Center Dashboard > Children > a Choose a child profile     Select the edit button from the bus run setup of the child profile page to assign a bus run to the child.       On the bus run pop-up window, you can add/remove the bus run to the child profile.

articles.title: Children Summary by Program End Date
articles.description:
Children Summary by Program End date is used to find out the children who are all having their program end date in the selected period of time and this report is based on the 'Program start and end date'. 




This will help you to find the future opening slots in the programs and prepare you for future enrollment works.  


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Reports > Children Summary by Program End Date





Based on the program date, this report includes children with active, inactive, covid-19, and incoming status.


 

Filters


1Core has provided two types of filters to this report,


            1. Program to be Completed in ___ Days.

            2. By date.


Program to be Completed in___ Days 


You can use this filter to find out the children who are all having the 'Program End Date' in the given within-days range.



By Date


You can generate a report for a specified date range using this 'By Date' filter.

Access Path : Center Dashboard > Reports > Center > Child Care Facility Roster



This report is based on the children's enrollment start and withdrawal date.

articles.title: Full Time Equivalency (FTE) Report
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. Introduction 
  • 2. Report - Based on Program 
  • 3. Report - Based on the Classroom
  • 4. FAQs
    • 4.1. If a child only has a primary classroom, no secondary classroom, and the FTE Calculations base is set as 'Secondary Classroom'. How will be this child represented in that report?
    • 4.2. How will this report represent a child with only completed program(s) or enrolled without a program in the center?

1. Introduction 


You can generate a weekly FTE report for the center's program and classrooms based on the child's enrollment start and withdrawal date.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Report > Operations > Full Time Equivalency Report




2. Report - Based on Program 


You can generate an FTE report for all the programs in the center and the children who are all enrolled in the programs. 




3. Report - Based on the Classroom


You can generate an FTE report for the classrooms (Primary or Secondary Classroom) of the center and the children enrolled in the classrooms. 


Report with Primary Classroom option,



Report with Secondary Classroom option,




4. FAQs


4.1. If a child only has a primary classroom, no secondary classroom, and the FTE Calculations base is set as 'Secondary Classroom'. How will be this child represented in that report?


If a child has only one classroom (either the primary or secondary) and the FTE calculations are set as on the non-existent classroom of the child on the report then that child will be categorized as the 'Not Assigned'.




4.2. How will this report represent a child with only completed program(s) or enrolled without a program in the center?


Both children without a program schedule and with only a completed program(s) schedule are categorized as 'Not Assigned'.

Report - Based on the Classroom     You can generate an FTE report for the classrooms (Primary or Secondary Classroom) of the center and the children enrolled in the classrooms.      Report with Primary Classroom option,          Report with Secondary Classroom option,             4. FAQs     4.1. If a child only has a primary classroom, no secondary classroom, and the FTE Calculations base is set as 'Secondary Classroom'. How will be this child represented in that report?     If a child has only one classroom (either the primary or secondary) and the FTE calculations are set as on the non-existent classroom of the child on the report then that child will be categorized as the 'Not Assigned'.           4.2. How will this report represent a child with only completed program(s) or enrolled without a program in the center?     Both children without a program schedule and with only a completed program(s) schedule are categorized as 'Not Assigned'.

  • 1. Children Classroom Summary By Days
  • 2. Frequently Asked Questions

1. Children Classroom Summary By Days


Children Classroom Summary By Days report is used to generate a weekly Classroom Summary with children details(Program schedule, Known allergies, and Medication on campus) based on the child's enrollment start and withdrawal date. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Reports > Operations > Children Classroom Summary By Days



Report :

2.1. Does this report include children without a program? 


Since this report is based on the enrollment start and withdrawal date, you can find the children without an assigned program in this report. But their 'Days' column will be blank.

articles.title: FAQ - Enrollment/Withdrawal Report
articles.description:
Frequently Asked Questions


1. Will the Incoming children be included in this report? How does it work?


Enrollment/Withdrawal Report is based on the Child's Enrollment Date. So the children with active, inactive, Incoming, and Covid 19 status will be included in the report. 


To view the incoming status children, the enrollment start date of the incoming child must lie within the selected report period.



2. Will the Inactive child be included in this report? When it will be displayed?


Inactive children will be included in this report. They will be included on the Total Current Enrolled count and the program counts for that selected period only and their withdrawal details will be present at the bottom. 


But if you generate the report the next month (for monthly report), the inactive children count will be reduced from the total current enrolled count. 



3. If a child is enrolled in multiple programs, what will happen to the report counts?


If a child is enrolled in multiple programs, then the child will be included in the Total Current Enrolled and the respective programs. 


In the below example, Lucy Chen is enrolled in two different programs. So both program counts will include Lucy because the Count #'s are based on the program start and end dates. The total current enrolled is based on the child's enrollment start and withdrawal date. 


Hence, Total Current Enrolled will only be increased by +1 irrespective of how many programs Lucy enrolled.

So both program counts will include Lucy because the Count #'s are based on the program start and end dates. The total current enrolled is based on the child's enrollment start and withdrawal date.      Hence, Total Current Enrolled will only be increased by +1 irrespective of how many programs Lucy enrolled.

articles.title: Enrollment and Financial Projection Report
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. Introduction
  • 2. Group By
    • 2.1. Age Group 
    • 2.2. Classroom
    • 2.3. Program 
  • 3. Fix Now Alert
  • 4. FAQs

1. Introduction


Enrollment and Financial Projection Report provides you the past, present & future enrollment and financial data of the center.  The past & present uses the actual data and the future uses the projected data.


You can generate this report for any 10 months period with the ability to group by Age Group / Classroom / Program.


Based on the Group By filter, this report provides the following components individually and as a summary.


Enrollment Projection: 


    1. Enrolled     2. Capacity     3. FTE 


Financial Projection:

    

    1. Tuition       2. Other Charges     3. Discounts     4. Net Revenue     5. Average FTE Revenue 

    6. Occupancy Percentage


This report includes the Active, Incoming, Covid-19, and Inactive children present in the center. 



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Reports > Enrollment and Financial Projection


2. Group By


You can generate enrollment and financial projection report with 'Three Group By' filters. 


1. Age Group 

2. Classroom

3. Program 



2.1. Age Group 


You can generate this report based on the 'Age Group(s)' mapped in the child's profile. 


Enrolled - Based on the child's 'Enrollment Start Date'

Capacity - Based on the child's 'Classroom Capacity'

FTE - Based on the 'Child's Program Schedule FTE'

Incoming - Based on the child's 'Enrollment Start Date' 

Withdrawn - Based on the child's 'Withdrawal Date'





Note : The 'Summary' part of the report will be same for the 'Age Group' and 'Classroom' group by filters. But the 'Summary' part of the 'Program' group by filter will not have 'Capacity' projection on it. 


To map 'Age Group' to the 'Classroom' setup:


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Classroom 




Note: If you couldn't locate the Age Group drop down on the classroom setup dialog box, please contact the 1Core Support Team for enabling the option. 



2.2. Classroom


You can generate the report based on the 'Classroom(s)' mapped in the child profile.


Enrolled - Based on the child's 'Enrollment Start Date'

Capacity - Based on the child's 'Classroom Capacity'

FTE - Based on the 'Child's Program Schedule FTE'

Incoming - Based on the child's 'Enrollment Start Date' 

Withdrawn - Based on the child's 'Withdrawal Date' 





2.3. Program 


You can generate the report based on the 'Program' present in the center.  


Enrolled - Based on the 'Program Start Date'

Capacity - Based on the 'Child's Classroom Capacity'

FTE - Based on the 'Child's Program Schedule FTE'

Incoming - Based on the child's 'Enrollment Start Date' 

Withdrawn - Based on the child's 'Withdrawal Date' 



Note : Since, the Drop in Programs are attendance based, you can only view the program wise projections(enrollment and financial). But the summary's  financial part (Tuition, Other Charges, Discounts, Net Revenue and Avg FTE Revenue) won't take the drop in future numbers in to calculation, because of its uncertainty.  


3. Fix Now Alert


If there is any discrepancy in the entered center capacity, classroom age group/capacity, and FTE value for children, you will encounter an alert screen before entering into the 'Enrollment and Financial Projection Report'.  


You can either skip the alert(s) or fix it. 



Fixing the Center Capacity issue,




Fixing the FTE value for children issue,



FAQs


1. Is the 'Enrolled' count inclusive of 'Incoming' and 'Withdrawn'?


Yes, the 'Enrolled' count is inclusive of 'Incoming' and 'Withdrawn' children.


This is because both incoming and withdrawal happen within the month. So technically both 'Incoming' and 'Withdrawn' children will be in the center for at least some part of the month.



2. Will the children count match enrolled count in enrollment and financial projection report?


Since the enrollment and financial projection report is based on the child's enrollment start and withdrawal date, the child count will match the enrolled count perfectly in the enrollment and financial projection report. 



By choosing your desired period, you can view the enrollments that have been made in the past which may or may not be active in the present.

 


3. Will the incoming status children be included in the enrollment and financial projection report?


The answer is 'Yes'. The report projection will include the children with incoming status.



When a child is newly enrolled at the center in December 2024, the system will update the records as follows: a count of "1" will appear in the Incoming column for December 2024 to indicate the new enrollment. At the same time, the Enrolled count for December will increase by one, reflecting the updated total number of enrolled children that month. For example, if the center already has 25 enrolled children in December, adding a new child will increase the Enrolled count to 26.


If a child is withdrawn from the center and re-enrolled after two months, the child will be added directly to the Enrolled count for that month, rather than the Incoming column. This is because the child is being re-enrolled at the center.

articles.title: Enrollment / Withdrawal Report
articles.description:
The main objective of this report is to equip the centers with the enrollment & withdrawal counts, program enrollment counts, and the FTE counts for the given period of time. This will help the centers to plan for future enrollments. 


The Enrollment/Withdrawal Report for the center provides the following for any given period:


1. Enrollment Counts

2. Withdrawal Counts

3. Total Current Enrolled Counts

4. Count based on the filter (program / classroom / age group)

5. FTE count based on the filter (program / classroom / age group)

6. New Enrollment Details



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Reports > Enrollment/Withdrawal Report 



Note : Enrollment/Withdrawal Report includes only the detail of active,incoming,Covid-19 and inactive children. It won't include the details of waitlist children.


Calculations of Enrollment/Withdrawal :


Enrollment / Withdrawal counts are calculated based on the children's 'Enrollment Start Date' and 'Withdrawal date'.   




Calculations of Count #'s and FTE #'s Count:


1. Count #s :


This section of the report explains the programs present in the center and its enrollments. The 'Program Enrollment Start Date' is the base date for Count #'s calculation.


2. FTE's Count :


This section of the report explains the FTE efficiency of the active programs in the center. The Full-Time Equivalent or FTE #'s Count calculation uses the Program Start Date as its base date.

 

Note: Since a child can have a multiple program enrollments,there may be mismatches on the Total Current Enrolled #'s and the Total of Count #'s (including the Not Assigned)



Details of Newly Enrolled Child(ren) and Withdrawn Child(ren) :


New Enrollment Details consist of the basic details of the child with the program and tuition details. 



Withdrawal details consist of the child's basic details with withdrawal reason and date.

articles.title: Difference between "Account Activity Report" /"Total Charge/Credit Summary Report and "Specific Charge/Credit Detail Report"
articles.description:
Both the "Account Activity Report" and "Total Charge/Credit Summary Report" includes the "Beginning Balance

But the "Specific Charge/Credit Detail Report" doesn't include "Beginning Balance".
Hence the difference.


If you subtract the "Beginning Balance" from the value of this report, you will get the same value

articles.title: How To Add a Vendor
articles.description:
You can add Vendors to your camp sessions by using the Vendor option. 

You can select the Vendor option in two ways,


1.From the Camp Module


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Camp > Setup > Vendor


 


2. From Setup 



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Camp/Event > Vendor



Selecting the 'Vendor' option (From either Camp or Setup module) will take you to the 'Vendor Setup' page. Select the 'Add New Vendor' option present on the upper right corner of the 'Vendor Setup' page to add a new vendor to the camp session.



Fill out the vendor details on the 'Vendor Details' page and select the 'Save' button to save the entered Vendor detail.

Select the 'Add New Vendor' option present on the upper right corner of the 'Vendor Setup' page to add a new vendor to the camp session.        Fill out the vendor details on the 'Vendor Details' page and select the 'Save' button to save the entered Vendor detail.

articles.title: How to Add Grades to Camp Sessions
articles.description:
The grade is an eligibility criterion for the camp sessions. With this grade settings, you can allow/disallow certain age group children from registering for the camp sessions. 


You can access the 'Grade' option from two places, 


1. From the Camp module



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Camp > Setup > Grade



2. From the Setup 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Camp/Event > Grade



Selecting the 'Grade' option (From either Camp or Setup module) will take you to the 'Grade Setup' page. Select the 'Add New ' option present on the upper right corner of the 'Grade Setup' page to add a new grade to the camp session.



Selecting the Add New button will open up a new dialog box labeled 'Grade Setup'. In that 'Grade Setup', you can enter 'Grade Name' and 'Status'.

Selecting the Add New button will open up a new dialog box labeled 'Grade Setup'. In that 'Grade Setup', you can enter 'Grade Name' and 'Status'.

articles.title: How to Setup a Camp/Event
articles.description:
You can set up a Camp/Event by using the Camp module present in 1Core. The billing functions of Camp / Event are integrated with the Family Accounting. 


You can access the camp/event in two ways,


1. From the Camp module, 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Camp > Setup > Camp/Event



2. From the Setup


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Camp/Event > Camp/Event



Selecting the 'Camp / Event ' option (from either the Camp or Setup module) will take you to the camp/event setup page. 


From the 'Camp/Event Setup' page, select the 'Add New Camp/Event' option in the upper right corner to add a new camp or event.




After selecting the 'Add New Camp/Event' button, you need to fill out the details of the Camp/Event. 


Program Setup


The first section in the Camp/Event Setup details page is 'Program Setup'.




Note : If you have created any 'Tags' before the creating the camp/event, you will see an option labeled 'Select Tags Want to Assign to this Camp' below the Camp/Event Type drop-down. Otherwise you won't see the 'Tags' option.


Camp / Event Type:


To choose the type of camp or event you are setting up, select an option from the 'Camp/Event Type' drop-down list. There are five default options available in the drop-down menu to choose from."



Registration Type: 


There are two types of registration options available for parents to enroll in a Camp/Event. 


Self Registration: 


Parents have the option to directly enroll in a camp or event without the approval of the center director. The payment for the camp or event will be deducted at the end of your registration and seat allocation will be carried out automatically, without the intervention of the center/camp director. 


Director Authorized:


Parents can fill out the registration form online, and the center/camp director will review and approve it. Payment and seat allocation will occur only after the center/camp director processes the registration request. 



Early Bird Discount


The Early Bird Discount is offered to those who enroll early in the camp/event. With this discount, you can set a cut-off date to benefit.


Multi-Session Discount:


The Multi-Session Discount is a discount offered to children who are enrolled in multiple sessions of a camp or event." 


There are two types of multi-session discount options available,


1. Same Discount for Each Session: With this option, all sessions in a camp or event will receive the same discount 


2.Different Discount for Each Session: With this option, you can set custom discounts for each session in a camp or event. These discounts can only be configured after the successful creation of the program 


You can also establish a minimum number of sessions that must be attended in order to be eligible for the Multi-Session Discount.

 

After creating the camp program, you can configure the 'Different Discount for Each Session'. To create this discount, you need to have more sessions than the set minimum number of session criteria. (For example, according to the above image, you need to have more than one session to apply the 'Different Discount for Each Session Discount Method). 




After selecting the total number of sessions in the program (camp/event), you will be directed to the Multi-Session Discount Custom Setup page. 


The Regular Session Discount is a discount offered for each full session. 


The Short Session Discount is offered for sessions marked as short sessions. Generally, short sessions are half-day programs or programs with a shorter duration. You can mark a session as a short session on the 'Session Setup' page.



Select the 'Save' button to save the multi-session discount. 


You can mark a session short session only if you had configured the multi-session discount with the Different Discount For Different Session option. If not 'Is Short Session?' option will not be visible for you on the 'Session Setup' page.




Sibling Discount:


Sibling Discount is the type of discount offered to a child if their sibling had already enrolled in the same camp/event.


This discount is only offered from the second child of the family, the child who registered first will not get this sibling discount. 




 Full Payment Discount:


This discount is offered to those parents who pay the full total billing at the registration. 


Add- On Sessions and Policies:

 

You can create multiple add-on sessions to the camp once the camp has been successfully created.



Select the 'Save' button to save the camp/event.


Camp Settings :


After setting the Camp/Event, you can configure the child settings and payment account collection/store consent using the 'Camp Settings' option.

This discount is only offered from the second child of the family, the child who registered first will not get this sibling discount.               Full Payment Discount:     This discount is offered to those parents who pay the full total billing at the registration.      Add- On Sessions and Policies:      You can create multiple add-on sessions to the camp once the camp has been successfully created.        Select the 'Save' button to save the camp/event.     Camp Settings :     After setting the Camp/Event, you can configure the child settings and payment account collection/store consent using the 'Camp Settings' option.

articles.title: How to Add a New Session
articles.description:
A Camp/Event can have multiple sessions. Once you have created a camp/event, you can add sessions to that camp using the 'Add New Session' option present on the Camp/Event Setup page. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Camp > Setup >  Camp/Event > Add New Session icon




Selecting the 'Add New Session' icon will take you to the 'Session Setup' page. The first section of the Session Setup page is Session Name and Description.


After the session name section, the next sections are Vendor selection and Session Details.



After the session details, the next section is Fee Setup.



You may have configured Early Bird Discount, Multi-Session Discount, and Sibling Discount at the camp level. 1Core offers you an option to configure session wise discounts also. You can configure discounts for each session.



You can add multiple add-on sessions for each session. To create an add-on session, select the 'New Add-On Session' button on the Add-On Session section. 




After filling in all the details, select the 'Save' button to save the session.

The first section of the Session Setup page is Session Name and Description.       After the session name section, the next sections are Vendor selection and Session Details. articles.title: Camp Enroll - Parent Registration
articles.description:
You can use the URL that has been shared with you by the center directors for the registration of the camp/event.



Select the URL link to enter the registration process for the camp/event.



After selecting a camp/event, you will be taken to the Camp/Event list page. 



Select the 'Next' button on the Session list page to go to the Registration page. If you are a new parent, you can register your details along with your children's details here. 


If you are an enrolled family, you can directly log in to the registration using your account credentials.


For New Registrations,



For Enrolled Families,



For Enrolled Families,




Enter the Primary Contact details: 

 

Enter the child's details:




After selecting the sessions, you will be taken to the confirmation page, where you can view the entered details one last time before moving to the payment level.



After the confirmation page, you will be taken to the payment page, where you have to choose your mode of payment and enter the payment details.



After entering the payment details, you will be taken to a page where you can configure the amount that you want to pay at the registration stage. 


You can pay either choose Current Due or Total Due at the registration stage.  



After the successful payment, you will be asked to verify your account. You will receive a verification code from the 1Core to your email inbox. You have to enter the verification code to confirm your account. 



After the successful confirmation, you will be taken to the password creation page from where you can set your password for your account.

articles.title: Managing the Camp/Event Requests
articles.description:
There are two types of registration process present. 


1. Director Authorized


2. Self Registration


While setting up the Camp/Event, you can configure that as either Director Authorized or Self Registration. 




Self Registration: 


Parents can directly enroll in the Camp/Event without the center director's approval. The payment will be deducted at the end of the parent's registration and seat allotment will be carried out automatically, all without the intervention of the center/camp director.


Director Authorized:


Parents can fill out the registration form online and that registration will be sent to the center/camp director's approval. Payment and seat allotment will happen only after the center director processes the registration request.


To process a registration request, visit the 'Process Camp Registration' page.

 

Access Path: Center Dashboard > Camp


Select the Camp/Event from the 'Select Camp/Event' drop-down list and submit it. 


There will be three tabs 


1. Pending: The registration requests from the parents will be listed here for approval from the center director.

2. Incomplete: Incomplete Camp/Event registration will be listed here, you can edit the application here or you can send an email to the parents to complete the registration using the 'Email Parents to Complete Registration' button.

3. Approved: Successfully processed applications will be listed here.

articles.title: Camp/Event Registration URL
articles.description:
1Core Camp/Event Registrations are completely online. Parents and center directors can enroll children in camps/events using the online registration form . 


You can find the Camp/Event Registration URL on the 'Registration URL' page.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Camp > Setup > Registration URL
articles.description_text: 1Core Camp/Event Registrations are completely online. Parents and center directors can enroll children in camps/events using the online registration form .      You can find the Camp/Event Registration URL on the 'Registration URL' page.     Access Path: Center Dashboard > Camp > Setup > Registration URL

articles.title: Copy Camp Setup
articles.description:
Copying an existing camp setup and renaming it to create a new camp is an easy and efficient process using 1CoreSolution. This feature simplifies the process of creating camps across your center, as well as duplicating camp setups within the same center or across multiple centers within your company. 



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Camp > Add Camp 





By copying an existing camp setup, you can save time and effort when creating new camps, as well as easily replicate camp configurations across your organization.

Follow these steps to copy a camp setup:

  1. Click the "Add Camp" button.
  2. On the "Add Camp" pop-up, select the "Copy from existing camp" option and click "Next."
  3. Choose a camp from the list of existing camps at this center and click "Next".

Note: Click the filter icon on the right side to choose the centers under the company.


4. On the camp setup wizard, you will encounter steps like 'Camp', 'Discount', 'Add-on Sessions', 'Session', and 'Merchandise'.


5. Enter the relevant information and save the camp.



If you need further assistance, please feel free to contact our support team. Check out our Copy Existing Camp help video for a visual guide on setting up your camp.

Choose a camp from the list of existing camps at this center and click "Next".   Note: Click the filter icon on the right side to choose the centers under the company.       4. On the camp setup wizard, you will encounter steps like 'Camp', 'Discount', 'Add-on Sessions', 'Session', and 'Merchandise'.     5. Enter the relevant information and save the camp.        If you need further assistance, please feel free to contact our support team. Check out our Copy Existing Camp help video for a visual guide on setting up your camp.

articles.title: Merchandise
articles.description:
To add merchandise to your childcare center's camp or events, create a merchandise setup during the camp creation process. 



Access Path : Center Dashboard > Camp > Add Camp


On the Add Camp wizard menu, the final option is the 'Merchandise' option. With this option, you can specify the price of your merchandise, provide a billing description, and set criteria for purchasing the merch. 




Sales Tax: If the merchandise is subject to state and local sales tax, you can specify the amount or percentage of the sales tax in the "Is Sales Tax Applicable?" option.


Purchasing Merchandise Criteria: If you want to require the purchase of merchandise, you can make it mandatory using the "Are Parents Required to Purchase Merchandise?" option.


If you want participants to purchase the merchandise once for the entire camp or for each session in the camp, you can choose "The Camp" or "Individual Sessions" for the "Merchandise Applicable For" option to optimize your settings.


For the "Merchandise Applicable For" option:


  • Select "The Camp" if participants are only required to purchase the merchandise once for the entire camp.
  • Select "Individual Sessions" if participants are required to purchase the merchandise for each session they enroll/register in at the camp.



If you need further assistance, please feel free to contact our support team. Check out our merchandise help video for a visual guide on setting up your merchandise.

articles.title: Copy Camp Session
articles.description:
1CoreSolution allows users to easily replicate session setups from one camp to another within the same center, or even from other centers within the same company, using the 'Copy from existing sessions' option.


1. Click the 'Action' icon parallel to the camp that you want to add. copy the 'Sessions' to it and select the 'Add New Session' option. 





Copying an existing session setup can help you save time and effort by avoiding the need to create new sessions from scratch. Additionally, this feature enables you to replicate session configurations across your entire organization or company.


2. . Once click 'Next' after selecting the 'Copy from existing Sessions' on the Add new session pop-up and then you will be taken to the camp list page. 


3. Select the camp from the list to copy its session(s) setup and click the 'Next' button.


4.  On the session setup, select the session(s) and enter the 'Start / End date' of the session you want to copy. If you have an early bird discount enabled, you need to enter the end date for the discount. 


Note: The session name should be unique If there is already a session with the same name in the destination camp, change the name of the copied session.

 


5. Click the 'Save' button on the confirm page to save the copied session setup. 



If you need further assistance, please feel free to contact our support team. Check out our Copy from other Sessions help video for a visual guide on setting up your session.

articles.title: How to Remove a Camp Session for an Enrolled Child
articles.description:
The center director can remove session(s) of an enrolled child(ren) using their center director portal. 


Access Path : Center Director Portal > Camp > Registration Management


Select the 'Registered by Family' option from the Registration Management section. 



Selecting the 'Registered by Family' option will take you to the 'Family Registration Management' page. 




Select the 'Yes' option from the confirmation pop-up to cancel the selected camp session for the child.


After the cancellation of the session, you will be asked with an option, whether you want to cancel the fees and discounts associated with the canceled session. 


Select the ledger items from the list and then select the 'Void' button to cancel the fees and discounts associated with the canceled session.
articles.description_text: The center director can remove session(s) of an enrolled child(ren) using their center director portal.      Access Path : Center Director Portal > Camp > Registration Management     Select the 'Registered by Family' option from the Registration Management section.           Selecting the 'Registered by Family' option will take you to the 'Family Registration Management' page.                Select the 'Yes' option from the confirmation pop-up to cancel the selected camp session for the child.       After the cancellation of the session, you will be asked with an option, whether you want to cancel the fees and discounts associated with the canceled session.      Select the ledger items from the list and then select the 'Void' button to cancel the fees and discounts associated with the canceled session.

articles.title: Send Batch Email to Camp Families
articles.description:
1Core allows its Center Admin Users to Send Batch Emails for its Camp families whenever required.


Note: Batch Email to Camp Families will be displayed only for those Centers who Camp option.


Access Path: Center Dashboard--->Communication--->Batch Email To Camp Families.


* Select the Camp / Event Type

* Select the Sessions

* Select the Families 

* Compose the Message / Upload any Attachments if required.







The Batch Email History can be viewed under Communications--->Batch Email History.

articles.title: How to Enroll a Child to a Camp Session using the Center Director Portal
articles.description:
The center directors can directly enroll a child (From a new or existing family) in a camp session using their center director portal.


Access Path : Center Director Portal > Camp >Enroll a child to camp



Select the family type, you can enroll a child from a new family or select a child from an existing family.



Adding a new family to the camp enrollment :


Selecting the 'New Family' from the 'Select Family Type' option will take you to the Primary Contact registration page. 



After entering the primary contact, you will be taken to the child details page. Enter your child(ern) details here. 



Select the Session(s) for the entered child(ren).




After selecting the session(s), you will be taken to the Confirmation page, you can verify the entered details one last time from here before submitting it. 




After submitting the camp enrollment registration, the enrolled child(ren) will be taken to the approved tab of the 'Process Camp Registration' page directly. 




Adding an existing family to camp enrollment :


Select the 'Existing Family' option on the Select Family page.




On the Child Details page, you need to select the gender of the child and the grade which the child entering in the next school year.


Select the session(s) for the child(ren)



Confirmation page, 




Note : 

1. Submitting a child (from new/existing famlily) enrollment in to a camp session using the center director portal will not result an immediate payment/fee deduction. The payments/fees will be paid by the parent using their parent portal. 

2. If the session has any fee or discount, it will be posted as billing in the ledger after being submitted by the center director.

3.The posting date of these session will be based on the 'Payment Due Date'.
