articles.title: CLASSROOM ACTIVITIES - 1CORE WEB PORTAL
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. Classroom Activities - Introduction
  • 2. Creating Activities Setup 
    • 2.1. Ability to Add a Subject to a Lesson Plan 
    • 2.2. Ability to Add a Category to a Lesson Plan 
    • 2.3. Ability to Create an Activity for a Lesson Plan
    • 2.4. Ability to Create an Activity using an Offline Template 
  • 3. Classroom Activities 
    • 3.1. Adding a Lesson Plan to a classroom
    • 3.2. Approving the Lesson Plan submitted by staffs
    • 3.3. Ability Download and Share the Created Lesson Plan 
    • 3.4. Ability to view the Classroom activity feeds of  1Core Class App in 1Core Web
    • 3.5. Ability to generate reports for the classroom activities



1. Classroom Activities - Introduction


1Core has now integrated the 'Classroom Activities' into 1Core Web to provide a high level of interoperability between 1Core Web and 1Core Class App. 


2. Creating Activities Setup 

 

For creating a successful lesson plan in the classroom activities module, you need to create 'Subjects', 'Categories', and 'Activities' on the 1Core Web. 


2.1. Ability to Add a Subject to a Lesson Plan 


To add one or more subjects, use the 'Subject Setup' option available under the 'Activity Category' under setup.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Activity > Subject Setup



Click on 'Add Subject' to add a new subject. 



Selecting the 'Add Subject' button will open the 'Add Subject' dialog box. Select the Age Group and provide a Subject Name, Subject Short Code, and Description. 



Note : You cannot add the same subject twice in an age category. 



Editing a saved subject 



Note : You can now enter/input in any international language at all text boxes and editors in all setups. 1Core has brought multi-language input support. The default field names will be in English only, but you can feed the information in any language of your choice.


Example:  

In the below image, the inputs are in Spanish,


2.2. Ability to Add a Category to a Lesson Plan 


You can create a category for a lesson plan by selecting the 'Activity Category Setup' option from the 'Activity category' under Setup.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Activity > Activity Category Setup 

Selecting the 'Activity Category Setup' will take you to the 'Activity Category' page. Click 'Add Activity Category' button to add a category. 



Enter the Category Name and Description on the respective text boxes and Select the 'Save' button to save the entered category. 



Editing a saved Category. 




2.3. Ability to Create an Activity for a Lesson Plan

 After creating a subject and category, you need an activity to integrate subject and category in a lesson plan. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Activity > Activity Setup


Click 'Add Activity' button to add an activity. 



Materials can be added for reference and you can also add Website link, you tube video link, and files with pdf and csv extensions to the activities.




Note : Instructions will be visible to everyone (Parents, Teachers and Directors). 
           Private Notes will be visible only to Teachers and Directors.


Creating a tag: 


Tags are created to ease the search process when you have a large number of activity created.

 

You can create a tag in two ways 


1. By accessing the 'Activity Tags' from the Setup module




2. By selecting the 'Add Tag' button from the Activity List page.




2.4. Ability to Create an Activity using an Offline Template 


To make the activity creation more user-friendly, 1Core has come up with an alternate option to online 'Activity Setup'. Now you can download an offline spreadsheet template from the 'Import Activity' page and use that spreadsheet to create 'Activities' offline.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Activity Import


Select the Download Activity Template button to download a template spreadsheet, using this template you can fill the activity details offline and upload them to the import activity page to create activities. In this way, you can create multiple activities in a single go.




 

3. Classroom Activities 

 

3.1. Adding a Lesson Plan to a classroom


Now you can add a lesson plan(s) to a classroom for a week using either the 'Add Lesson Plan' option on the 'Classroom Activities' page or the 'Lesson Plan' option under the 'Function' module. 


Add Lesson Plan via Classroom Activities



Selecting the 'Add Lesson Plan' will open the 'Add Lesson Plan' pop-up. Here select the desired week for the lesson plan by selecting the 'Green Arrows' adjacent to the 'Select Week' option. 


Select the classroom using the drop-down on the upper left side and enter the name of the weekly lesson plan on the editor at the bottom. 


Selecting the 'Continue' button will take you to the 'Lesson Plan' module page. 




Select the next button to publish the lesson plan or save this plan as a draft. 




Add Lesson Plan via Functions Module


You can add a weekly/daily lesson plan for a classroom using the 'Add Lesson Plan' option on the Lesson Plan page. 




3.2. Approving the Lesson Plan submitted by staffs


As an admin, you can directly create and publish a lesson plan(s) for a classroom and you can also be an approver for your staff who will create lesson plans and submit them for your approval. 


On the Classroom Activity Dashboard :


Completed: The total count of created and approved lesson plans for all classrooms.

To Review: The total count of the lesson plan waiting for your approval for all classrooms.

Yet to Plan:  Number of weeks without the lesson plan for all classrooms. 



Note : Select the counts to view the details of the respective lesson plan status.


Completed :



To Review:


Selecting the lesson plan that is waiting for approval will take you to the 'Lesson Plan Approval' page from there you can give your approval for the sent lesson plan. 





Note : You can allowed to change the title of the sent for approval lesson plan at the approval stage.

 

Yet to Plan:




3.3. Ability Download and Share the Created Lesson Plan 


1Core allows you to download the created lesson plan and also allows you to share the created lesson plan with the parent. 


Downloading the Created Lesson Plan 





Use the "Download" button to download the lesson plan and "Share" button to share those with the parents.



Downloaded Lesson Plan :



Sharing the Lesson Plan:




Email :

3.4. Ability to view the Classroom activity feeds of 1Core Class App in 1Core Web


1Core has now added the 1Core Class App Activity feeds into the 1Core Web on the Classroom Activities page. So you can view the activities, diaper change, notes, food, incident, nap, and homework feeds on the Classroom Activities page. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Classroom Activities


Activities Created on the 1Core Class App :


Activity Created on the 1Core Class App Reflected on the 1Core Web



You can use the "filter" icon to view any specific activity for any specific classroom at a time.





Grouped By : 


The grouped 'By Timeline' will be the default option. The homepage of 'Classroom Activities' will be displayed based on the Timeline by default. 



Grouped By Child:


Grouped by Activity:





3.5. Ability to generate reports for the classroom activities


1Core provides a couple of comprehensive reports on the classroom activities to give a better picture of your center's classroom activities. 

Daily Activities - Report:


Using this report, you can view the classroom activities of each child on daily basis. 


Select the 'View' link to the activities of a child on the selected date and classroom.

 


Activity Library - Report:


Using the Activity Library, you can generate and view a report for a specified period of time with elaborate filters.

Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Activity > Activity Category Setup   Selecting the 'Activity Category Setup' will take you to the 'Activity Category' page. Click 'Add Activity Category' button to add a category.           Enter the Category Name and Description on the respective text boxes and Select the 'Save' button to save the entered category.           Editing a saved Category.              2.3. Ability to Create an Activity for a Lesson Plan   After creating a subject and category, you need an activity to integrate subject and category in a lesson plan.      Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Activity > Activity Setup     Click 'Add Activity' button to add an activity.           Materials can be added for reference and you can also add Website link, you tube video link, and files with pdf and csv extensions to the activities.             Note : Instructions will be visible to everyone (Parents, Teachers and Directors).             Private Notes will be visible only to Teachers and Directors.     Creating a tag:      Tags are created to ease the search process when you have a large number of activity created.     You can create a tag in two ways      1. By accessing the 'Activity Tags' from the Setup module             2. By selecting the 'Add Tag' button from the Activity List page.             2.4. Ability to Create an Activity using an Offline Template      To make the activity creation more user-friendly, 1Core has come up with an alternate option to online 'Activity Setup'. Now you can download an offline spreadsheet template from the 'Import Activity' page and use that spreadsheet to create 'Activities' offline.     Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > Activity Import      Select the Download Activity Template button to download a template spreadsheet, using this template you can fill the activity details offline and upload them to the import activity page to create activities. In this way, you can create multiple activities in a single go.                3. Classroom Activities      3.1. Adding a Lesson Plan to a classroom     Now you can add a lesson plan(s) to a classroom for a week using either the 'Add Lesson Plan' option on the 'Classroom Activities' page or the 'Lesson Plan' option under the 'Function' module.      Add Lesson Plan via Classroom Activities          Selecting the 'Add Lesson Plan' will open the 'Add Lesson Plan' pop-up. Here select the desired week for the lesson plan by selecting the 'Green Arrows' adjacent to the 'Select Week' option.      Select the classroom using the drop-down on the upper left side and enter the name of the weekly lesson plan on the editor at the bottom.        Selecting the 'Continue' button will take you to the 'Lesson Plan' module page.                Select the next button to publish the lesson plan or save this plan as a draft.              Add Lesson Plan via Functions Module     You can add a weekly/daily lesson plan for a classroom using the 'Add Lesson Plan' option on the Lesson Plan page.                  3.2. Approving the Lesson Plan submitted by staffs     As an admin, you can directly create and publish a lesson plan(s) for a classroom and you can also be an approver for your staff who will create lesson plans and submit them for your approval.      On the Classroom Activity Dashboard :     Completed: The total count of created and approved lesson plans for all classrooms.  To Review: The total count of the lesson plan waiting for your approval for all classrooms.  Yet to Plan:  Number of weeks without the lesson plan for all classrooms.         Note : Select the counts to view the details of the respective lesson plan status.      Completed :          To Review:     Selecting the lesson plan that is waiting for approval will take you to the 'Lesson Plan Approval' page from there you can give your approval for the sent lesson plan.                 Note : You can allowed to change the title of the sent for approval lesson plan at the approval stage.     Yet to Plan:             3.3. Ability Download and Share the Created Lesson Plan      1Core allows you to download the created lesson plan and also allows you to share the created lesson plan with the parent.      Downloading the Created Lesson Plan                 Use the "Download" button to download the lesson plan and "Share" button to share those with the parents.        Downloaded Lesson Plan :          Sharing the Lesson Plan:           Email :    3.4. Ability to view the Classroom activity feeds of 1Core Class App in 1Core Web     1Core has now added the 1Core Class App Activity feeds into the 1Core Web on the Classroom Activities page. So you can view the activities, diaper change, notes, food, incident, nap, and homework feeds on the Classroom Activities page.      Access Path : Center Dashboard > Classroom Activities     Activities Created on the 1Core Class App :       Activity Created on the 1Core Class App Reflected on the 1Core Web          You can use the "filter" icon to view any specific activity for any specific classroom at a time.                  Grouped By :      The grouped 'By Timeline' will be the default option. The homepage of 'Classroom Activities' will be displayed based on the Timeline by default.           Grouped By Child:       Grouped by Activity:                3.5. Ability to generate reports for the classroom activities     1Core provides a couple of comprehensive reports on the classroom activities to give a better picture of your center's classroom activities.     Daily Activities - Report:     Using this report, you can view the classroom activities of each child on daily basis.        Select the 'View' link to the activities of a child on the selected date and classroom.        Activity Library - Report:     Using the Activity Library, you can generate and view a report for a specified period of time with elaborate filters.

articles.title: LESSON PLAN CREATION - 1CORE STAFF PORTAL
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. Adding a Lesson Plan to a classroom
  • 2. Approving a Lesson Plan for Classroom Staff


1. Adding a Lesson Plan to a classroom

1Core has provided the option to create lesson plans for classroom staff through their Staff Portal Account. You can either create the lesson plan and have them published or submit the same for approval based on your approval status. 


Note : Lesson Plan Approval status is decided on the Staff record by the Center director / Admin staff. 

 

Select the Classroom tab on the left hand menu to start adding your Lesson Plan.


Click Add Lesson Plan and select the desired week for which you need to add the Lesson plan


Select the  desired classroom and provide a Name for the Lesson Plan and select the desired week for the lesson plan by selecting the 'Green Arrows' adjacent to the 'Select Week' option.

Selecting the 'Continue' button will take you to the 'Lesson Plan' module page.



Copying Lesson Plan from other classes:



This feature can be used to copy the lesson plan that has been created for the previous weeks session.




Selecting the 'Add Lesson' button will open the 'Lesson Plan' pop-up from where you can enter the lesson plan Name, notes and select/ create an activity. 




Based on your approval status, you can either create a lesson plan and submit for approval or you can directly publish it. 

1Core also avails the option to save the created lesson plan as a draft for future use irrespective of your approval status.

 



2. Approving a Lesson Plan for Classroom Staff


As a lesson approver, you need to verify and provide approval for the lesson plan submitted by your staff.



To approve the submitted lesson plan click on "To Review" to view and approve the same.


Select the Lesson period (date) to view the contents of the lesson plan.



Selecting the Lesson period will open the Lesson Plan details page.

 



Select the 'Approve' button to give your assent to the submitted lesson plan.

articles.title: IMPORTING LESSON PLAN - 1CORE CLASS APP
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. Importing Lesson Plan while creating an activity for children
  • 2. Viewing the Lesson Plan on the 1Core Class App
  • 3. Activities Summary

1. Importing Lesson Plan while creating an activity for children


To import a lesson plan while creating an activity, you need a lesson plan created on the 1Core web for that day. 


Select the Activities icon at the bottom footer of the 1Core Class App to go to the activities screen and select the children for the activity from the 'Currently Signed in' children list.


Selecting the 'Import Lesson Plan' icon will open the Lesson Plan list screen containing the created lesson plan for the day. You can select the lesson(s) on the list to import those for the selected children. 


App Screen after importing the lesson plan for the selected children. Select the 'Submit' button to create an activity with the imported lesson plan.



You can view the imported lesson plan on the children's timeline. 


2. Viewing the Lesson Plan on the 1Core Class App


You can view the Lesson Plan of classrooms in the 1Core Class App using the Lesson Plan module on the main menu.



3. Activities Summary


Earlier there was no option for viewing the activities feed on the 1Core Class App. 1Core has now introduced an Activities Feed summary feature on the 1Core Class App.  





You can filter the 'Activities summary Results' using the filter icon available in the upper right corner of the 'Activities Summary' page.

articles.title: Lesson Plan Feature on 1Core Web Interface
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS


1. Adding a Lesson Plan to a classroom

2. Approving the Lesson Plan submitted by staffs

3. Ability to Download and Share the Created Lesson Plan 


1. Adding a Lesson Plan to a classroom


Now you can add a lesson plan(s) to a classroom for any week either through the 'Add Lesson Plan' option on the 'Classroom Activities' tab or the 'Lesson Plan' option under the 'Functions' tab. 


Adding Lesson Plan from Classroom Activities



Selecting the 'Add Lesson Plan' will open the 'Add Lesson Plan' pop-up. Here select the desired week for the lesson plan by selecting the 'Green Arrows' adjacent to the 'Select Week' option. 


Select the classroom using the drop-down on the upper left side and enter the name of the weekly lesson plan on the editor at the bottom. 



Selecting the 'Continue' button will take you to the 'Lesson Plan' module page. 




Select the next button to publish the lesson plan or save this plan as a draft. 




Adding Lesson Plan from Functions tab


You can add a weekly/daily lesson plan for a classroom using the 'Add Lesson Plan' option on the Lesson Plan page. 





2. Approving the Lesson Plan submitted by staffs


As an admin, you can directly create and publish a lesson plan(s) for a classroom and you can also be an approver for your staff who will create lesson plans and submit them for your approval. 


On the Classroom Activity Dashboard :


Completed: The total count of created and approved lesson plans for all classrooms.

To Review: The total count of the lesson plan waiting for your approval for all classrooms.

Yet to Plan:  Number of weeks without the lesson plan for all classrooms. 



Note : Select the counts to view the details of the respective lesson plan status.


Completed :



To Review:


Selecting the lesson plan that is waiting for approval will take you to the 'Lesson Plan Approval' page from where you can give your approval for the submitted lesson plan. 





Note : You can change the title of the sent for approval lesson plan at the approval stage.

 

Yet to Plan:




3. Ability to Download and Share the Created Lesson Plan 


1Core allows you to download and share the created lesson plan with your parents. 


Downloading the Created Lesson Plan 





Use the "Download" button to download the lesson plan and "Share" button to share those with the parents.



Downloaded Lesson Plan :



Sharing the Lesson Plan:




Email :

articles.title: Classroom Activity Now Available in 1Core Web Interface
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS


1. Ability to view the App Classroom activity feed in 1Core Web

2. Ability to view the Classroom details on the Classroom Activities page 

3. Accessing the Lesson and Food Plan through the Classrooms section

4. Accessing Classroom Activities through Children page 

4. Ability to generate reports for the classroom activities


1. Ability to view the App Classroom activity feed in 1Core Web


1Core has now integrated the Classroom Activity feed into 1Core Web under the Classroom Activities tab, to provide ease for the user to view all the information within the web interface.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Classroom Activities


Activities Created on the 1Core Class App :




Activity Created on the 1Core Class App will automatically get updated in the web version.



Click on the activities feed images to view the full-size enhanced view on the image gallery. 




You can play the videos on the feed by clicking on them. 





You can use the "filter" icon to view any specific activity for any specific classroom at a time.





Grouped By : 


The grouped 'By Timeline' will be the default option. The homepage of 'Classroom Activities' will be displayed based on the Timeline by default. 



Grouped By Child:


Note : The number superscription on the child profile picture denotes the number of activities shared for the child.



Grouped by Activity:



2. Ability to view the Classroom details on the Classroom Activities page 


Now, you can view the Classroom details on the Classroom Activities page using the 'Classrooms' section.




You can also view the classroom activities of a particular classroom by selecting the activities icons present at the bottom of each classroom in the classroom section. 




3. Accessing the Lesson and Food Plan through the Classrooms section


You can access the Lesson and Food plan for the day by using the 'Lesson and Food Plan' icon in the Classrooms section. 


Lesson Plan



Food Plan



4. Accessing Classroom Activities through Children page 


Now, you can also access the 'Classroom Activities' feed on the Children page.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Children > Class Activities icon


Select the 'Classroom Activities' icon on the 'Action' column to view the 'Classroom Activities' of a particular child. 


 

You can download the Classroom Activities of the selected child in a pdf format using the Download button. 


Downloaded Classroom Activities document :



Sharing the Classroom Activities with the parents 



Select the recipient(s) and click the 'Next'  button.



Select the 'Send' button to send an email attaching the classroom activities to the parent(s).



4. Ability to generate reports for the classroom activities


1Core provides a couple of comprehensive reports on those activities to provide a clear insight of your center's classroom activities. 


Daily Activities - Report:


Using this report, you can view the classroom activities of each child on daily basis. 


Select the 'View' link to the activities of a child on the selected date and classroom.

 


Select the 'Download' button to download the daily activities report in a pdf document form. 



Downloaded Daily Activities report of a child


Sharing the Daily Activities report to the parent(s)



Select the Recipient(s) and click the 'Next' button


Select the 'Send' button to share the Daily Activities Report with the parent(s)




Activity Library - Report:


Using the Activity Library, you can generate and view weekly activities of the classroom(s).

articles.title: CRM (Customer Relationship Management)
articles.description:
The Customer Relationship Management (CRM) feature is a technology that allows you to manage your relationship with existing customers and potential customers (leads).


1Core - CRM :


1Core introduces a new CRM feature for its customers into the existing platform. Now, centers don't need external CRMs to handle their lead inquiry, tour setup, lead follow up, and customer relations.


CRM on Company Dashboard 


CRM on Center Dashboard
articles.description_text: The Customer Relationship Management (CRM) feature is a technology that allows you to manage your relationship with existing customers and potential customers (leads).     1Core - CRM :     1Core introduces a new CRM feature for its customers into the existing platform. Now, centers don't need external CRMs to handle their lead inquiry, tour setup, lead follow up, and customer relations.     CRM on Company Dashboard         CRM on Center Dashboard

articles.title: CRM Setup - Company Dashboard
articles.description:
CRM setup at the company level allows you to configure the Tour and waitlist setup. you can also get your unique Tour, Inquiry, and Waitlist URL from the CRM setup page.




1.Inquiry Setup


Using this tab, you can configure the fields for parent and child info sections of the 'Inquiry' form.


1.1. Communication Preference : 

It is the mode of communication preferred by the parent to communicate with them or reach them. By default, you will have 'Phone Only', 'Email Only', and 'Either Phone or Email' options. But you can add other means by selecting the 'Add New' from the 'View List' pop-up.



1.2.How did you hear from us?

This option helps you to find your referral source or the way the parent found you. You can add your source of referral by selecting the 'Add New' button on the View list pop-up.



1.3. Collecting the fields of the Child Info Section :


Here, in this section, you will be able to set the options for the parent for their desired program schedule and the estimated date from which they want the care for their child(ren).


After configuring your desired parent and child info section options, select the 'Copy' button of the Inquiry Form URL. You can use this Copied URL to send to the parents to get their detailed inquiry. 


Waitlist Setup


This tab allows you to configure the fee for the waitlist in your company. You can set the 'Waitlist Fee' for your company using this tab. 


Select the 'Copy URL' button to copy the Parent Waitlist Form URL. You can send this URL to parent(s) to help them to join the 'Waitlist' of your company. 



Tour Setup 


This tab will help you to set up your company's 'Tour' setup which includes the 'Creating Tour Slots', 'Uploading Tour Policy' for the company, and 'Tour Request timeline'.

articles.title: Add New Inquiry at Company Level
articles.description:
You can add a new inquiry manually on behalf of a parent using the company dashboard.



For companies with multiple centers, you can choose the desired center while adding a new inquiry.


After selecting the center, you need to enter the details of the parent and child in the inquiry form.

 

On the process page, you can define the desired action for this inquiry form. 



'Add a New Inquiry Only' :


You can use this option to make a new inquiry without any additional actions such as 'Tour' and 'Waitlist'. The inquiry added using the option on the later stage can be converted into a 'Tour Request' or 'Waitlist' request. 

 


Add Inquiry and Schedule/invite to tour:


This option allows you to add an inquiry and subsequently schedule a tour for the parent(s). Here, you have two options, 


1. You can schedule a tour for the parents directly

2. Send an invite to the parents


Scheduling the 'Tour' directly on behalf of the parents :


Using this option, you can directly select a slot for the parent(s) to tour. 




Invite the Parents by email to schedule a tour on their own :


Using this option, you're sending an email invite to the parents via that they can choose their comfortable time slot for the tour from the available tour slots. 




Add Inquiry and invite to join Waitlist:


By selecting this option, you can do two things, 


1. You can directly add the parent to the waitlist by yourself

or 

2. You can send an invite to the parent to join the waitlist



Add This Family to the Waitlist directly


You can add a family directly to the 'Waitlist' on behalf of the parents. 


if your company collects any waitlist fee then you can do any one of the following two things, 

1. You can waive the waitlist fee

or

2. You can send an email to the parent(s) to collect the waitlist fee. 


If you wish to send just an invite to the parents to join the waitlist, select the 'Invite the parents by email to join the waitlist' option from the 'Process' page and send the invite to the parent(s).
articles.description_text: You can add a new inquiry manually on behalf of a parent using the company dashboard.          For companies with multiple centers, you can choose the desired center while adding a new inquiry.       After selecting the center, you need to enter the details of the parent and child in the inquiry form.     On the process page, you can define the desired action for this inquiry form.           'Add a New Inquiry Only' :     You can use this option to make a new inquiry without any additional actions such as 'Tour' and 'Waitlist'. The inquiry added using the option on the later stage can be converted into a 'Tour Request' or 'Waitlist' request.           Add Inquiry and Schedule/invite to tour:     This option allows you to add an inquiry and subsequently schedule a tour for the parent(s). Here, you have two options,      1. You can schedule a tour for the parents directly  2. Send an invite to the parents       Scheduling the 'Tour' directly on behalf of the parents :     Using this option, you can directly select a slot for the parent(s) to tour.                Invite the Parents by email to schedule a tour on their own :     Using this option, you're sending an email invite to the parents via that they can choose their comfortable time slot for the tour from the available tour slots.            Add Inquiry and invite to join Waitlist:     By selecting this option, you can do two things,      1. You can directly add the parent to the waitlist by yourself  or   2. You can send an invite to the parent to join the waitlist          Add This Family to the Waitlist directly     You can add a family directly to the 'Waitlist' on behalf of the parents.        if your company collects any waitlist fee then you can do any one of the following two things,   1. You can waive the waitlist fee  or  2. You can send an email to the parent(s) to collect the waitlist fee.        If you wish to send just an invite to the parents to join the waitlist, select the 'Invite the parents by email to join the waitlist' option from the 'Process' page and send the invite to the parent(s).

articles.title: Import Inquiry
articles.description:
You can import your manual parent inquiries to the 1Core CRM using the 'Import Inquiry' option. This will allow you to maintain your manual leads/inquiries in the automated CRM environment. 



For multiple location companies, you need to choose your choice of center on the import inquiry page before entering into the 'Upload File' page. 



After choosing the 'Inquiry file', the uploaded inquiry details will be automatically displayed on the 'Verification' page. You can verify the uploaded details here. 




If the uploaded inquiry file has any discrepancy, it will be shown on the final confirmation page. You can rectify the error and reupload the data again.

You can verify the uploaded details here.              If the uploaded inquiry file has any discrepancy, it will be shown on the final confirmation page. You can rectify the error and reupload the data again.

articles.title: CRM - Reports
articles.description:
CRM module has three reports at the company level to provide comprehensive and important insights on the referral source, task and performance status, and Tour decline reasons. These reports will help you to improve the customer relations and communications of your company. 



Task Status and Performance Report


This report helps you to know about the 'Task details', 'Task leads','Status of the assigned tasks', and break up of Assignee's performance. 



'How did you hear about us' - Report


This report is all about the referral source of your inquiries that are collected from the 'inquiry', 'schedule', and 'waitlist' forms from the parents. It is very helpful for you to increase and improve your company's marketing and advertisements. 



Decline Reason Reports


This report provides the details about the decline reason stated by the parents when they decline the 'Tour Schedules'. Further this report gives the details of 'Age Group percentage children','reference source of the parents' and details of the parents who declined the tours.

It is very helpful for you to increase and improve your company's marketing and advertisements.           Decline Reason Reports     This report provides the details about the decline reason stated by the parents when they decline the 'Tour Schedules'. Further this report gives the details of 'Age Group percentage children','reference source of the parents' and details of the parents who declined the tours.

articles.title: Decline Repository
articles.description:
This is a repository of all the perspective families that have declined themselves or declined by the center. To re-engage them, please select the 'Process' icon under the 'Action'.





Selecting the Process icon will open the 'ViewDeclined Family' page, on that page you need to select the 'Next Stage' button to choose the re-engage options for the declined family.

To re-engage them, please select the 'Process' icon under the 'Action'.                    Selecting the Process icon will open the 'ViewDeclined Family' page, on that page you need to select the 'Next Stage' button to choose the re-engage options for the declined family.

articles.title: CRM Setup
articles.description:
To configure the CRM Setup for each center, you need to use the CRM setup available under the 'Setup' page on the center dashboard. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > Setup > CRM Setup


Inquiry Setup


On the Inquiry Setup tab, you can see the Inquiry Setups that are configured at the company level. You cannot edit these setups here. The inquiry setup configured at the company level is common for all centers. 



Tour Setup


Tour setup helps you configure the tour invite for parents. You can add a director review status for the tour invite, optimize the tour date (e.g., how far in advance to allow parents to schedule a tour), and set the center's tour policy.


You can optimize the 'Tour Slot' for the center using the 'Tour Setup' tab.



You can add new slots for the tour using the 'Add Slot' option. You can edit already scheduled slots using the 'Edit' button next to the day, and you can delete existing schedules by selecting the 'Delete Schedule' button.




Note : You need to configure the tour invite options before you coping the 'Tour invite' link


Waitlist Setup


You can customize the waitlist settings for your center using the 'Waitlist Setup' tab.

You cannot edit these setups here. The inquiry setup configured at the company level is common for all centers.         Tour Setup     Tour setup helps you configure the tour invite for parents. You can add a director review status for the tour invite, optimize the tour date (e.g., how far in advance to allow parents to schedule a tour), and set the center's tour policy.     You can optimize the 'Tour Slot' for the center using the 'Tour Setup' tab.          You can add new slots for the tour using the 'Add Slot' option. You can edit already scheduled slots using the 'Edit' button next to the day, and you can delete existing schedules by selecting the 'Delete Schedule' button.           Note : You need to configure the tour invite options before you coping the 'Tour invite' link     Waitlist Setup     You can customize the waitlist settings for your center using the 'Waitlist Setup' tab.

articles.title: CRM - Import Inquiry
articles.description:
If you have a list of inquiries/leads and you want to upload that to your CRM, you can do that by using 'CRM Import Inquiry'. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > CRM > Menu > Import Inquiry




Note: Use the 'Download Sample Csv file' option to download a pre-filled example of the 'Inquiry Template'. You can use this csv file as reference to fill your inquiry template.


Use the downloaded template to fill in the inquiry/lead details and use the 'Browse' button to upload it to the system. You can use the 'View Inquiry' option to view the details of individual uploaded inquiries. 



Successfully Imported Inquiries displayed in the CRM Dashboard

You can use this csv file as reference to fill your inquiry template.     Use the downloaded template to fill in the inquiry/lead details and use the 'Browse' button to upload it to the system. You can use the 'View Inquiry' option to view the details of individual uploaded inquiries.           Successfully Imported Inquiries displayed in the CRM Dashboard

articles.title: CRM Task
articles.description:
After getting the inquiry into the CRM, the next step is to reach the parents for follow-ups. To do the follow-up, you can use 'CRM Task' to assign follow-up tasks to Company Admin/Admin/Super Users

. 

Access Path : Center Dashboard > CRM > Menu > Tasks


.



Select the lead/inquiry from the available lead/inquiry list. You can filter the list using the 'Process Type' drop-down.


 Enter the details asked in the 'Add a Task' pop-up.





Respond - Task:


After the assigned task is completed by the assignee, you can update the task with the 'Mark as Completed' tag by using the 'Action' button. You can also edit/delete the assigned task using the action button. 



While marking a task as 'Completed', you will be asked with a pop-up message if you need any further follow-up on this task.


 If you select 'yes' for the pop-up message, you can add another follow-up to this task. If you select 'No' then this task will be moved to the 'Completed' tab.

articles.title: Add New Inquiry
articles.description:
Apart from the parent(s) filling out the inquiry form sent to them, you can also add inquiries to the CRM yourself using the center dashboard.


Access Path : Center Dashboad > CRM > Add New Inquiry



On the Add New Inquiry page, you can able to provide the parent and child info along with program info and contact preferences.

 


After entering the requested details, you need to select the desired outcome (Inquiry/Schedule Tour invite/waitlist invite) of the new inquiry.


 

'Add a New Inquiry Only' :


This option allows you to make a new inquiry without initiating a Tour or Waitlist request. However, an inquiry created using this option can be converted into a Tour or Waitlist request at a later stage.



Add Inquiry and Schedule/invite to tour:


This option allows you to add an inquiry and schedule a tour for the parent(s). Here, you have two options, 


1. You can schedule a tour for the parents directly

2. Send an invite to the parents




Scheduling the 'Tour' directly on behalf of the parents :


Using this option, you can directly select a slot for the parent(s) to tour.





Invite the Parents by email to schedule a tour on their own :


This option allows you to send an email invite to the parents, allowing them to choose a convenient time slot for the tour from the available options.


Add Inquiry and invite to join Waitlist:


By selecting this option, you can do any one of the following two actions, 


1. You can directly add the parent to the waitlist by yourself


2. You can send an invite to the parent to join the waitlist



Add This Family to the Waitlist directly


You can add a family directly to the 'Waitlist' on behalf of the parents.



if your center collects any waitlist fee then you can do any one of the following two things, 


1. You can waive the waitlist fee


2. You can send an email to the parent(s) to collect the waitlist fee.


To send an invite to the parents to join the waitlist, select the 'Invite the parents by email to join the waitlist' option on the 'Process' page and send the invite to the parent(s).

articles.title: CRM Dashboard
articles.description:
CRM dashboard is the place where you can view the details of 1Core CRM's Tour/Waitlist/Inquiry requests and their developments. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > CRM 

 


Inquiry: Number of Inquiries 

Tour: Number of Tour Invites sent and responded 

Waitlist: Number of Waitlist invites sent and responded. 

Enrollments: Number of Program Enrollments (Counts reflected from the Program Enrollment dashboard)


Inquiry Tab: 


Under the Inbound tab, you have the New, Responded and Change Request tabs. 



Tour Tab :


Under the Tour tab, you have the Invited, Pending, Scheduled, Toured, and No Show tabs.


 

Waitlist Tab :


Under the Waitlist tab, you have the Invited and Joined tabs.



EnrollmentTab :


Under the Enrollment Tab, you have the Enrollment Offer, Incoming, Enrolled,and Withdrawn Tabs.

articles.title: CRM - Responding to a New Inquiry
articles.description:
Once the inquiry form is completed by the parent or an inquiry is made through the CRM by the director, you will be able to view those inquiries in the 'New' tab under 'Inbound'.


Access Path : Center Dashboard > CRM > Inbound > New




Note: Inquiries that are 24 hours old will be indicated by a bright yellow color before the parent's name. Inquiries that are 48 hours old will be indicated by a red color. Fresh inquiries will not have any indication before the parent's name.


Add - Note and call log details : 


You can add 'Note' and 'Call Log' to the inquiry details using the 'View Inquiry' page.  





Respond - Inquiry


After creating a new inquiry, you can do the following:


1. Schedule/Invite Tour

2. Add/Invite to Join Waitlist

3. Directly Enroll

4. Send Enrollment Offer

5. Move to Decline Repository


 

Once a 'Next Stage' or 'Task/note' is added, the status of the inquiry will change from 'New' to 'Responded', and the inquiry will be moved from the 'New' tab to the 'Responded' tab.

articles.title: CRM - Updating A Scheduled Tour Request
articles.description:
Once after the parent fills the sent 'Tour Request' or Director schedule tour on behalf of the parent, the inquiry comes to the 'Scheduled' tab under the 'Tour' section. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > CRM > Tour > Scheduled



To update the status of the scheduled tour , select the 'View Tour' icon present at the right end of the parent request.

 

Selecting the 'View Tour' icon will open the tour details page from where you can update the status of the scheduled tour. 


The available next stages for the scheduled tour are


1. Reschedule - On the request of the parent or due to any particular reason, you can reschedule the tour.

2. Update Tour Status - Tour Completed or No Show

3.Add/Invite to Join Waitlist - Using this option, you can either add the parent directly to the waitlist or send an invite to them to join the waitlist. 

4.Send Enrollment Offer - You can use this option to directly send an enrollment offer to the parent.

5. Move to Decline repository - you can decline the tour request and subsequently move the request to the 'Decline Repository'.


Rescheduling the request 


Update Tour Status




Add/Invite to Join Waitlist

articles.title: Batch Functions - CRM
articles.description:
Batch Functions are helpful in sending 'Invite to schedule tour', 'Invite to join waitlist', and 'Send email to parents' to multiple parents at a time. This will help you to respond to multiple inquiries and invites in a batch and saves you a lot of time in processing inquiries and invites one by one. 


Access Path : Center Dashboard > CRM > Batch Functions


The Batch Functions option will be available under all the tabs present in the CRM dashboard. 


Inquiry Tab :


Invite to Schedule Tour


Under the Inquiry tab, on the 'Batch Functions,' you will find the 'Invite to Schedule Tour' option to send tour invite to multiple parents in a batch.


Invite to Join Waitlist :


You can send waitlist invites to multiple parents as a batch using the 'Invite to Join waitlist' option under the 'Batch Functions'. 

 



Send Email to Parents


If you wish to respond to the received inquiries and registered invites with a message without any scheduled tour requests or waitlist invites, you can do that by using the 'Send Email to Parents' option.



After selecting the parents from the available inquiries, compose the email Subject, Message, and attach relevant documents (if any).

articles.title: CRM - Sibling Info
articles.description:
While adding a new inquiry to your center via CRM, you now have the capability to obtain the sibling information of the child making the inquiry.


Enable - Sibling Info Collection:


1. Go to your company dashboard

2. Select the CRM module

3. Select the menu button from the right top corner. 



4. Choose the 'Setup' option.


5. On the inquiry tab, choose the 'Yes' option on the 'Sibling Info'.



Sibling Info - Center Level:


Once enabled, parents and directors have the ability to see the sibling information section on the inquiry form. They can add multiple sibling records in the sibling info section.



If a child is added to the CRM and has a sibling record, it will be indicated by a special icon denoting the presence of a sibling record. This icon will be displayed next to the name of the child on the inquiry page, making it easy to identify children with sibling connections.

articles.title: CRM- Inquiry Parent Flow
articles.description:
After receiving the Inquiry URL from the center, click on the URL to fill out the parent & child details to submit the inquiry.


If the company-level inquiry URL is shared with you, you'll be able to select your desired center from the available center list. 



If the shared inquiry URL is from a particular center, you'll not able to pick or switch centers.
articles.description_text: After receiving the Inquiry URL from the center, click on the URL to fill out the parent & child details to submit the inquiry.     If the company-level inquiry URL is shared with you, you'll be able to select your desired center from the available center list.           If the shared inquiry URL is from a particular center, you'll not able to pick or switch centers.

articles.title: CRM - Tour Parent Flow
articles.description:
After receiving the Tour Schedule URL, click on the URL to fill out the parent & child details, and pick your desired tour schedule from the available sch


If the company-level Tour Schedule URL is shared with you, you'll be able to select your desired center among the available center list. 


If the shared Tour Schedule URL is from a particular center, you'll not able to pick or switch centers.

articles.title: CRM - Waitlist Flow
articles.description:
After you receive the waitlist flow URL from the center, click the URL to fill out the parent and child details to join the center's waitlist. 


If the waitlist flow is from a company with multiple locations, you'll be able to choose your desired location from the centers' list.


If the waitlist flow is from a center with a single location, you will not be able to pick and choose the center location. you can only submit the waitlist form for that location.




If the company/center has any waitlist fee, you need to pay that waitlist fee before submitting the form.

If the waitlist flow is from a center with a single location, you will not be able to pick and choose the center location. you can only submit the waitlist form for that location.                If the company/center has any waitlist fee, you need to pay that waitlist fee before submitting the form.

articles.title: Enrolled Tab
articles.description:
1Core's center dashboard includes 8 tabs under the program enrollment section, each of which represents an important parameter for your center's performance. These tabs are as follows:


1. Capacity 2. Enrolled 3. Enrolled FTE 4. Occupancy Ratio 5. New Applications 6. Newly Enrolled 7. Incoming 8. To be withdrawn.



Enrolled Tab: 


The Enrolled tab in the center dashboard displays the current number of children who are actively enrolled in your center. It provides a count of the children who are currently attending and receiving services at your center.

 


Upon clicking the 'Enrolled tab', you will be directed to the 'Program Enrollment - Total Enrollment as on Today' page. This page provides comprehensive information regarding your center's program enrollment status. 


To view the 'Capacity', 'Count', 'Space Available', 'FTE', and 'Occupancy Ratio' for any age group, classroom, or program, utilize the group by option. This option allows you to organize and display the desired information based on your chosen grouping criteria.

articles.title: 1Core - FBA Product Updates February 2024
articles.description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. New Feature: Re-Enrollment Campaign
    • 1.1 Create a Re-Enrollment Campaign
    • 1.2 Parent Response
      • 1.2.1   I’m Interested
      • 1.2.2  Not Interested
    • 1.3 Re-Enrollment Campaign Dashboard
      • 1.3.1 Interested
      • 1.3.2 Not Interested
      • 1.3.3 No Action
  • 2. New Feature: Child and Staff Attendance Summary Report 
  • 3. Enhancement: Staff Scheduling
    • 3.1 Staff Schedule
      • 3.1.1 Copy Schedule
      • 3.1.2 Add multiple Breaks and Special Assignments
    • 3.2 Setups
      • 3.2.1 Mandatory Setups
      • 3.2.2 Staff Qualification
    • 3.3 Dashboard 
      • 3.3.1   Weekly View
      • 3.3.2   Child Head Count 
      • 3.3.3   Staff Head Count
      • 3.3.4   Daily View
    • 3.4 View “All” Classroom 
    • 3.5 View ‘Actual Schedule’
  • 4. Enhancement: View all Funding Account Information
  • 5. Enhancement: Child Profile Updates
  • 6.Enhancement:  Rollcall Sheet Report 
  • 7. Enhancement: CRM – Send Enrollment Offer
  • 8. Enhancement: Change Request - Send Enrollment Offer







1. New Feature: Re-Enrollment Campaign

 

Re-enrollment is a challenge for the childcare centers. 1Core Solution has introduced a new feature called 'Re-enrollment', to simplify the process.

This feature helps the center to build relationships with existing families and makes it easier for the director to know parents' decisions regarding the re-enrolling of their child in the center.

1.1 Create a Re-Enrollment Campaign

 

The re-enrollment campaign offers to send an invitation to the parent and get the confirmation of their interest to re-enroll at the center. 

Follow the steps below, to create a new re-enrollment campaign.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > CRM




Step 1: Fill in the necessary details which are mandatory for creating a new campaign.



  • By Program 

The ‘By Program’ option allows parents to select a preferred program based on the child’s age group at the time of re-enrollment. Through this option, the center receives the parent's confirmation for the re-enrollment invitation, along with their preferred program.

 

For instance, if the child is an ‘Infant Toddler’ in the upcoming age group and if the parent selects ‘I’m Interested’ option, they will be redirected to view the list of programs suitable for infant toddlers. 

 

  • By Program Schedule Days

The ‘By Program Schedule Days’ option allows parents to select their preferred schedule days. Through this option, the center receives the parent's confirmation for the re-enrollment invitation, along with their preferred days.



Step 2: Select the children to whose parents you want to send the re-enrollment campaign invitation. 

 

Use the filter icon to sort the children based on their age group.



Upcoming Age Group: The upcoming age group depends on the child’s age at the time of re-enrollment.

 

For example, there are two age groups: Infant (1-12 months) and Toddler (13-36 months).

If a child is an infant in the current year and becomes 16 months old during the re-enrollment process, they will be moved into the toddler age group. 


Note: The Child's upcoming age group will be automatically displayed based on the child's age at the time of re-enrollment or you may select the age group from the 'Select Age Group' drop-down list.


 

Step 3: A template with a default email message is displayed to send the re-enrollment campaign invitation to the parent.

 

Step 4: Confirm and send it to the parents.



 

1.2 Parent Response

 

Parents will receive an email invitation. In response to this email, parents can confirm their availability and re-enroll their child in the center.



1.2.1   I’m Interested


If the parent is interested in re-enrolling their child in the center, they can select the ‘I’m Interested’ option.



On selecting the 'I'm Interested' option, they will be redirected to the page displayed below.


  • By Program - Re-enrollment invite

 

This page will list the specific program based on the child’s upcoming age group. Parents can select the desired program for their child, to re-enroll in the center.



  • By Program Schedule Days - Re-enrollment invite

 

In this page, parents can select the preferred days in the re-enrollment period.




Once the parent submits the re-enrollment form, a notification email will be sent to the Director and the parent. 

The Registration fees and charges will be posted to the Parent ledger, if they had made the payment.


Note: If the parent already has a funding account, they can use the same to pay the registration fee. Else they will be redirected to create a funding account.


1.2.2  Not Interested


If the parent is not interested in re-enrollment, they can select the 'Not interested' option.

On selecting the 'Not Interested' option, they will be redirected to the page displayed below and they can enter the reason for not re-enrolling in the center.



Once the parent submits the response, both director and parent will receive an E-mail notification.


1.3 Re-Enrollment Campaign Dashboard

 

1.3.1 Interested


When parents accept the invitation, the child will come under the ‘Interested’ category and the Director can send the enrollment offer.



1.3.2 Not Interested

 

If parents select 'Not Interested', the child is categorized as 'Not Interested' and the director can update the withdrawal date for the child, which will be displayed in the child's profile.





1.3.3 No Action

 

If the center does not get any response for the re-enrollment invitation from parents, they will be categorized under 'No Action'. The director may send reminders to those parents as a follow up.




2. New Feature: Child and Staff Attendance Summary Report 

 

The main objective of this report is to provide the total number of staff and the total number of children signed in the center for the day. This will help to view the details of staff and child attendance at the center, at an instance.


Access Path: Company Dashboard > Reports > Child and Staff Attendance Summary Report






You can view the timecard entries for both staff and children, as well as where they logged in, using the time clock and classroom movement.




3. Enhancement: Staff Scheduling


1Core has added new enhancements to manage better staffing. In the Staff Scheduling Dashboard, the user interface has been improved, allowing easy access for weekly and daily summaries directly from the landing page.

There are now six mandatory setups instead of the five optional ones. This update makes it possible to collect information of staff qualifications, can copy schedules, and add multiple breaks and special assignments.



Note: All the 'Mandatory Setups' need to be completed to access the Staff Scheduling Dashboard.
         
            If the setups are incomplete, then you will be landed to the 'Mandatory Setups' page.


3.1 Staff Schedule

 

3.1.1 Copy Schedule

 

To improve the useability, we are introducing a ‘Copy Schedule’ option in the following sections of ‘Add / Edit Schedule’ page.

  • Work Schedule Section
  • Break
  • Special Assignment 

 

Using this option, after entering the schedule entry for the 1st row, the Director can copy the data for the remaining days also.



3.1.2 Add multiple Breaks and Special Assignments

 

Earlier we do not have an option to add multiple breaks / special assignments for a Staff. 

Now, a feature has been introduced to setup a multiple breaks and multiple special assignments for a single day as shown in the below screenshot.




3.2 Setups

 

3.2.1 Mandatory Setups

 

Earlier, Staff Scheduling setup had an individual access links for Age Group, Classroom, Staff Assignment Order, and Classroom Consolidate Rule are shown in the below page. 

Access Path: Center Dashboard > Setup



Now, all these individual links are combined into a single option called ‘Setup’. 

By clicking on the ‘Setup’ under Staff Scheduling will redirect you to the mandatory setup page, it allows you to access all the setup pages related to Staff Scheduling.

 


This Mandatory Setup page allows you to access all the setups related to ‘Staff Scheduling’. 

  • If the setup is incomplete, you will see a ‘Setup Now’ option. Clicking the ‘Setup Now’ option will redirect to the respective page for setup. 
  • For the Staff Schedule setup, clicking 'View' will redirect you to the page displaying the start date, planned schedule, and actions. In the 'Action' section, selecting 'view' will redirects you to each individual Staff Schedule page.
  • For the Child Schedule setup, clicking ‘View’ will redirect you to the page displaying the start date, planned schedule, and actions. In the 'Action' section, selecting 'view' will redirects you to each individual Program & Billing page.
Access Path: Center Dashboard > Staffing > Staff Scheduling




3.2.2 Staff Qualification

 

A new field has been introduced in the mandatory setup called ‘Staff Qualification’. This enhancement will be helpful to assign the right staff, based on their qualifications.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Staffing > Staff Scheduling> Setup






3.3 Dashboard 

 

The Staff Scheduling Dashboard has been enhanced to view all the below details in a single page.

  1. Can view the count and details of Child, Staff, and Classroom for the selected period.
  2. Planned and Actual schedule Summary.
  3. Hours Summary breakup for Regular Hours, Floater Hours , Admin Hours, Over Staffed & Under Staffed. 
  4. Option to access ‘All’ or specific classroom’s Planned and Actual daily classroom view.
  5. Graphical representation for both Staff and Child’s Planned vs Actual head counts.


“Planned hours” represent the allocated work hours for the staff based on their schedules.

“Actual hours” represent the hours that a staff member worked for the day, i.e., the hours during which the staff checked in for the classroom.

 

Access Path: Center Dashboard > Staffing > Staff Scheduling



3.3.1   Weekly View


The weekly view helps to view the classroom planning summary for the selected week period.




3.3.2   Child Head Count 

 

You can view the Child Planned Vs Child Actual head count for the week in a graphical format.



3.3.3   Staff Head Count

 

You can view the Staff Planned Vs Staff Actual head counts for the week in a graphical format.



3.3.4   Daily View

 

Click on the 'Daily' to view the planned and actual hours of staff, classroom ratio, and staff type for that specific day. 



3.4 View “All” Classroom 

 

Now, “ALL” classroom option has been introduced to view the Planned and Actual schedules of all the classrooms in a single page.  


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Staffing > Staff Scheduling > Weekly View > Click 'View' for the day




The below path provides the access to 'all' classroom view as well,

Access Path: Daily View > Classroom View > Classrooms > All



Click on the Classroom name, to access the classroom schedule of an individual classroom.




3.5 View ‘Actual Schedule’

 

1Core gives the provision to view the actual schedule of the center. 

 

The actual hours are determining based on the classroom movement data. 

 

The Staff Scheduling dashboard provides a summary of actual hours on a weekly/daily basis for the selected period.

 

The actual schedule gives detailed information for all or individual classroom.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Staffing > Staff Scheduling





4. Enhancement: View all Funding Account Information

 

Now the director has the provision to view all the active funding accounts of the parent.

Access Path: Center Dashboard > Families > Family Profile




5. Enhancement: Child Profile Updates

 

Now, the child's information is split into two parts: ‘Profile’ and ‘Enrollment’. The profile has the basic information, and the Enrollment section has the enrollment details of a child. This feature helps you to view the enrollment start date, the withdrawn date and reason. 


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Children




6.Enhancement:  Rollcall Sheet Report 

 

An option is included to add additional rows at the bottom of each section of the report.

This will help you to enter the details of other children.

Access Path: Center Dashboard > Reports > Rollcall Sheet





7. Enhancement: CRM – Send Enrollment Offer

 

Earlier, the director had two steps to send an enrollment offer in the CRM. First, they had to create a new inquiry, and then send the enrollment offer. 

 

Now 1Core has provided a new option. In the CRM landing page, there is a 'Send Enrollment Offer’ option. By choosing this, the director can send enrollment offer to an existing family / new family, without creating new Inquiries.


Access Path: Company Dashboard > CRM




8. Enhancement: Change Request - Send Enrollment Offer

 

Now, the director can send the enrollment offer for existing children through the Change Request tab.


Access Path: Center Dashboard > Program Enrollment

articles.title: Create your SuperSub account as a Substitute
articles.description:
1. Log In to the Mobile App

  • Download and open the 1Core SuperSub mobile app on your device

  • Enter your email and password

  • Tap "Sign In" to access your dashboard

2. Set Your Availability

  • On the left-side bar menu, tap “My Availability.”

  • Choose the days you want to receive job alerts (e.g., Monday–Friday)

  • Select your availability type:

    • Full Day

    • Half Day (AM or PM)

  • Click on “OK” to save and update your schedule

3. View Job Requests

  • Go to the Home screen and browse the “Open Jobs”

  • Review Open job listings and accept the jobs you can work.

  • Each listing shows:

    • Center Name

    • Time

    • Date

    • Position Needed

    • Age Group

    • Shit

4. Accept a Job

  • Tap a job to view full details

  • Review the job posting carefully

  • If it suits your schedule, tap “Accept”

  • Confirmation appears once the job is successfully accepted

5. Self Check-In Using QR Code

  • Upon arrival at the center, go to the front desk

  • The provider will display a QR code

  • Open the app and tap “QR Check-In.”

  • Scan the QR code to log your attendance

  • Repeat the process at the end of the shift to check out

6. Review Past Jobs (Optional)

  • Tap the “Home Tab” and navigate to your Job History by selecting a job status. 

  • Move from one screen to the next and see the jobs you’ve accepted, completed, or canceled.

  • Helps track your hours, paid jobs, and past assignments.

articles.title: Substitutes Scan QR Code at the Center
articles.description:
The Center Admin will...

1. Receive the QR Code Email

  • Center Admin receives an automated email from 1Core SuperSub

  • The subject line includes the center name and mentions the QR code attachment

2. Open the Email

  • Check your inbox (or spam folder if not found)

  • Open the email titled something like:
    “[Center Name] - QR Code for Substitute Check-In/Out”

3. Download the QR Code

  • Inside the email, look for the QR Code image or PDF attachment

  • Tap “Download” or “Open Attachment.”

  • Save the file to your device (desktop or phone)

4. Print the QR Code

  • Open the downloaded file (image or PDF)

  • Print it

    • Make sure the QR Code is visible and not pixelated

5. Display the QR Code at the Center

  • Place the printed QR code at the front desk or check-in station

  • Ensure it is easy for substitutes to access upon arrival and departure

6. Substitutes Scan to Check In and Out

  • Substitutes will use their mobile app to:

    • Tap “QR Check-In”

    • Scan the displayed code when they arrive

    • Repeat when they leave

articles.title: Substitute's Time Log Card
articles.description:
1. Open the 1Core Connect App

  • Substitutes launch the 1Core SuperSub mobile app

  • Log in using email and password, if not already signed in

2. Tap on “Time Log”

  • On the bottom menu, tap “Time Log.”

  • This section displays all active job assignments with time tracking.

3. View Time Log Entries

  • Check-In and Check-Out Times

  • Breaks

  • Entries are grouped by day for easy review

4. Tap into a Shift for Details

  • Tap any job to view the detailed time card

  • You’ll see:

    • Sign-in and Sign-out times

    • Whether you used the QR code for log-in/out

    • The job status (e.g., Completed, Cancelled)

5. Use for Attendance or Payroll Tracking

  • Time Log acts as your digital time card

  • Use it to:

    • Track how many hours you’ve worked

    • Review past assignments for record-keeping or payroll

articles.title: Substitutes My Calendar Tab - Mark As Available/Unavailable
articles.description:
1. Open the 1Core SuperSub Mobile App

  • Launch the app and log in with your email and password

  • Once logged in, you’ll land on the home screen

2. Navigate to “My Calendar”

  • Tap the calendar icon or find “My Calendar” in the left-side menu

  • This section shows your monthly view with color-coded availability

3. View Availability Status

  • Each day will show one of the following statuses:

    • Green = Available

    • Red = Unavailable

    • Gray = No status set (My Schedule is toggled off for that day)

4. Mark Yourself as Available

  • Tap on a date you want to update

  • Select “Available”

  • Choose your availability type:

    • Full Day

    • Half Day (AM/PM)

  • Tap “Save”

5. Mark Yourself as Unavailable

  • Tap on a specific date

  • Select “Unavailable”

  • Confirm the update

  • The date will change to red to reflect your status

6. Update Multiple Dates (Optional)

  • Repeat the process for each day you want to mark

  • Helps ensure you only receive job offers for the days you’re truly free

  • Only receive job requests on days/times you're marked as available

View Availability Status    Each day will show one of the following statuses:    Green = Available    Red = Unavailable    Gray = No status set (My Schedule is toggled off for that day)       4. Mark Yourself as Available    Tap on a date you want to update    Select “Available”    Choose your availability type:    Full Day    Half Day (AM/PM)      Tap “Save”     5. Mark Yourself as Unavailable    Tap on a specific date    Select “Unavailable”    Confirm the update    The date will change to red to reflect your status     6. Update Multiple Dates (Optional)    Repeat the process for each day you want to mark    Helps ensure you only receive job offers for the days you’re truly free    Only receive job requests on days/times you're marked as available

articles.title: Near Matching - Confirmation Update (Center's Side)
articles.description:
1. Log into the 1Core SuperSub Web Platform

  • Use your Region Admin credentials

  • Once logged in, you'll land on the dashboard/home screen

2. Navigate to the “Jobs” Section

  • In the left-side menu, click “Home”.

  • Fill out the form to post a job.

  • If the system finds a substitute who's available to work one hour earlier or later than the time you posted the job for, it will show you a pop-up message asking you if you want to modify your schedule.

3. Confirm or Decline the Match

  • You can select Earlier or Keep Current to finish the action.

  • The system will finalize the assignment and notify the substitute

  • If the match isn’t suitable, click “Decline” or leave unconfirmed

articles.title: Manage Availability from My Calendar Tab
articles.description:
1. Managing Availability with “My Calendar” (Substitute View)


  1. From your phone, Open My Calendar Tab

    • Go to the My Calendar section in the 1Core SuperSub app.

    • Select any future date (Note: today or past dates with accepted jobs cannot be selected).

  2. Select a Date

    • Click on an available date.

    • A pop-up appears with the option: "Mark Not Available."

  3. Mark as Unavailable

    • Tap "Mark Not Available" to block that day.

    • A confirmation message will appear.

  4. Unavailable Dates

    • The marked date will turn red.

    • You will not receive job notifications for that day.

  5. Change Back to Available

    • Click the red (unavailable) date.

    • Press "Mark Available" to make yourself available again.

  6. Resume Notifications

    • Once marked available again, you’ll receive alerts for:

      • Open jobs already posted

      • New job postings for that day


Manage Availability from My Calendar Tab Video Format:

articles.title: Step 1 - Create a Region by State Lead Hub
articles.description:
Create a Region (State Lead Hub Guide)

1. Login to the Platform

Go to your state website's link

Click on the "Username" field and enter your credentials

Fill in your Password

Click "Sign In" to access the dashboard

2. Add a New Region

Click "Add Region"

Enter the region name:

  • Example: SDA 6 - 4C for Children

3. Select Counties for the Region

Search and add multiple counties:

  • Example: Select Butler, Clermont, Hamilton

  • Use short search terms like bu, cl, and ham to filter

Remove existing counties (if needed):

  • Click "× Butler County" to deselect


4. Assign Region Admin

Click "Enter first name" and fill:

  • First Name: SDA

  • Last Name (if needed): SDA 6

Designate the user as Region Admin

Enter:

  • Email

  • Phone Number

5. Finalize

Click "Submit"

Click "OK" to confirm setup

articles.title: Step 3 - Region Admin Setup by State Lead Hub - Part 1
articles.description:
Region Admin Setup (State Lead Hub – Part 1)

1. Login & Access the Platform

Go to your state's website link 

Click "Username" and enter your login credentials

Fill in your Password

Click "Sign In"

2. Add a New Region

Click "Add Region"

Enter Region Name:

  • Example: SDA 1 - YWCA of Northwest Ohio

Select respectives counties

3. Assign a Region Admin

Click "Enter first name" and email address

Add Title or Notes: Region admin

Click "Submit" to save the changes

4. Add Age Groups

Go to "Age Groups"

Enter:

  • Age Group Name

  • Age Range

Click "Add" and then "×" to save and exit

5. Add Substitute Positions

Click "Add Position"

Enter:

  • Position Name

  • Qualification

  • Pay Rate

Click "Add" → Then "OK"

6. Add Shifts

Go to "Shifts"

Click "Add Shift"

Fill in (e.g.):

  • Shift Type: Full Day

  • Duration: 9 hours

  • Start Time: e.g., 07:00 AM

  • End Time: e.g., 04:00 PM (based on duration)

  • Token Count: 1

Click "Add" → Then "OK"

Repeat to add more shifts if needed


Region Admin Setup by State Lead Hub - Part 1:

articles.title: Step 4 - Region Admin Setup by State Lead - Hub Part 2
articles.description:
Region Admin Setup (State Lead Hub – Part 2)

1. Upload Key Documents

Go to your state's website link

Click "Documents"

Navigate to the "Companies" tab


To create new fields for additional documents:

For Companies:

Click "Enter document name"

Type: Additional Insured Documents

Click "Add" → Then "OK"


For Substitutes:

Go to "Substitutes" section

Click "Enter document name"

Type: Signed Substitute Handbook

Click "Add" → Then "OK"

Click "Add Document"

Click "Document Name" and input:

  • Signed Substitute Contract

Click "Add" → Then "OK"

2. Configure Business Rules

Expand the menu by clicking on the three lines.

Go to "Business Rules"


Set Training Hours:

Click on the "hours" field

Input number of hours

Repeat if needed for additional settings


Configure Cancellation Window:

Click on the setting labeled:

  • "How many hours before the job start time can the substitute cancel?"

Change unit to "minutes"

Input number of minutes

3. Save and Finalize

Click "Submit"

Confirm by clicking "OK"

4. Final Review

Navigate to "Settings" to adjust or review configurations if necessary

articles.title: Step 5 - Rating Centers & Substitutes by State Lead Hub
articles.description:
Rating Centers & Substitutes by State Lead Hub


1. Log in to the State Lead Hub

  • Go to your platform access URL

  • Enter your credentials to access the platform dashboard

2. Navigate to the Ratings Section

  • On the left-side menu, click "Ratings"

3. View Center Ratings

  • Click on "Centers" within the Ratings section

  • This opens the list of centers with job and rating data

4. Expand Center Details

  • Click the view icon next to any center

  • This opens job-level detail:

    • Dates

    • Substitute assigned

    • Rating score

    • Optional comments (if provided)

5. Review Low Ratings

  • If a job rating is below 4 stars, the system will ask for a reason

  • Any reasons or comments left by the rater will appear in the Comments column

6. Click on Rating Stars

  • Clicking on the star rating opens a pop-up with:

    • Job details

    • Center rating summary

  • Use this to review and take any follow-up action

7. Go Back to the Main Ratings Menu

  • Click “Back” to return to the main Ratings view

8. View Substitute Ratings

  • On the left menu, still under “Ratings,” click "Substitutes."

9. Expand Substitute Details

  • Click the view icon next to any substitute

  • This opensthe  performance history and rating data for that individual

10. Review Substitute Rating

  • Click the stars in the Rating column

  • A pop-up will display job details and performance evaluation

  • Use this view to track feedback or address concerns


Rating by State Lead Hub Video Format:

https://app.guidde.com/share/playbooks/vzQj8CrwYNm6vY5fsPDtp2?origin=IwG9VFIx53c3zMGA6tmtKf93s2p1

articles.title: Step 1 - Onboard Substitutes by Region Admin
articles.description:
Onboarding Substitutes: Region Admin Workflow (Step-by-Step)

1. Sign In

Visit your state's website link.

Insert your "Username (email address)"

Click "Password", fill it in, and click "Sign In"

2. Add a New Substitute Application

Navigate to "Substitutes"

Click "Add Application"

Enter:

  • First Name

  • Last Name

  • Email

  • Mobile

  • Address

Click "Save"

3. Set Role & Preferences

Insert:

  • Position

  • Work Frequency

  • How Heard About Us

Click "Submit" → Click "OK"

4. Application Review & Notes

Navigate to:

  • Applications > Substitutes > Pending Approval/New

Click "Process"

Add notes:

  • Example: "I spoke with AnnMarie. She's comfortable working with Toddlers, Infants, and Pre-School."

5. Select Age Preferences

Choose applicable age groups:

  • Toddler

  • Pre-School

  • (Optional: Remove others like Infants, if not applicable)

6. Set Qualification & Position

Choose appropriate hourly rate tiers (e.g):

  • SuperSub 1 (CPL 1–2)

  • SuperSub 2 (CPL 3–6)

7. Upload Documentation

Click "Add New Documents"

Example of documents to upload:

  • High School Diploma/GED

  • OCCRRA Profile Training Summary

Confirm and close upload

8. Final Notes & Approval

Update and add any interview notes:

  • "Feb 2nd: We had a successful in-person interview."

  • "We're moving forward with onboarding."

Click "Approve", then "Yes" → "OK"

9. Final Navigation

Navigate through:

  • Substitutes > Requests > Activities

  • Review and manage remaining actions

  • Click "Back" to return to dashboard



Onboarding Substitutes by Region Admin Video Format:

https://app.guidde.com/share/playbooks/bYraaTd9rFTmWzdWRv8D2V?origin=IwG9VFIx53c3zMGA6tmtKf93s2p1

articles.title: Step 2- Onboard a Center by Region Admin Part 1
articles.description:
Onboarding Childcare Centers (Region Admin Guide – Part 1)

This walkthrough helps Region Admins onboard childcare centers into the 1Core SuperSub system.

1. Access and Password Setup

Go to your state's website link

Click "Sign In"

Enter your current password

If prompted, create a new password and confirm it

Submit changes to proceed

2. Sign In with Credentials

Click Username and enter your email address

Type in the password

Sign in to your account

3. Application Access

Go to Applications > Companies

Review:

  • Declined

  • Pending Approval

  • New

4. Add New Center

Click "Add Application"

Enter:

  • Company Name

  • Address

Click Save

5. Center Info & Contact Details

Select:

  • Number of Centers

  • Work Frequency

  • Referral Source

Enter Admin Details:

  • First Name

  • Last Name

  • Email

  • Phone

Submit the application → Click OK

6. Add Notes

Select the center you just added

Add a note:

  • Example: "I called the center but couldn’t speak with the director. I’ll follow up this afternoon."

  • Update later: "I was able to speak with them. Onboarding in process."

7. Upload Required Documents

Click "Add New Documents"

Example of documents to upload:

  • Contract

  • Center Handbook

  • Additional Insured Documents

Drag and drop or click to upload → Click Upload

8. Approve Center

Go back to Pending Approval

Select Company Information

Click Approve → Confirm with Yes → Acknowledge with OK

9. Final Review (Optional Cleanup & Edits)

Navigate back to Companies or other areas as needed

Add more documents if necessary

Update or finalize any missing details


Onboarding a Center by Region Admin Part 1 Video Format:

articles.title: Step 9 - Job Post History & Details Guide (Region Admin View)
articles.description:
Job Post History & Details Guide 

Explore job history, view job details, and navigate job-related actions on the 1Core SuperSub platform.

1. Sign In to Access the Dashboard

Go to your state's website link

Enter:

  • Username/Email

  • Password

Click "Sign In"

2. View Job Post History

Navigate through the dashboard to locate the Job Post History section

Use the calendar or filters:

  • Select month/year (e.g., Feb 2025, Mar 2025)

  • Choose a day (e.g., 10, 3, 1)

? 3. Access Job Details

Click through job entries to view specifics

To expand further details, click:

  • “Requested To” field or related pop-ups

  • Additional detail buttons or windows as shown

Use the × to close each window after viewing

? 4. Navigation Tips

Click here links (in context) to proceed through filtered data

Use arrows or selectors to scroll between months and job dates

Access additional panels to review assignments, substitute matches, or notes



Job Post History & Details Guide Video Format:
