articles.title: Step 8 - Near Matching Feature Setup (Region Admin View)
articles.description:
Near Matching Feature Setup

Enable and configure the Near Match feature in the 1Core SuperSub system to help fill job requests when no exact matches are found.

1. Sign In to the Platform

Go to your state's website link

Enter:

  • Username

  • Email

  • Password

Click "Sign In"

2. Access Business Rules

Navigate through the menu to find "Business Rules"

Click "Business Rules" to enter the configuration section

3. Enable Near Matching

Click on the "Near Match" option

In the settings panel, adjust the following:

  • Select Hours: Choose how many hours earlier/later a substitute can start

Type in:

  • Time (hours)

  • Number of hours

4. Save Your Settings

Click "Update" to apply the new Near Match rule

Click "OK" to confirm changes


Near Mat Feature Video Format:

https://app.guidde.com/share/playbooks/7hE1Fyvf42Hxxu3FoLAxQa?origin=IwG9VFIx53c3zMGA6tmtKf93s2p1

articles.title: Step 5 -Token Configuration by Region Admin
articles.description:
Token Configuration by Region Admin


1. Log in to the Admin Platform

  • Go to 1Core SuperSub login url

  • Use your admin credentials to sign in

2. Navigate to Setup

  • On the left-side menu, click “Setup”

  • This takes you to the region settings and token tools

3. Open Token Management

  • Under Setup, click on “Token Management.”

  • You’ll access the token configuration and transaction history

4. Add Token Bundle

  • Click the “Add Token Bundle” button

  • A new configuration window will pop up

5. Enter Token Count

  • Choose the token action:

    • Add Tokens (positive count)

    • Subtract Tokens (negative count)

6. Enter Amount

  • Type in the number of tokens to add or subtract

    • Example: 100

7. Select Currency

  • Choose “USD” from the currency dropdown

8. Save the Token Change

  • Click “Add” to confirm and apply the token change

  • The window will close automatically

9. Review Purchase History

  • Click on “Purchase History” to view past transactions

  • Helps track token use for transparency and budgeting

10. Adjust Record Display (Optional)

  • Use the dropdown (e.g., 10, 25, 50, 100) to control how many history entries are visible

  • Review detailed info for each record


Token Configuration by Region Admin Video Format:

https://app.guidde.com/share/playbooks/qfFEaocUj6DU5zSLRFx9FH?origin=IwG9VFIx53c3zMGA6tmtKf93s2p1

articles.title: Step 6 - Enable Purchase Payment & Token Configuration by Region Admin Part 1
articles.description:
Enable Purchase Payment & Token Configuration by Region Admin Part 1  


1. Log in to the Region Admin Dashboard

  • Go to your platform access URL

  • Enter your admin credentials to sign in

2. Navigate to Setup

  • On the left-hand side menu, click “Setup”

  • This opens the configuration tools for payment and tokens

3. Access Business Rules

  • Click “Business Rules.”

  • You’ll be taken to the payment setup area

4. Enable Payment Gateway

  • Under Payment Rules, toggle the option to “Yes” to allow payment tokenization

  • This activates the payment feature

5. Select Providers

  • Choose your desired payment providers from the list

6. Enter API Keys

  • Provide the required Publish Key and Secret Key from your provider

  • Click “Update” to save and enable the connection

7. Proceed to Token Management

  • Return to the left-hand menu and click “Token Management.”

8. Add Token Bundle

  • Click “Add Token Bundle” to begin token configuration

9. Enter Token Count

  • In the token entry field, enter the number of tokens to be added

10. Enter Amount

  • Define the corresponding amount associated with the token action

11. Set Currency

  • Select “USD” as your currency from the dropdown

12. Save Token Configuration

  • Click “Add” to finalize and save the token bundle

13. Edit Existing Bundles (Optional)

  • Click the blue pencil icon next to a token bundle to edit it

14. Toggle Token Status

  • Change the token bundle status to Active or Inactive as needed

15. Submit Updates

  • After making edits, click “Update” to save your changes


Enable Purchase Payment & Token Configuration by Region Admin Part 1 Video Format:

https://app.guidde.com/share/playbooks/aFMCc3GHxgUxqAh4XAQKa7?origin=IwG9VFIx53c3zMGA6tmtKf93s2p1

articles.title: Step 7 Enable Purchase Payment & Token Configuration by Region Admin Part 2
articles.description:
Enable Purchase Payment & Token Configuration by Region Admin Part 2


1. Go to the Token Configuration Page

  • Navigate to your platform access URL

  • Make sure you’re logged in as a Region Admin

2. Add a Token Bundle

  • Click the “Add Token Bundle” button to create a new bundle

3. Enter Token Details

  • In the form, fill in the following:

    • Token Count

    • Amount (e.g., 25)

    • Currency (set to USD)

4. Finalize Token Addition

  • Click “Add” to save the new token bundle

5. Edit Existing Bundles (Optional)

  • To make changes, click the pencil icon next to any token bundle

6. Update Token Status

  • Use the toggle to:

    • Set token bundles to “Inactive” (if not ready for use)

    • Or “Active” (to enable usage immediately)

7. Save Changes

  • After editing, click “Update” to confirm and save changes

8. Navigate to the Setup Section

  • Return to the Setup menu using the left navigation panel

9. Access Purchase History

  • Click “Purchase History” to review past token transactions

10. Filter by Date

  • Select a date range (e.g., May 2025) to filter the data

  • Review transaction logs to monitor token activity and confirm proper configuration


Enable Purchase Payment & Token Configuration by Region Admin Part 2

articles.title: Step 10 Dashboard Features - Region Admin
articles.description:
1. Log into the Region Admin Platform

  • Go to the 1core SuperSub platform.

  • Enter your Region Admin credentials

2. Access the Dashboard

  • Click the purple “View” icon on the right-hand side to open the Region Admin Dashboard.

3. View Region Overview

  • On the dashboard, you’ll see:

    • Number of active centers and substitutes

    • New applications from both subs and centers

    • A high-level summary of job activity

  • To expand unprocessed center applications, click the green arrow in the Centers sectio.n

4. Drill Into Active Centers

  • Hover over the “Total Active” section and click the green arrow

  • This will reveal more detailed data on each active center in your region

5. View Center Profile

  • Select a center and click the purple “Eye” icon to open its profile

6. Filter by Month

  • At the top of the profile page, select a month (e.g., “Jul 2025” or “Jun 2025”)

  • This filters the job data by that month

7. Explore Job Details

  • Click the green arrow icon to expand a specific job

  • Use the left panel to switch between job statuses:

    • Canceled

    • Completed

    • Others as available

8. Review Job-Level Information

  • Click the view icon next to a job to expand full job details

  • You’ll see:

    • Job ID

    • Date & Shift

    • Age Group

    • Job Status

    • Ratings

    • Substitutes assigned, notified, or who accepted

  • Click “×” to close the details window

9. Review Substitute Data

  • In the Substitute section, click the green arrow next to “Total Active.”

  • Then click the blue “View” icon to open the substitute profile

10. Filter Substitute Activity by Month

  • Use the dropdown to select “Last 30 Days” or a specific month like “Apr 2025.”

  • Review:

    • Jobs matched

    • Jobs accepted

    • Jobs completed

    • Job status breakdown for each role



Dashboard Features - Region Admin Video Format:

https://app.guidde.com/share/playbooks/9mCLQLg1tx25YfbvzawdvS?origin=IwG9VFIx53c3zMGA6tmtKf93s2p1

articles.title: Rating Reasons by Super Admin
articles.description:
Rating Reasons


1. Log in to the Super Admin Platform

  • Go to: https://app.1coresupersub.com

  • Enter your Super Admin credentials to sign in

2. Navigate to Setup

  • On the left-hand menu, click to open the Setup section

  • You’ll be directed to the settings dashboard

3. Access Rating Reasons

  • Within the Setup section, click “Rating Reasons.”

  • This opens the list of existing reasons used for post-shift feedback

4. View Existing Reasons

  • Each reason shown is part of the feedback flow between centers and substitutes

  • These reasons help understand performance impressions after a shift

5. Edit a Rating Reason

  • Click the blue pencil icon next to a reason to edit it

  • Make any necessary changes to the name or context

6. Change Status (Active/Inactive)

  • Use the toggle to mark a reason as either Active or Inactive

  • Inactive reasons will not appear in the live rating forms

7. Save or Exit

  • Click “Update” to save your changes

  • Or click the “X” at the top right to cancel/close the window without saving

8. Add a New Rating Reason

  • Click the “Add Reason” button in the top-right corner

9. Enter and Save the New Reason

  • Type the name of the new reason in the entry field

  • Click “Add” to save and activate the new feedback option


Rating Reasons by Super Admin Video Format

https://app.guidde.com/share/playbooks/bieaKEiZRrX1pAs6CMEKg8?origin=IwG9VFIx53c3zMGA6tmtKf93s2p1
